From Raagini.Rameshwar at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep  3 17:22:11 2014
From: Raagini.Rameshwar at students.olin.edu (Raagini Rameshwar)
Date: Wed, 3 Sep 2014 17:22:11 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] To all the French speakers out there!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587E7485D3@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Bonjour tout le monde!

Cette semestre nous voudrions commencer un table fran?ais, appel?e Amuse Bouche. Nous voudrions retrouver pour le dejeuner ou le diner une fois par semaine pour parler en fran?ais sur un vari?t? de sujets.

Si vous souhaitez vous joindre nous, r?pondrez-nous par e-mail ! Nous vous enverrons un e-mail avec un whenisgood.


Hello everyone!

This semester we would like to start a french table, called Amuse Bouche. We'd meet for lunch or dinner once a week to speak in French on a variety of topics.

If you're interested in joining us, send us an email ! We'll email you with a whenisgood.

Thanks !

Raagini, Evan, and James

From Christopher.Joyce at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep  3 18:33:18 2014
From: Christopher.Joyce at students.olin.edu (Christopher Joyce)
Date: Wed, 3 Sep 2014 18:33:18 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Want a docking station for an Olin laptop?
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587E7485EC@EXVS01.olin.edu>

I have one that I no longer need - still works perfectly, and should be compatible with 2015-2017 (and probably 2018) laptops.  It's one of the fancy models:  http://accessories.us.dell.com/sna/productdetail.aspx?c=us&l=en&s=dhs&cs=19&sku=430-3312

With standard peripherals, you can then just pop your laptop onto it, and work as if it's a desktop.  It makes CAD way more tolerable.

They sell for $220 new, and don't really break.  I'm asking $120 for it (OBO) - venmo, cash, check, whatever.

-Chris

Another year, another exclamation mark.

The Outing Club camping trip is taking place again this year, first weekend we're back (9/5/14-9/7/14).  You all know the drill, hopefully, but if not, feel free to email me with any questions you have.

a:link, span.MsoHyperlink
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:blue;
	text-decoration:underline;}
a:visited, span.MsoHyperlinkFollowed
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:purple;
	text-decoration:underline;}

	{mso-style-type:personal;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}

	{mso-style-type:personal-reply;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}

	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-size:10.0pt;}

	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}

	{page:WordSection1;}

From Bernard.Kahle at students.olin.edu  Thu Sep  4 13:20:37 2014
From: Bernard.Kahle at students.olin.edu (Bernard Kahle)
Date: Thu, 4 Sep 2014 13:20:37 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Ultimate Frisbee!
Message-ID: <E9E3FF7C-0AB8-41EF-9FBC-C9CF73F5C688@students.olin.edu>

Hey everyone,
Before we kick off practices for the year, we?re going to have a couple introductory scrimmages to meet people, learn some frisbee, have some fun, and most importantly just to play frisbee.

This afternoon, we?ll be throwing around the great lawn before dinner.

Friday at 5pm we?ll scrimmage down on the soccer fields!

Lets do it!

- Ben Kahle

From Kyle.McConnaughay at students.olin.edu  Thu Sep  4 13:35:49 2014
From: Kyle.McConnaughay at students.olin.edu (Kyle McConnaughay)
Date: Thu, 4 Sep 2014 13:35:49 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] PowerChStudents - Class of 2018
	<Students-Classof2018@olin.edu>ords!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587E74883B@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey everybody! Welcome (back) to Olin!

It's the beginning of the year and PowerChords, Olin's premier a cappella group, is auditioning for new members this Friday and Monday! We perform at Olin, with other a cappella groups, compete in ICCA (a la the movie Pitch Perfect)

For your audition, please be prepared to:

*         Sing one song of your choosing - show off what you can do!

*         Sing A Whole New World from Disney's Aladdin. Sheet music can be found in the dining hall.

*         Give us your completed information survey, which can also be found in the dining hall.

*         Have a ton of fun!

To show everyone what PowerChords is like, we will be performing tomorrow at 12:45 in the wooden waterfall. Come see us sing!

If you have any questions, feel free to email/talk to me (the Music Director), Ingrid Hagen-Keith (the President), Jenny Vaccaro (the Assistant Music Director), or any other member of PowerChords.

Hope to see you in auditions!

-Kyle

-------------- next part --------------

Sheet music can be found in the dining hall. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>&middot;<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]>Give us your completed information survey, which can also be found in the dining hall.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>&middot;<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]>Have a ton of fun!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>To show everyone what PowerChords is like, <b>we will be performing tomorrow at 12:45</b> in the wooden waterfall. Come see us sing!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>If you have any questions, feel free to email/talk to me (the Music Director), Ingrid Hagen-Keith (the President), Jenny Vaccaro (the Assistant Music Director), or any other member of PowerChords.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Hope to see you in auditions!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>-Kyle<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div></body></html>

Subject: [Carpediem] Dorm Hacking Contest!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587E748985@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey All-

Celeste (alum) wanted me to pass this along...

Instructables is holding a university-hacking contest:
http://www.instructables.com/contest/diyuniversity/
where you can show off your best college-related hacks.

If you have pictures of your loft or anything, definitely enter it!
Oliners definitely have some of the best hacks and you could win a laptop, speakers, a tablet, and other cool gizmos!

Also there # of entires has not even hit the triple digits so an Oliner could easily win.


Brian

From Mitchell.Cieminski at students.olin.edu  Thu Sep  4 18:55:47 2014
From: Mitchell.Cieminski at students.olin.edu (Mitchell Cieminski)
Date: Thu, 4 Sep 2014 18:55:47 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Thoughts about [Olin]?
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587E748A45@EXVS01.olin.edu>

tldr: Give me your complaints, your thoughts, your silly research about our favorite school. Also, you can use this google doc! https://docs.google.com/forms/d/170iu-WBuRUiCrEcy3xgXsxf9CsVdozpQwQXovfH5TZ8/viewform?usp=send_form 

Hey folks. I'm sending this out again to some more people this time, including alumni, faculty, and new students :)

As some of you may know, I am currently at Insper in S?o Paulo, Brazil, helping faculty there design a new engineering school. They are (I am) interested in all aspects of Olin, especially in your experiences, things you've noticed, conclusions, and notes about literally anything. From student life to student-faculty relations to courses to clubs, and everything in between. Let me give you some examples:

Did you ever take or give a new course? What did you think of it?
Do you think a course needs a serious revision? Why?
Have you noticed patterns of behavior of Olin students? Faculty members? Staff?
Did you ever write something to a friend or colleague about how weird Olin is? Share!
Have you ever had conversations with Olin students or community members about Olin? What did you conclude?
Have you ever sent a survey out to the school or some subset of it? You should send me the results!
Have you ever done a project or a model about something at Olin?
Do you have a reflection that you want to share with me?

Basically, I'm compiling a crazy corpus of data. Anything that gets sent directly to me will be given special attention. I'm theoretically going through all the emails I've ever gotten, but let's be honest, I have over 40407 emails in my archived inbox. To clarify: I REALLY DON'T CARE WHAT YOUR DATA POINT IS ABOUT -- good, bad, silly, potentially off-topic. I just want to get a better feel for Olin through the eyes of others.

You're the best! If you ever think of something throughout the semester, just shoot it my way and throw [olin] in the subject line. I'll probably send this email again in about a month to remind you! YOU CAN ALSO USE THIS GOOGLE DOC! https://docs.google.com/forms/d/170iu-WBuRUiCrEcy3xgXsxf9CsVdozpQwQXovfH5TZ8/viewform?usp=send_form 

One more thing: I may read some of the things you say aloud or email them to someone else. If you want some specific level of anonymity, tell me or fill out the Google Doc, which allows for totally anonymous responses, as well as a handy smattering of other privacy options. 

Obrigado e abra?os!
mitch

From Philicia.Chow at students.olin.edu  Thu Sep  4 20:33:23 2014
From: Philicia.Chow at students.olin.edu (Philicia Chow)
Date: Thu, 4 Sep 2014 20:33:23 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Babson Dance Ensemble Tryouts!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587E748A84@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi everyone!

BDE tryouts are next week! The flyer is attached.

General information session is on Monday at 5PM in the Sorenson Theatre (that's the theatre across from Reynolds Center at Babson).
Girls have two auditions: Tuesday 8:30PM and Wednesday 8PM. If you want to know how that works and what those auditions entail, let me know! They'll probably tell you about it during the general information session, too.
Boys have their auditions on Wednesday at 9PM.
All of these auditions are in the Sorenson Theatre.

Please join! BDE is a great group and an awesome chance to perform on stage. Feel free to ask me, Ndungu Muturi, Brian Liebson, and Marena Richardson about anything BDE related. :)

Love,
Philicia

From Brian.Liebson at students.olin.edu  Fri Sep  5 09:52:46 2014
From: Brian.Liebson at students.olin.edu (Brian Liebson)
Date: Fri, 5 Sep 2014 09:52:46 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Try my Friend's New App
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587E748C0E@EXVS01.olin.edu>

My friend at UPenn wanted me to throw this app out here.

It's called "Down to Chill" and it's on the app store, should also be on Android.

"Down to chill allows you to swipe through your facebook friends that have free time. Once matched, you can message each other through the app. End the mess of texting and Facebook messaging out of the blue. DTC turns your social network into your social life. Find your free friends, swipe down to chill."


I just downloaded it now so I don't really know what to expect.

If you have some free time and don't mind using another app for like a week to test it, please download it and let me know you are using it. I am giving him feedback on it over the next couple weeks so having a lot of user-based changes and suggestions would be awesome.

Note: You will not get compensated for your help.


Any questions, comments, concerns, let me know!

http://downtochill.com/


Best,
Brian
-------------- next part --------------

From Myles.Cooper at students.olin.edu  Fri Sep  5 10:34:20 2014
From: Myles.Cooper at students.olin.edu (Myles Cooper)
Date: Fri, 5 Sep 2014 10:34:20 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Off-campus lectures with Gui
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587E948014@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Sorry to those who already saw this.
TL;DR: Gui has offered to teach some impromptu classes off-campus this year (probably at Artisan's Asylum). Let me know what you want to learn so I can tell Gui and he can make lesson plans.

Full message:

Hey Carpe,
    As many of you know, Gui Cavalcanti (Olin class of '09) is a beast at just about all things robotics and many things beyond in the mechanical realm. He has offered to hold some off-campus (presumably at Artisan's Asylum) lectures on whatever we want throughout this upcoming school year if we can come together and decide on a couple topics for him to talk about. This is an amazing opportunity as Gui is a very accomplished mechanical engineer, entrepreneur (though he sometimes denies it), blues dancer, mad inventor, and overall person. If nothing else, simply hearing him talk about his life's adventures and outlooks would be a lecture worth attending. 

   FIRST YEARS, don't be shy. Many Oliners have already learned from Gui, so your input will probably be more interesting and original. Let me know what you want to learn and learning will happen!

   So, if you have something you would like to hear Gui talk about, please e-mail me and I will compile a list of popular results. Things he has taught before at Olin with high praise: Blues dancing, mechanical design, good Solidworks practice, pneumatics & hydraulics, financing a startup, and perhaps something else I'm forgetting.

Hope you all had wonderful summers!

-Myles

From Ela.Ben-Ur at olin.edu  Tue Sep  2 11:27:01 2014
From: Ela.Ben-Ur at olin.edu (Ela Ben-Ur)
Date: Tue, 2 Sep 2014 11:27:01 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Please vote and spread before Sept 6 - SXSW
Message-ID: <89847E3F-63A0-46E6-AAFF-81FD95C50571@olin.edu>

Hello and welcome back everyone!

I would deeply appreciate your help! Please vote before Sept 6, and share this widely, for the two sessions I passionately helped design for the SXSW Interactive conference (you don't have to be planning to attend SXSW to vote):

"The Empowering Experience Experiment (E3)" (http://panelpicker.sxsw.com/vote/33650)

"Design: part of problem, solution or distraction?" (http://panelpicker.sxsw.com/vote/39046)

Descriptions at each link, just click the "thumbs-up" in the upper left to vote - though it will ask you to (quickly) create an account to do so.

I've drawn a group of former senior IDEOers, and folks from DesignGym/FutureProject/Stanford d.School K12 Lab and Presencing Institute together; We created these SXSW entries to give ourselves a deadline and a larger experimental venue for our ideas.

Thank you SO much!
Ela




_______________
Ela Ben-Ur | Design

From Abigail.Rodrigues at students.olin.edu  Fri Sep  5 13:35:20 2014
From: Abigail.Rodrigues at students.olin.edu (Abigail Rodrigues)
Date: Fri, 5 Sep 2014 13:35:20 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Jobs/ Research Opportunities On-campus
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587E748D6F@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey everyone!

Welcome back to Olin, and for those of you first-years, welcome to college! If you're looking for on-campus job and research opportunities, we (SASE) have compiled information from students and professors to help with your search. We want to emphasize that the opportunities in the packet attached are not the only ones available, so make sure to ask your peers and faculty about other positions!

Yours truly, SASE

</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:14.5pt;color:black'>Hey everyone!<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:14.5pt;color:black'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:14.5pt;color:black'>Welcome back to Olin, and for those of you first-years, welcome to college! If you&#8217;re looking for on-campus job and research opportunities, we (SASE) have compiled information from students and professors to help with your search. We want to emphasize that the opportunities in the packet attached are not the only ones available, so make sure to ask your peers and faculty about other positions! </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br></span><span style='font-size:14.5pt;color:black'>Yours truly, SASE</span><o:p></o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Evan.Dorsky at students.olin.edu  Fri Sep  5 15:25:06 2014
From: Evan.Dorsky at students.olin.edu (Evan Dorsky)
Date: Fri, 5 Sep 2014 15:25:06 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Fire Arts Burn Tonight in Lot D!
Message-ID: <BD6BC7EC-23CD-4F41-8CBA-E038B23BB27E@students.olin.edu>

Hello!

OFAC (the Olin Fire Arts Club) will be holding their first burn (that?s a practice/performance with FIRE) TONIGHT AT 8:00 (iCal attached) in Lot D (the parking lot closest to the campus entrance), and everyone is invited to come watch! (Especially first years!)

There will be some OFAC members in WH2 around 8:00 to take you down to Lot D if you want to watch.

We?ll end right when chilling in 1N starts at 9:00, so you can go straight from the burn to 1N! And if you?re going on the camping trip, don?t worry! We?ll also have a burn next Friday.

Looking forward to seeing you there!

The fire lords,
Evan and Brooks

From Liani.Lye at students.olin.edu  Fri Sep  5 17:26:58 2014
From: Liani.Lye at students.olin.edu (Liani Lye)
Date: Fri, 5 Sep 2014 17:26:58 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Piloting Rethink Education, a new design event
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587E748ED4@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey there,



The Olin Foundry is excited to announce a new event called Rethink Education<http://rethink.olin.io/> for March 2015. This event is a design weekend meant to bring New England undergraduates together to gain experience with the user-oriented design process and collaborate to generate new ideas for improving the K-12 education system - the first time such an event has been hosted at Olin.


In the spirit of design thinking, the we are hosting an Olin-only "prototype" event on Saturday, September 13, 2014 from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.!  This "prototype" will be much smaller (~15-20 Oliners), but we're still aiming for a couple stakeholders to give input to teams. We're looking for a broad range of Oliners with varying levels of design experience to attend.


If you'd like to try your hand at design or are passionate about education, we'd love to see you.

Sign up at http://goo.gl/2OEhPn by Sunday midnight! (before Monday).

Want to chat?  Feel free to reach out to Madison May (email only), Celine Ta, or myself.

Liani on behalf of the Foundry

From James.Nee at students.olin.edu  Fri Sep  5 18:38:48 2014
From: James.Nee at students.olin.edu (James Nee)
Date: Fri, 5 Sep 2014 18:38:48 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Free and Not so Free Things
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587E748F11@EXVS01.olin.edu>

I have some items for sale, and some items that you may have for free!

For Sale:

Monitor - $30 O.B.O. Comes with DVI + VGA cables; 18" diagonal; looks like 4:3 aspect ratio

Computer Power Supply - $20 O.B.O. Antec 450W mint condition.

White T-shirts - Long story but I have a big box of brand new white t-shirts. Great for screen printing, lots of sizes. A suggested donation of $2 each.

For Free:

Everything in the laundry basket - including the basket.

EH2W.

James Nee

From Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu  Fri Sep  5 18:54:32 2014
From: Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu (Lyra Silverwolf)
Date: Fri, 5 Sep 2014 18:54:32 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Co-Curricular Registration Opened Today
Message-ID: <D2C8667C-DCEF-4375-A441-AC4DF27642C0@students.olin.edu>

Hey everyone,

In case you were like me and forgot about co-curricular registration, I just found out that it opened today at 12:45pm. Tonight would be a good time to read through the packet of options in the packet here<http://star.olin.edu/docs/Records/Courses_Sched/FA14_Co-Curricular_Descriptions.pdf> and sign up for your favorites on my.olin.edu<http://my.olin.edu>.

I would also like to make a shameless plug for the Olin Workshop on the Library offering. Jeff Goldenson, our new library director, is co-sponsoring it with Aaron Hoover, and the end goal is to examine how we use the library space and attempt to improve it. Plus, Jeff is a super cool person that you definitely want to meet. Read the description in the booklet, and don't hesitate to sign up if it sounds at all interesting to you.

Have a wonderful weekend,
Lyra
-------------- next part --------------

In-Reply-To: <BD6BC7EC-23CD-4F41-8CBA-E038B23BB27E@students.olin.edu>

This is happening in 30 minutes! And the weather is perfect!

On Sep 5, 2014, at 3:25 PM, Evan Dorsky <Evan.Dorsky at students.olin.edu<mailto:Evan.Dorsky at students.olin.edu>> wrote:

Hello!

OFAC (the Olin Fire Arts Club) will be holding their first burn (that?s a practice/performance with FIRE) TONIGHT AT 8:00 (iCal attached) in Lot D (the parking lot closest to the campus entrance), and everyone is invited to come watch! (Especially first years!)

There will be some OFAC members in WH2 around 8:00 to take you down to Lot D if you want to watch.

We?ll end right when chilling in 1N starts at 9:00, so you can go straight from the burn to 1N! And if you?re going on the camping trip, don?t worry! We?ll also have a burn next Friday.

Looking forward to seeing you there!

The fire lords,
Evan and Brooks

Subject: [Carpediem] Free 46" Flatscreen TV*
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587E748F7A@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Dakota and I are going on a dump run at 10 PM tonight. Any and all first-years are welcome to tag along. Apparently some other people went recently, so the pickings might be slim, but we aren't looking for anything ourselves - we just want to show you guys the route and the best spots to get stuff. Boots, backpack, flashlight and gloves recommended.

Convene in WH2L at 10PM. See you there/then,
-Logan and Dakota, Dakota and Logan

*if you can find it and carry it back

Boots, backpack, flashlight and gloves recommended. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Convene in WH2L at 10PM. See you there/then,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>-Logan and Dakota, Dakota and Logan<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><i>*if you can find it and carry it back<o:p></o:p></i></p></div></body></html>

Hi Everyone!!!

Tomorrow the residents of EH 3West and 4West will be grilling burgers, vegetable kebabs, and other assorted things at the grills between the dorms Sunday starting at 4PM and we'd love for you (especially first years!) to all join us for a grilled snack and Kan Jam, horseshoes, and MORE!!!

Food supplies are somewhat limited, so first come first serve! If you have food you'd like to grill, feel free to bring it out and cook it with us.

Sincerely,
Geek Row and The Kingdom of Helen

</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><div><div style='border:none;border-top:solid #B5C4DF 1.0pt;padding:3.0pt 0in 0in 0in'><p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>From:</span></b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'> Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] <b>On Behalf Of </b>Toni Saylor<br><b>Sent:</b> Saturday, September 06, 2014 7:33 PM<br><b>To:</b> carpediem at lists.olin.edu<br><b>Subject:</b> [Carpediem] Free Seat Cushion<o:p></o:p></span></p></div></div><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>White, Velcro&#8217;s to chair legs.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Has one small coffee stain and my name on the bottom. Moved to East Hall 3rd floor north wing north suite at 9:30 because they are still finishing into the Dalek!

From: TARDIS [mailto:tardis-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Alexander Crease
Sent: Saturday, September 06, 2014 6:14 PM
To: tardis at lists.olin.edu; carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [TARDIS] Doctor Who: Robots of Sherwood!

Hey everyone!!!

TARDIS will be watching Episode 3 of Series 8 of Doctor Who tonight in the East Hall 3 East Suite at 9PM!!! Please come by!!!
If you have not seen previous episodes of Series 8, we'll be officially kicking off the semester next weekend by watching the previous episodes.
Sorry for the discontinuity, but time is just a big ball of wibbly wobbly, timey wimey stuff. There's not much we can do to fix it.

[cid:image001.jpg at 01CFCA15.E138BE30]

-From your Lord President of the High Council of the Time Lords.

From Elizabeth.Doyle at students.olin.edu  Sat Sep  6 21:24:45 2014
From: Elizabeth.Doyle at students.olin.edu (Elizabeth Doyle)
Date: Sat, 6 Sep 2014 21:24:45 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Catholic Mass 4pm
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D067@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Mass is available on Babson's campus most Sundays during the school year. We would like to invite you to join us at Mass on Sunday's at 4pm in Glavin Chapel at Babson.

If you would like to walk over with other Oliners tomorrow (or in the future), please let Lindsey (cc'd) know and meet her in WH1 at 3:40 tomorrow.

Everyone of any or no faith is welcome!

If you think you might ever be interested in coming to Mass or other activities including bible study, faith group, inter-college worship nights, etc. please sign up for the BOCA mailing list (https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/boca)


We hope to see you there!

~Elizabeth

From Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep  7 12:10:29 2014
From: Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu (Gregory Edelston)
Date: Sun, 7 Sep 2014 12:10:29 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Rock out with ORO!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D118@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Friends! Now that we're comfortably into the new year, the time has come for you to audition for the Olin Rock Orchestra! For those who have literally never spoken to me, ORO is a four-year-old rock group that joins the beauty and sonority of an orchestra with the badassery and hell-yes of a rock band.

We're primarily looking for violin/viola and electric bass, but if you play something else that you think you can rock out on, we'd still love to hear you*! Who knows? We may stumble upon something wonderful and badass.

If you're interested in playing music with us, please email me ASAP! I'd love it if we can get all auditions squared away within the next week and a half. I'll send you a bit of our music, and I'd like to hear you on some music of your choosing as well. Super-casual.

Also, if you emailed me at the end of last semester and we didn't find time for an audition, please still email me.

Hells yeah,
Greg

*Except for keyboard, guitar, and drums. We have those covered, and we don't need more of them.
-------------- next part --------------

/* Font Definitions */

	{font-family:"Cambria Math";

@font-face
	{font-family:Calibri;
	panose-1:2 15 5 2 2 2 4 3 2 4;}
/* Style Definitions */
p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:11.0pt;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
a:link, span.MsoHyperlink
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:blue;
	text-decoration:underline;}
a:visited, span.MsoHyperlinkFollowed
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:purple;
	text-decoration:underline;}
span.EmailStyle17
	{mso-style-type:personal-compose;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}
--></style><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
<o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1026" />
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
<o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
<o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1" />
</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal>Friends! Now that we&#8217;re comfortably into the new year, the time has come for you to audition for the Olin Rock Orchestra! For those who have literally never spoken to me, ORO is a four-year-old rock group that joins the beauty and sonority of an orchestra with the badassery and hell-yes of a rock band.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>We&#8217;re primarily looking for violin/viola and electric bass, but if you play something else that you think you can rock out on, we&#8217;d still love to hear you*! Who knows? We may stumble upon something wonderful and badass.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>If you&#8217;re interested in playing music with us, <b>please email me ASAP!</b> I&#8217;d love it if we can get all auditions squared away within the next week and a half. I&#8217;ll send you a bit of our music, and I&#8217;d like to hear you on some music of your choosing as well. Super-casual. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Also, if you emailed me at the end of last semester and we didn&#8217;t find time for an audition, <b>please still email me.</b><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Hells yeah,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Greg <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>*Except for keyboard, guitar, and drums. We have those covered, and we don&#8217;t need more of them.<o:p></o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep  7 12:37:15 2014
From: Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu (Gregory Edelston)
Date: Sun, 7 Sep 2014 12:37:15 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Do funny stuff!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D129@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Yes, it's true! Olin Performance Improv und Magicke will be starting back up, starting this week, and we want YOU to join us! No experience required whatsoever.

For the next few weeks we'll be holding open drop-in workshops that anyone can join on Tuesdays at 10PM in the auditorium. (This week, that will be immediately after your R2 floor talk.) After a few weeks of workshops, we're going to hold auditions for a performing troupe.

For those unaware, improv comedy is a theatrical art in which everything is made up on the spot. You may have seen it on Whose Line Is It Anyway<http://whoselineonline.org/>, or at Second City<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LMQphIhBBbg>, or maybe you've even been to ASSSSCAT 3000<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P4HTxmqNTCY>.

If you'd like to create wonderful art, this is the opportunity for you!
If you'd like to watch but not participate, this is the opportunity for you!
If you'd like to hang out with me, this is the opportunity for you!
Bottom line: This is the opportunity for you!

Adoringly yours,
Greg, on behalf of Bill and Greg
-------------- next part --------------

From Kai.Austin at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep  7 14:25:30 2014
From: Kai.Austin at students.olin.edu (Kai Austin)
Date: Sun, 7 Sep 2014 14:25:30 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Do funny stuff!
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D129@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D129@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D1C0@EXVS01.olin.edu>

** General disclaimer/clarification for those I have talked to/are now confused:
This is not Olimprov. Email for that is coming soon. :P

Olimprov is open house improv, jump in and join or just sit back and watch, specializing in short form games (and the occasional miming). OPIUM is a performance troop, specializing in long form improv (think "mini-improv plays") and you will have shows. You should definitely try both out because they are both awesome. :D


From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Gregory Edelston
Sent: Sunday, September 07, 2014 12:37 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Do funny stuff!

Yes, it's true! Olin Performance Improv und Magicke will be starting back up, starting this week, and we want YOU to join us! No experience required whatsoever.

For the next few weeks we'll be holding open drop-in workshops that anyone can join on Tuesdays at 10PM in the auditorium. (This week, that will be immediately after your R2 floor talk.) After a few weeks of workshops, we're going to hold auditions for a performing troupe.

For those unaware, improv comedy is a theatrical art in which everything is made up on the spot. You may have seen it on Whose Line Is It Anyway<http://whoselineonline.org/>, or at Second City<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LMQphIhBBbg>, or maybe you've even been to ASSSSCAT 3000<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P4HTxmqNTCY>.

If you'd like to create wonderful art, this is the opportunity for you!
If you'd like to watch but not participate, this is the opportunity for you!
If you'd like to hang out with me, this is the opportunity for you!
Bottom line: This is the opportunity for you!

Adoringly yours,
Greg, on behalf of Bill and Greg

Here is the Sunday lineup: http://fall.bostoncalling.com/m

For those who were too cheap to buy tickets, like me.

Gaby

From Lindsey.Vanderlyn at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep  7 15:13:24 2014
From: Lindsey.Vanderlyn at students.olin.edu (Lindsey Vanderlyn)
Date: Sun, 7 Sep 2014 15:13:24 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Babson Martial Arts
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D20E@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey Carpe,

If you were ever interested in doing martial arts or want to continue your martial arts education Babson has classes for both Karate and Jujitsu on both Mondays and Wednesdays.

Jujitsu is a Japanese martial art focused on redirecting your opponent's energy (i.e. throws) and happens from 6:30 to 8pm
Karate is a Japanese martial art focused on strikes happens at 8pm to 9pm

The Sensei are super accommodating of people of all skill levels so don't worry if you've never done any martial arts before, or you have had several years under your belt. You are welcome to try as many classes as you want, there is no obligation to commit.

If you want to walk over together we're meeting at the wooden waterfall on Monday at 6:15pm. If you're coming from a class I would suggest you grab a boxed lunch from the cafeteria and put it in your fridge. Wear loose fitting exercise clothes.

If you want to get there by yourself, Jujitsu is on the 2nd floor dance studio in the Babson Gym and Karate is in the squash courts next to the weight lifting room.

Best,
Lindsey

-------------- next part --------------

Hi Everyone!!!

Tomorrow the residents of EH 3West and 4West will be grilling burgers, vegetable kebabs, and other assorted things at the grills between the dorms Sunday starting at 4PM and we?d love for you (especially first years!) to all join us for a grilled snack and Kan Jam, horseshoes, and MORE!!!

Food supplies are somewhat limited, so first come first serve! If you have food you?d like to grill, feel free to bring it out and cook it with us.

From Mika.Ichiki-Welches at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep  7 17:16:10 2014
From: Mika.Ichiki-Welches at students.olin.edu (Mika Ichiki-Welches)
Date: Sun, 7 Sep 2014 17:16:10 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] RUGBY
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D274@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey guys!

As the Olin representative of Babson Women's Rugby and somebody who intensely loves the sport, I am encouraging anybody who has even the slightest interest or curiosity to COME CHECK OUT OUR WONDERFUL RUGBY TEAM :)

We are always extremely excited to take in new rookies, and NO EXPERIENCE IS REQUIRED. I didn't even know what rugby was when I joined.

We'll have a table set up for Friday's Club Fair, so you should absolutely come talk to us then or find/email me and ask me any questions you may have!

[cid:image002.png at 01CFCABF.4E218E60]

Mika

<v:formulas>
<v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0" />
<v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0" />
<v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1" />
<v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2" />
<v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth" />
<v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight" />
<v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1" />
<v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2" />
<v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth" />
<v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0" />
<v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight" />
<v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0" />
</v:formulas>
<v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect" />
<o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t" />
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="Heart_x0020_1" o:spid="_x0000_s1026" type="#_x0000_t75" style='position:absolute;margin-left:-1.5pt;margin-top:2.25pt;width:21pt;height:17.25pt;z-index:251659264;visibility:visible;mso-width-percent:0;mso-height-percent:0;mso-wrap-distance-left:9pt;mso-wrap-distance-top:0;mso-wrap-distance-right:9pt;mso-wrap-distance-bottom:0;mso-position-horizontal:absolute;mso-position-horizontal-relative:text;mso-position-vertical:absolute;mso-position-vertical-relative:text;mso-width-percent:0;mso-height-percent:0;mso-width-relative:margin;mso-height-relative:margin'>

From Casey.Alvarado at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep  7 17:24:47 2014
From: Casey.Alvarado at students.olin.edu (Casey Alvarado)
Date: Sun, 7 Sep 2014 17:24:47 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Xanadu Auditions!!!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D279@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello friends,

FWOP will be preforming Xanadu, the musical, in November! Do you like 80's roller discos, dazzling romance, and stunning dance numbers? If you said yes to all of those things, come to auditions!

Auditions will be held on September 13th and 14th in the Crescent Room in the Campus Center at 1pm!

September 13th: Singing and Acting auditions.
Acting-wise, be prepared to read a scene. No preparation necessary.
Singing wise, please bring TWO 30 second songs prepared to sing a Capella. The first can be any song that displays your vocal range.  The second song should be from the show.

September 14th: Dancing Auditions.
Choreography will be taught, and then you will perform the choreography.


Everyone must attend both auditions. However if you feel like you only want to dance, please email us.

 Click here to view the complete Broadway show for inspiration!<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c_-mYomx1nw>
Show dates will be on November 13th, 14th, and 15th!

Everyone with a musical theatre interest is encouraged to audition! Even if you have minimal experience, don't worry about it, please still come! Bring your friends!

If you cannot attend both or either of the audition dates and you would still like to audition, please let us know!

Thank you,
Casey & Hannah

[cid:image003.jpg at 01CFCAC0.9F8E52F0]

From William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep  7 18:00:54 2014
From: William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu (William Saulnier)
Date: Sun, 7 Sep 2014 18:00:54 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] (no subject)
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587EB3E5E6@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello Summoners!

Do you play League of Legends? Do you follow the LCS and the esports scene? Hate Teemo? Love Teemo? Do you find yourself often times looking for a duo queue partner, or a fives team, or just someone to talk meta with?

Well, you've found your answer to all of lifes problems and more in LoLin! 

We hold in house tournaments, viewing parties, and much much more throughout the year. We also have a skype chat where we hang out and talk about league too.

While I'm fighting off hordes on minions in Japan, Tom "Aerimorla" Chen and Jazmin "FearBsquick" Gonzales-Rivero will be leading the helm, organizing viewing parties for Worlds, making fun get togethers to play some ARAMs, and generally doing club president style things.

Interested? Join our mailing list right here, right now: https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/lolin, or add me in game and I'll hook you up with the deets.

See you on the rift!

-William "Lego6245" Saulnier

I?ve set up a scavenger hunt highlighting some cool/useful places at Olin. There?s candy at the end! It starts in the O-level entrance of the CC. It took me about 30 minutes to set it up, going from end to start, to give you a rough estimate of how long it takes.

Feel free to email me if you get stuck at any point and I?ll try to give more useful hints.

From Alex.Spies at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep  7 18:47:32 2014
From: Alex.Spies at students.olin.edu (Alex Spies)
Date: Sun, 7 Sep 2014 18:47:32 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Ceramic Studio Use
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D2B5@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi,
I would like to let everybody know about the opportunities at the Babson Ceramic Studio this semester. There are currently 3 potential options, Independent Studio Use and 2 beginner courses. The studio opens to users Monday 9/15 and the studio fee is $85, but Olin will reimburse $30 of this studio fee. The studio fee pays for supplies and firings for the semester. The links for registration are below. Please let me know if you have any questions.

Intro to Clay<https://www.eventbrite.com/e/introduction-to-clay-registration-12874984425>                                                                       Thursdays 4:00-6:00 PM

Foundations of Wheel Throwing<http://www.eventbrite.com/e/foundations-of-wheel-throwing-registration-12876200061>                               Mondays 5:00-7:00 PM

Independent Studio Use<https://www.eventbrite.com/e/independent-studio-use-registration-12875963353>                                              7 days a week 9:00 AM-9:00 PM



-          Alex Spies

	mso-style-link:"Plain Text";
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}

	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}

</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal>Hi,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>I would like to let everybody know about the opportunities at the Babson Ceramic Studio this semester. There are currently 3 potential options, Independent Studio Use and 2 beginner courses. The studio opens to users Monday 9/15 and the studio fee is $85, but Olin will reimburse $30 of this studio fee. The studio fee pays for supplies and firings for the semester. The links for registration are below. Please let me know if you have any questions. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/introduction-to-clay-registration-12874984425">Intro to Clay</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Thursdays 4:00-6:00 PM<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/e/foundations-of-wheel-throwing-registration-12876200061">Foundations of Wheel Throwing</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; From Brian.Liebson at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep  7 19:36:21 2014
From: Brian.Liebson at students.olin.edu (Brian Liebson)
Date: Sun, 7 Sep 2014 19:36:21 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Volleyball!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587E903F36@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Volleyball!

I'm so happy that so many of you have been coming to find me and express your interest in joining the Olin Volleyball Team!

We are holding off on practice for another week or so, but stay pumped and excited!

We are holding practice twice a week at the Babson Gym:
WEDNESDAYS 7:30PM - 9:30PM
and either SATURDAY 3:30PM-5:30PM or SUNDAY 7:30PM - 9:30PM

If you feel strongly for Saturday or for Sunday, let me know. We need to decide that soon.

Whether you want to compete with the Olin team in the Boston Sports League or the Babson Intramural Tournament or even just learn how to serve a ball, you are all welcome.
We have members ranging from never-touched-a-volleyball to nationally ranked state champions (actually).


If you would like to play more volleyball than just twice a week, let me know. Babson also has a co-ed volleyball team that we will scrimmage against every once in a while, but we are more than welcome to go to their practices (and them, ours).

If you have any interest at all, AT ALL, please come find our table at the club fair! 
Questions, comments, concerns? Don't hesitate to contact me!



Y'all best start peppering


Best,
Brian Liebson, Captain







PS In regards to my all-students email earlier, #sorrynotsorry

From Brandon.Chiou at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep  7 23:20:24 2014
From: Brandon.Chiou at students.olin.edu (Brandon Chiou)
Date: Sun, 7 Sep 2014 23:20:24 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Free ~10 Gallon Aquarium
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D443@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Handmade, and without the ugly metal frame supports in normal aquariums. A little dirty but it can be cleaned. Silicone has some mold growth but it too can be replaced. Original purpose was aquascaping. Glass is perfectly cut.

From Celine.Ta at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep  8 11:38:30 2014
From: Celine.Ta at students.olin.edu (Celine Ta)
Date: Mon, 8 Sep 2014 11:38:30 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Piloting Rethink Education, a new design event
In-Reply-To: <CAFeF5zx=R4ZxORv-B2sbrKt0vGjSK3=38nZSvVykYXx4nh8QDw@mail.gmail.com>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587E748ED4@EXVS01.olin.edu>
	<CAFeF5zx=R4ZxORv-B2sbrKt0vGjSK3=38nZSvVykYXx4nh8QDw@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D5BB@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello Carpe!
This is a reminder that Rethink Education<http://rethink.olin.io/> is happening this coming Saturday! This is the first time this type of event is being held at Olin, and we?d love to hear your feedback about the event and how it can be even better. (In fact, your feedback is pretty crucial right now.)
For anyone interested in education, contextualizing your own education, user-centered design, and/or making the world a better place, this is the opportunity to have some great discussions and taking the first steps to creating something valuable. No previous experience with design or educating necessary. Again, we?re running this ?pilot?/ prototype event THIS SATURDAY, from 10 AM to 4 PM. We?re extending the deadline to sign up until tomorrow (Tuesday) night, so sign up here: http://goo.gl/2OEhPn.
Feel free to send any questions, comments, and concerns to me, Liani, or Madison (CC?ed) or send them to olin.rethink at gmail.com<mailto:olin.rethink at gmail.com>.
Thanks!
Celine on behalf of the Foundry
---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: Liani Lye <Liani.Lye at students.olin.edu<mailto:Liani.Lye at students.olin.edu>>
Date: Fri, Sep 5, 2014 at 5:26 PM
Subject: [Carpediem] Piloting Rethink Education, a new design event
To: "carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>" <carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>>


Hey there,



The Olin Foundry is excited to announce a new event called Rethink Education<http://rethink.olin.io/> for March 2015. This event is a design weekend meant to bring New England undergraduates together to gain experience with the user-oriented design process and collaborate to generate new ideas for improving the K-12 education system ? the first time such an event has been hosted at Olin.


In the spirit of design thinking, the we are hosting an Olin-only ?prototype? event on Saturday, September 13, 2014 from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.!  This ?prototype? will be much smaller (~15-20 Oliners), but we?re still aiming for a couple stakeholders to give input to teams. We?re looking for a broad range of Oliners with varying levels of design experience to attend.


If you?d like to try your hand at design or are passionate about education, we?d love to see you.

Sign up at http://goo.gl/2OEhPn by Sunday midnight! (before Monday).

Want to chat?  Feel free to reach out to Madison May (email only), Celine Ta, or myself.

Liani on behalf of the Foundry

_______________________________________________
Carpediem mailing list
Carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:Carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/carpediem

From Sharon.Breitbart at olin.edu  Mon Sep  8 12:31:53 2014
From: Sharon.Breitbart at olin.edu (Sharon Breitbart)
Date: Mon, 8 Sep 2014 12:31:53 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Photographer needed
Message-ID: <74EC63270F70E84EBE31C4588324B4760119A63BF3A9@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Ashesi University College, in Ghana, is in the process of developing an engineering program.  They will be holding a meeting of their Ashesi Engineering Advisors team on Olin's campus this Friday and Saturday, September 12 & 13, and would like to have some photos and video taken of their meeting.  They need someone for a few hours on Friday and a few hours on Saturday to take some photos and some video.  They can provide a camera, or you can use your own.  They can pay cash.

Please let me know if you are interested.

Thanks!
Sharon

Sharon Breitbart | Director of Collaboratory Administration
Olin College of Engineering
Tel: 781-292-2526 | URL: collaboratory.olin.edu<http://collaboratory.olin.edu/>
Leading the Revolution in Engineering Education

/* Style Definitions */

	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;

	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:blue;
	text-decoration:underline;}

	{mso-style-priority:99;

	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}

	{mso-style-type:personal-compose;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#0070C0;}

	{mso-style-name:"Balloon Text Char";

From William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep  8 12:47:44 2014
From: William.Saulnier at students.olin.edu (William Saulnier)
Date: Mon, 8 Sep 2014 12:47:44 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Resume Building Website
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587EB3E5E7@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi friends. Found this super duper nifty website that helps you build a really sharp resume, and allows you to host it on the web (perfect for those portfolio websites) or print it as a PDF, Docx, and more. You can even import your information from LinkedIn or Facebook if you've already got a head start.

Here is the URL for the main site: http://creddle.io

And here is my Resume as an example: https://resume.creddle.io/resume/61vy03ze1qt

Have fun makin those resumes!

-W

From: Music [mailto:music-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Michael Resnick
Sent: Friday, August 15, 2014 1:44 AM
To: music at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Music] Reign of Kindo in Cambridge, $10 (mid-October)

If you don't know them, they're a great band with some really intelligent music (see Play with Fire). A good place to start though is probably Rhythm, Chord, and Melody. $10 is dead cheap for them and they're at a tiny venue (max. 200), so I really don't understand how it's even possible, but it's happening.

Anyone wanna come with me? I just bought a ticket for myself.

Buy a ticket here:
http://www.ticketweb.com/t3/sale/SaleEventDetail?dispatch=loadSelectionData&eventId=5180785&REFERRAL_ID=tmfeedbuyat73074&wt.mc_id=aff_BUYAT_73074&camefrom=CFC_BUYAT_73074

From Kevin.OToole at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep  8 16:32:05 2014
From: Kevin.OToole at students.olin.edu (Kevin O'Toole)
Date: Mon, 8 Sep 2014 16:32:05 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Tonight at 7: Let's talk about Midnight Math
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D72D@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Midnight Math is a club at Olin that involves meeting at midnight, eating cheese and crackers, and listening to someone talk about a cool facet of mathematics.

Want to discuss this? Suggest topics? Amend our charter? Prove the Banach-Tarski paradox is equivalent to the axiom of choice?

All but the last one will be happening in the WH4 lounge at 7:00 tonight.

iCal attached.

Subject: [Carpediem] Tonight at 7: Let's talk about Midnight Math
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D72D@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Now with corrected iCal.

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Kevin O'Toole
Sent: Monday, September 08, 2014 4:32 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu; MidnightMath at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Tonight at 7: Let's talk about Midnight Math

Midnight Math is a club at Olin that involves meeting at midnight, eating cheese and crackers, and listening to someone talk about a cool facet of mathematics.

Want to discuss this? Suggest topics? Amend our charter? Prove the Banach-Tarski paradox is equivalent to the axiom of choice?

All but the last one will be happening in the WH4 lounge at 7:00 tonight.

iCal attached.

-------------- next part --------------

From Mitchell.Cieminski at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep  8 17:33:44 2014
From: Mitchell.Cieminski at students.olin.edu (Mitchell Cieminski)
Date: Mon, 8 Sep 2014 17:33:44 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Resume Building Website
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587EB3E5E7@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587EB3E5E7@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D770@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Also if you have an up-to-date LinkedIn profile, they have a pretty decent automagic Resume builder. Definitely good for getting a starting point on a resume, in any case. http://resume.linkedinlabs.com/ 

-----Original Message-----
From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of William Saulnier
Sent: segunda-feira, 8 de setembro de 2014 13:48
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Resume Building Website

Hi friends. Found this super duper nifty website that helps you build a really sharp resume, and allows you to host it on the web (perfect for those portfolio websites) or print it as a PDF, Docx, and more. You can even import your information from LinkedIn or Facebook if you've already got a head start.

Here is the URL for the main site: http://creddle.io

And here is my Resume as an example: https://resume.creddle.io/resume/61vy03ze1qt

Have fun makin those resumes!

-W

Carpediem at lists.olin.edu

From Logan.Davis at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep  8 18:02:16 2014
From: Logan.Davis at students.olin.edu (Logan Davis)
Date: Mon, 8 Sep 2014 18:02:16 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Orphan Black, WH3L, 8PM
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D78F@EXVS01.olin.edu>

tl;dr Come watch the first two episodes of awesome new sci-fi thriller/comedy Orphan Black in WH3L at 8 PM. Free popcorn.

Over the summer, a high school friend I used to bond over nerdy TV shows with recommended that I check out Orphan Black. So I did. Turns out it's super fukken awesome, so now I want to share it with Olin. If you've ever wanted to be that person who constantly crows about jumping on board with an awesome TV show before it was cool, now's your chance!

Orphan Black is a Canadian sci-fi thriller/ comedy that just finished its second season. You may have heard of it as "that show where the one chick plays like six different characters, sometimes all in the same scene". It's characterized by its frenetic pace, dark humor, and general batshit bonkersness. It is rated TV-MA for language, occasional drug use, and frequent butts.

If this image<https://s.yimg.com/os/publish-images/tv/2014-05-15/6f5e03c0-dc7a-11e3-be0e-7bffb4ed2011_orphan-black-hair-makeup.jpg> intrigues you, come watch Orphan Black. If that image didn't intrigue you, still come watch Orphan Black, because I want to hang out with you. Especially first-years. It'll be great.

See you there,
-Logan

Subject: [Carpediem] HB-SERV Pizza Party TONIGHT
Message-ID: <CAHT-TTDQaENMzZyfhK5-0uUHKUQnh2dS5DH1h1uv-QrCeXFGDA@mail.gmail.com>

*TL;DR: *HB-SERV Pizza Party for those who are interested in running for
general member positions, today at 10pm in WH1. Come eat pizza and mingle
with us!



---



Honor Board and SERV would like to invite you to our *PIZZA PARTY** TODAY**,
September 8th at 10pm in WH1.*



What will we be doing?

1)      Eating pizza

*2)      **Talking about the elections for Honor Board and SERV*

3)      Ideating for service activity ideas

4)      Conversing about the Honor Code

5)      Making friends with first years! (Unless you are a first year in
which case make friends with upperclassmen!)



Come get a late night snack and let us recruit you to make Olin a better
place!

Email Victoria @ victoria.preston at students.olin.edu or Ari @
ariana.chae at students.olin.edu with questions.



<3,

SERV

	{font-family:Calibri;
	panose-1:2 15 5 2 2 2 4 3 2 4;}
/* Style Definitions */
p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:11.0pt;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
a:link, span.MsoHyperlink
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:blue;
	text-decoration:underline;}
a:visited, span.MsoHyperlinkFollowed
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:purple;
	text-decoration:underline;}
span.EmailStyle17
	{mso-style-type:personal-compose;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}

From Charles.mouton at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep  8 20:17:42 2014
From: Charles.mouton at students.olin.edu (Charlie Mouton - Olin)
Date: Mon, 8 Sep 2014 20:17:42 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem]  Babson LGBTQ Welcome Reception Tuesday Afternoon
Message-ID: <CAGYkcitj6WrPAkY3ZS92v-eviMTnvSbhYvZYZ=Z5-YhHOLL0RQ@mail.gmail.com>

Hey everyone,


I wanted to get the word out about Babson's LGBTQ Welcome Reception
tomorrow from 4pm-5:30pm. The event is open to all LGBT and allies and
takes place in Glavin Chapel at Babson. I will be waiting in WH1 at 4
so that we can walk over as a group in case you don't know how to get
to Glavin Chapel.

As president of OPEN this year, I would really appreciate any Oliners
who would like to help demonstrate the LGBTQ community that we have on
both of these campuses and help us foster a lasting friendship between
OPEN and PRIDE Alliance. If you plan on making it, let me know and I
will be sure to not walk over without you.


Thanks a ton!

Charlie Mouton '17

P.S. If you are interested to learn more about OPEN, you can find me
tomorrow or on Friday at club fair. Thanks again.

From Kevin.OToole at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep  8 20:25:46 2014
From: Kevin.OToole at students.olin.edu (Kevin O'Toole)
Date: Mon, 8 Sep 2014 20:25:46 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Midnight Math Lectures
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D86D@EXVS01.olin.edu>

It's that time of year again: Time to plan out lectures for Midnight Math. As usual, we're keeping track of everything in a google doc:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0Aoa6u9d6x-dFdGtJTjJJT2NjVURXN1VyNjZrdGZ3T1E&usp=drive_web#gid=1

If you have a bit of math that you want to talk about for 20 minutes to an hour, add it to the list with your name, and we'll be in contact at some point.
If you have a bit of math that you want to hear about for 20 minutes to an hour, add it to the bottom of the list without your name so we know in general what people are interested in.

Discretely,
The Midnight Mathematicians

Subject: [Carpediem] choclate mint plants

Hello!
I have a chocolate mint plant and I think it's been trying really hard to creep out of its container. I have some clippings that I think can be transplanted to grow new plants. Would you like one? Shoot me a message if you're interested! It'd be easiest for me if you could bring a container with soil at some point in time (there's tons of soil in parcel b....)
I'm not 100% they'll all survive but according to the internet it's a thing.
Lemme know,
Kari

It&#8217;d be easiest for me if you could bring a container with soil at some point in time (there&#8217;s tons of soil in parcel b&#8230;.)<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>I&#8217;m not 100% they&#8217;ll all survive but according to the internet it&#8217;s a thing.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Lemme know,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Kari<o:p></o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Erika.Weiler at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep  8 21:39:16 2014
From: Erika.Weiler at students.olin.edu (Erika Weiler)
Date: Mon, 8 Sep 2014 21:39:16 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] TAEKWONDO Wednesday at 7pm!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D919@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey everyone!
Taekwondo Club is starting up again this year!
Our first practice will be Wednesday @7pm on the Great Lawn.
This is open to all levels and throughout the year we will do both sparring and forms.
Email me if you have questions and hope to see you there!
-Erika

From Jamie.Gorson at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep  9 12:33:58 2014
From: Jamie.Gorson at students.olin.edu (Jamie Gorson)
Date: Tue, 9 Sep 2014 12:33:58 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] JOO Club's Bagel Brunch
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35DBB4@EXVS01.olin.edu>

[cid:image001.jpg at 01CFCC18.D4E8C620]JOO Club Bagel Brunch!
Saturday @ 10AM
Picnic Tables Between the Dorms

Join us for JOO (Jewish Organization @ Olin) Club's first event of the year! We will have lots to eat, fun lawn games, a chance to talk about what you want to see JOO club do this semester and the opportunity to learn about and sign up for Birthright! We will also have a guest from CJP (Combined Jewish Philanthropies of Boston) who is a great resource for anything and everything Jewish in the Boston community and of course Elaun Rave, a Birthright tour guide from Israel. iCal attached.

Jamie Gorson | Class of 2016
Leading the Revolution in Engineering Education
[cid:image002.png at 01CFCC18.D4E8C620]

	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:8.0pt;
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
span.EmailStyle17
	{mso-style-type:personal-compose;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
span.BalloonTextChar
	{mso-style-name:"Balloon Text Char";
	mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text";
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}
--></style><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

We will have lots to eat, fun <b>lawn games</b>, a chance to talk about what you want to see JOO club do this semester and the opportunity to learn about and sign up for <b>Birthright</b>! We will also have a guest from CJP (Combined Jewish Philanthropies of Boston) who is a great resource for anything and everything Jewish in the Boston community and of course Elaun Rave, a Birthright tour guide from Israel. iCal attached.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:#1F497D'>Jamie Gorson | </span></b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:#1F497D'>Class of 2016<b> </b></span><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:#1F497D'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p><p class=MsoNormal><i><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:#0066FF'>Leading the Revolution in Engineering Education<o:p></o:p></span></i></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'><img width=208 height=40 id="Picture_x0020_1" src="cid:image002.png at 01CFCC18.D4E8C620" alt="Olin_Identifier_Gradient_Standard_Blue_RGB">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style='color:#1F497D'><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep  9 16:01:37 2014
From: Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu (Lyra Silverwolf)
Date: Tue, 9 Sep 2014 16:01:37 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Free (Mostly) Broken Extension Cord!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587EC4D7F4@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello all,

The library has a 50 foot extension cord with a short in one end. It was previously a circulating tool that could be checked out, but now it is useless to us. As far as I can tell, the short is near the receiving plug end and it may be able to be repaired.

Originally it was part of this two-pack<http://www.amazon.com/Pack-Extension-Indoor-Outdoor-Heavy/dp/B00DJ6G0U6/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=undefined&sr=8-1&keywords=50ft+extension+cord+2+pack>. Would anyone like to take it off of our hands?

Thanks,
Lyra

From Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep  9 19:00:00 2014
From: Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu (Gregory Edelston)
Date: Tue, 9 Sep 2014 19:00:00 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Do funny stuff!
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D129@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D129@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35DE0E@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Reminder: This is tonight at 10PM in the auditorium! Improvvvvvvvv

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Gregory Edelston
Sent: Sunday, September 07, 2014 12:37 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Do funny stuff!

Yes, it's true! Olin Performance Improv und Magicke will be starting back up, starting this week, and we want YOU to join us! No experience required whatsoever.

For the next few weeks we'll be holding open drop-in workshops that anyone can join on Tuesdays at 10PM in the auditorium. (This week, that will be immediately after your R2 floor talk.) After a few weeks of workshops, we're going to hold auditions for a performing troupe.

For those unaware, improv comedy is a theatrical art in which everything is made up on the spot. You may have seen it on Whose Line Is It Anyway<http://whoselineonline.org/>, or at Second City<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LMQphIhBBbg>, or maybe you've even been to ASSSSCAT 3000<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P4HTxmqNTCY>.

If you'd like to create wonderful art, this is the opportunity for you!
If you'd like to watch but not participate, this is the opportunity for you!
If you'd like to hang out with me, this is the opportunity for you!
Bottom line: This is the opportunity for you!

Adoringly yours,
Greg, on behalf of Bill and Greg
-------------- next part --------------

</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='color:#1F497D'>Reminder:</span></b><span style='color:#1F497D'> This is tonight at 10PM in the auditorium! Improvvvvvvvv<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><div><div style='border:none;border-top:solid #B5C4DF 1.0pt;padding:3.0pt 0in 0in 0in'><p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>From:</span></b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'> Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] <b>On Behalf Of </b>Gregory Edelston<br><b>Sent:</b> Sunday, September 07, 2014 12:37 PM<br><b>To:</b> carpediem at lists.olin.edu<br><b>Subject:</b> [Carpediem] Do funny stuff!<o:p></o:p></span></p></div></div><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Yes, it&#8217;s true! Olin Performance Improv und Magicke will be starting back up, starting <b>this week</b>, and we want YOU to join us! No experience required whatsoever.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>For the next few weeks we&#8217;ll be holding <b>open drop-in workshops</b> that anyone can join on <b>Tuesdays at 10PM </b>in the<b> auditorium</b>. (This week, that will be immediately after your R2 floor talk.) After a few weeks of workshops, we&#8217;re going to hold auditions for a performing troupe.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>For those unaware, improv comedy is a theatrical art in which everything is made up on the spot. You may have seen it on <a href="http://whoselineonline.org/">Whose Line Is It Anyway</a>, or at <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LMQphIhBBbg">Second City</a>, or maybe you&#8217;ve even been to <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P4HTxmqNTCY">ASSSSCAT 3000</a>. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>If you&#8217;d like to create wonderful art, this is the opportunity for you!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>If you&#8217;d like to watch but not participate, this is the opportunity for you!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>If you&#8217;d like to hang out with me, this is the opportunity for you!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Bottom line: This is the opportunity for you!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Adoringly yours,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Greg, on behalf of Bill and Greg<o:p></o:p></p></div></body></html>

On Sep 9, 2014, at 4:01 PM, "Lyra Silverwolf" <Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu<mailto:Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu>> wrote:

Hello all,

The library has a 50 foot extension cord with a short in one end. It was previously a circulating tool that could be checked out, but now it is useless to us. As far as I can tell, the short is near the receiving plug end and it may be able to be repaired.

Originally it was part of this two-pack<http://www.amazon.com/Pack-Extension-Indoor-Outdoor-Heavy/dp/B00DJ6G0U6/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=undefined&sr=8-1&keywords=50ft+extension+cord+2+pack>. Would anyone like to take it off of our hands?

Thanks,
Lyra

Subject: [Carpediem] HELP CLEAR OUT LOFT STORAGE
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35DF51@EXVS01.olin.edu>

If you have a loft that is not being used, if you are using a loft but not your Olin bedframe, if you're not doing anything important, COME TO WH4 TO HELP CLEAN OUT LOFT STORAGE.

Wood needs to be taken down to the loop between the dorms and Olin bedframes need to be moved in.
There are unclaimed loft parts that have names on them:
Sophia UW, W Tn '16, Asa, and Jamie Gorson are names that I remember. PLEASE COME GET YOUR STUFF AND HELP US MOVE STUFF.

Thanks everyone!

From Shane.Skikne at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep  9 22:24:13 2014
From: Shane.Skikne at students.olin.edu (Shane Skikne)
Date: Tue, 9 Sep 2014 22:24:13 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Want to learn to Scuba Dive?
Message-ID: <52B1BCA5-2689-4A42-9D89-A73FA8796310@students.olin.edu>

Hey everyone!
Have you ever wanted to be a Mermaid? 
Have you ever wanted to float through the coral and hang out with crabs (the animal)?
Have you ever wanted to hang out with Shane*?

Well, SCUBA club is urgently gauging interest in a beginner SCUBA diving class held at Olin this semester and/or sending certified students diving with Mass Diving. You could apply for Passionate Pursuit funding, which will make it the cheapest way to get certified I?ve ever heard of.

If you?re interested, please fill out this survey. https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Bqn1QwxEBC-Br7Y8bt0m38ihA2xbF4l0QFGNz_4GCPU/viewform?usp=send_form

We?d need to organize the learner?s course asap so let us know if you?re interested.

Email Kaitlin/Shane or stop by our table at club fair if you have any questions!

Happy diving!
Scuba Club

*If that doesn?t make you want to dive, then you can hang out with Kaitlin, she is cooler.

Hello!
Tomorrow (Wednesday 9/10) is the first HPV meeting of the year! The Human Powered Vehicles team will be meeting at 8pm in the computer lab to talk through plans for the semester and decide which projects we'd like to work on. Everyone is welcome and encouraged to attend, even if you're just curious what HPV may be up to.
See you then!
~Kari

From iamcypress at gmail.com  Wed Sep 10 01:15:43 2014
From: iamcypress at gmail.com (Cypress Frankenfeld)
Date: Wed, 10 Sep 2014 01:15:43 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] =?utf-8?q?Spend_a_day_at_a_Board_Game_Caf=C3=A9=2C_Sa?=
	=?utf-8?q?t_Sept_27th!?=
Message-ID: <CAN1P9kaBwYbVFyyOGL0jx2V_pGUCRbKV7tJzb_12yJNA4K6GiA@mail.gmail.com>

Hey Board Game lovers!

Want to spend a day hanging out in Brookline at a beautiful caf? with a
(nearly) unlimited supply of board games?

I'm planning an all-day outing to Knight Moves Cafe
<https://www.google.com/maps/place/Knight+Moves+Cafe/@42.341509,-71.125022,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x89e379beee83fa7d:0xc8be98d4119380bb>
in Brookline. It'll happen on Saturday, Sept 27th. We'll leave Olin at
10:30am, and return to Olin at late-o-clock (the place closes at 11pm). I'm
planning on bringing an Olin-van's-worth of people, so spots are limited.

*Olin will cover the cost of transportation and the admittance fee to the
cafe*, and some snacks too! (but you have to pay for your own lunch and
dinner).

Worried about missing out? We'll do it again if it's a hit!

-Board Game Club
-------------- next part --------------

From Jennifer.Wei at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 10 10:00:42 2014
From: Jennifer.Wei at students.olin.edu (Jennifer Wei)
Date: Wed, 10 Sep 2014 10:00:42 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] First SASE Meeting of the Year!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35E053@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi all!

We hope your school year is off to a good start! SASE, the Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers, is holding a General Interest Meeting this week! We're a relatively new organization on campus, but SASE is one of the fastest growing professional societies nationwide. Getting involved with SASE is a great way to find out about unique job opportunities, network with people outside of Olin, and to get connected to Asian culture. Come to our interest meeting this Sunday to find out more or just to hang out. Anybody is welcome and we'd love to have you. We hope to see you then!

Sincerely Yours,
[cid:image001.png at 01CFCC80.80D9A0A0]

From Jennifer.Wei at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 10 10:15:20 2014
From: Jennifer.Wei at students.olin.edu (Jennifer Wei)
Date: Wed, 10 Sep 2014 10:15:20 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] First SASE Meeting of the Year!
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35E053@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35E053@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F6C7314@EXVS01.olin.edu>

It'll be a short meeting from 9-9:30pm!

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Jennifer Wei
Sent: Wednesday, September 10, 2014 10:01 AM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] First SASE Meeting of the Year!

Hi all!

We hope your school year is off to a good start! SASE, the Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers, is holding a General Interest Meeting this week! We're a relatively new organization on campus, but SASE is one of the fastest growing professional societies nationwide. Getting involved with SASE is a great way to find out about unique job opportunities, network with people outside of Olin, and to get connected to Asian culture. Come to our interest meeting this Sunday to find out more or just to hang out. Anybody is welcome and we'd love to have you. We hope to see you then!

Sincerely Yours,
[cid:image001.png at 01CFCCE0.201B14A0]
-------------- next part --------------

Subject: [Carpediem] Survey on Student Handbook Changes
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F6C7321@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi friends,
You all should know after last night that there have been some changes to the student handbook. I've heard a lot of feedback from people on this and so I want to give people a chance to fill out a survey about it.

www.tinyurl.com/OlinTalk1<http://www.tinyurl.com/OlinTalk1>

Please take the time to read the policy first but if you have feedback, please fill it in here.

Emily

From Michael.Resnick at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 10 11:24:55 2014
From: Michael.Resnick at students.olin.edu (Michael Resnick)
Date: Wed, 10 Sep 2014 11:24:55 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] The Music List
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F6C7366@EXVS01.olin.edu>

I'm ambivalent about sending this out because if every list were plugged, carpe would be flooded, but I just feel like the music list gets shockingly little traffic compared to how many people here love music and want to talk about it and coordinate for going to concerts and stuff and I'd like to see more activity there and sharing. So if you're interested in that stuff, join it.



-          1 0 8 0

From Celina.Bekins at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 10 11:42:17 2014
From: Celina.Bekins at students.olin.edu (Celina Bekins)
Date: Wed, 10 Sep 2014 11:42:17 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Hawaii party this Saturday!!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F6C7385@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Aloha awesome Oliners,

There will be a Hawaii party held in the WH2 lounge this Saturday night at 9:00 PM, so get excited!! Anyone is welcome to come; there will be LOTS of Hawaii-kine snacks and music.

If you play ukulele or guitar, bring your instrument along so we can jam!

Students from Hawaii: if you have snacks from or reminiscent of home, PLEASE bring them!

This party WILL be awesome, so I hope to see a lot of people there!!

~Celina

P.S. There's an iCal attached to this email.
-------------- next part --------------

From Amanda.Lee at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 10 13:04:47 2014
From: Amanda.Lee at students.olin.edu (Amanda Lee)
Date: Wed, 10 Sep 2014 13:04:47 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] F.I.L.M. Presents: The Kids Are All Right @ 10:00 pm
Message-ID: <A9AE04E6-F666-4A89-B190-D627434F2B92@students.olin.edu>

F.I.L.M. Club Presents: The Kids Are All Right<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bdDSqgZ87fM>
10:00 pm Today, Auditorium

[cid:F119DCA7-113B-46A7-94E5-E45E6289822C at olin.edu]

Welcome back guys! For those of you who don't know, FILM club is dedicated to showing movies (with snacks!) to the Olin Community on a weekly basis. This week we'll be watching The Kids Are All Right, a comedy-drama about what happens when the children of a lesbian couple reach out to their shared sperm donor father. It was well-recieved at Sundance when it came out in 2010 and has a fantastic cast.

Amanda Lee, F.I.L.M. Director
Mary Ruthven, I Couldn't Find Obvious Child :(
Helen Lyons, Mozzarella Sticks + Potstickers?
Philicia Chow, Key Grip
-------------- next part --------------
