Director<o:p></o:p></span></i></div><div style="margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: center; "><i><span style="font-size: 14pt; ">Mary Ruthven, I Couldn't Find Obvious Child :(<o:p></o:p></span></i></div><div style="margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; text-align: center; "><i><font face="Calibri, sans-serif" size="5">Helen Lyons,&nbsp;</font><font face="Calibri, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 19px;">Mozzarella</span></font><font face="Calibri, sans-serif" size="5">&nbsp;Sticks + Potstickers?<o:p></o:p></font></i></div><div style="margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; text-align: center; "><i><span style="font-size: 14pt; ">Philicia Chow, Key Grip</span></i></div></div>_______________________________________________<br>Carpediem mailing list<br><a href="mailto:Carpediem at lists.olin.edu">Carpediem at lists.olin.edu</a><br><a href="https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/carpediem">https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/carpediem</a><br></blockquote></div><br></div></div>_______________________________________________<br>Film-List mailing list<br><a href="mailto:Film-List at lists.olin.edu">Film-List at lists.olin.edu</a><br>https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/film-list<br></blockquote></div><br></div></body></html>

From Subhash.Gubba at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 10 13:36:57 2014
From: Subhash.Gubba at students.olin.edu (Subhash Gubba)
Date: Wed, 10 Sep 2014 13:36:57 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] #SHUML stickers
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F6C7411@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi Folks,

I designed a "#SHUML" sticker (and T-shirt) on Redbubble. I'm about to make an order, and because I'm the creator, I get a special discount. Would anybody like a sticker for the laptop?

Context: SHUML stands for "Should Have Used Machine Learning", basically a phrase, and now a hashtag, which signifies that something could have been improved or some obstacle overcome to reach success had machine learning been used.

Each sticker is 2 dollars (I'll be nice and pay for shipping :)).

Offer ends tonight at 11:00PM, which is when I'll be making the purchase.

Sincerely,

Subhash Gubba
Electrical and Computer Engineering
Olin College of Engineering | Class of 2017

From Paige.Cote at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 10 13:47:10 2014
From: Paige.Cote at students.olin.edu (Paige Cote)
Date: Wed, 10 Sep 2014 13:47:10 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Hacking Medicine This Weekend!
Message-ID: <8406CBDC-FCA5-4984-B3CA-17BB2121F974@students.olin.edu>

Hi Carpe!

This weekend I?m going to the Brigham and Women?s Hackathon, which is put on by MIT?s Hacking Medicine group. I?ve been to two of their hackathons before and had a blast both times. I would highly recommend it if you like solving non-traditional engineering problems with people from lots of different disciplines. My last team had a doctor, a med student, two engineers (bio and electrical), and a designer on it.

You can find the application and more information here: http://hackingmedicine.mit.edu/upcoming-events/bwh-hackathon-2/

They are accepting applications until the end of tomorrow (Thursday), so don?t hesitate to apply if you're interested. I am taking my car to the T, so I have spots to bring at least 4 more people.

Hope to see you there/let me know if you?re planning on going!
Paige

P.S. First years! Don?t worry if you don?t feel like you have enough experience yet, the Hacking Medicine hackathons are a great introduction to the hacking world, and you can contribute something no matter your experience level.
-------------- next part --------------
<html><head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html charset=windows-1252"></head><body style="word-wrap: break-word; -webkit-nbsp-mode: space; -webkit-line-break: after-white-space;">Hi Carpe!<div><br></div><div>This weekend I?m going to the Brigham and Women?s Hackathon, which is put on by MIT?s Hacking Medicine group. I?ve been to two of their hackathons before and had a blast both times. I would highly recommend it if you like solving non-traditional engineering problems with people from lots of different disciplines. My last team had a doctor, a med student, two engineers (bio and electrical), and a designer on it.&nbsp;</div><div><br></div><div>You can find the application and more information here:&nbsp;<a href="http://hackingmedicine.mit.edu/upcoming-events/bwh-hackathon-2/">http://hackingmedicine.mit.edu/upcoming-events/bwh-hackathon-2/</a></div><div><br></div><div>They are accepting applications until the end of tomorrow (Thursday), so don?t hesitate to apply if you're interested. I am taking my car to the T, so I have spots to bring at least 4 more people.</div><div><br></div><div>Hope to see you there/let me know if you?re planning on going!</div><div>Paige&nbsp;</div><div><br></div><div>P.S. First years! Don?t worry if you don?t feel like you have enough experience yet, the Hacking Medicine hackathons are a great introduction to the hacking world, and you can contribute something no matter your experience level.</div></body></html>

From Evan.Dorsky at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 10 14:25:20 2014
From: Evan.Dorsky at students.olin.edu (Evan Dorsky)
Date: Wed, 10 Sep 2014 14:25:20 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Part-time contract development work!
Message-ID: <732B0865-06EA-4ADB-9B2A-79D99134B7DC@students.olin.edu>

Hello, Carpe!

The startup I worked for two summers ago, eduCanon<http://www.educanon.com>, is looking for developers to do some part-time contract work! The product is really cool and they have a wide range of projects for developers with all sorts of interests.

Kai Austin and I have worked for eduCanon and we can vouch for the company ? the cofounders are great to work with, and we both really enjoyed our internships. Some of the positions are outlined in the google doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1k6VXzaIb1ZHTQmP1hofQXdqIqIWpXXIg6YhLyd7TvxM/edit?usp=sharing

And below is a description for a full-time position, though much of this could apply to a part-time (~5hrs/week) as well.

Reply to me or Ben (email below) if you?re interested!
Evan


FT Position:

eduCanon: eduCanon is a funded edtech company located outside of Washington DC, MD. We're building web software that matters, changing the face of education by giving teachers the tools they need to create and deliver interactive video; we?re a video player designed for educators, building a trusted canon of lessons from teachers across the globe based on this medium. We're looking for a full-stack developer to maintain and build on our current offerings as an addition to our team. Interested? Reach out to ben at educanon.com<mailto:ben at educanon.com>.

You: Smart and gets things done.
- Your skills are broad and deep. You know at least one server-side language very well (this is a PHP stack) and feel extremely comfortable on the front-end. Truthfully all startup positions are full-stack but this one will be 80% UI/UX, 20% back-end.
- You know git and how to use one well.
- You've coded at least one thing you're proud of, about which you can talk for hours.
- You're a passionate nerd.

Benefits:
- on a team that makes things happen; we're outpacing competitors 10x our size.
- money! This is a paid FT contract position. If interested in part-time, let us know.
- idyllic office space (and possible housing) on banks of the Chesapeake Bay. Full days, with interspersed kayaking, frisbee, etc.
- very flat structure--your ideas count; not only that but as you become more comfortable, we want to see independent development and idea generation from you!
-------------- next part --------------

	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
span.EmailStyle18
	{mso-style-type:personal;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}
span.EmailStyle19
	{mso-style-type:personal-reply;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}
span.BalloonTextChar
	{mso-style-name:"Balloon Text Char";
	mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text";
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-size:10.0pt;}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}

From Bernard.Kahle at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 10 19:21:39 2014
From: Bernard.Kahle at students.olin.edu (Bernard Kahle)
Date: Wed, 10 Sep 2014 19:21:39 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] SLAC Tonight 8pm EH2
Message-ID: <826B6F7D-09C9-4BBC-B5F0-DF99E495EC9A@students.olin.edu>

Tonight at 8-12pm in EH2 is the first weekly meeting of SLAC (Stay Late and Create)

SLAC provides a place to hang out, to work on personal work or projects, to learn or teach from one another, and to find project ideas you?re interested in working on and people to work with.

Over the course of this semester, we also plan to host a bunch courses, seminars, and tutorials about tech related skills and concepts.

Come hang out!

From Katherine.Bender at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 10 21:25:58 2014
From: Katherine.Bender at students.olin.edu (Katherine Bender)
Date: Wed, 10 Sep 2014 21:25:58 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Volunteer for Hub On Wheels
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F6C76E0@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello!
Hub on Wheels<http://www.bostonbikes.org/events/hub-on-wheels/> is a huge bike ride in Boston on Sunday September 21st and we'd like you to volunteer with us! Every year a group of students volunteers to help with the ride and this year we'll be stationed at a rest stop (handing out food and hanging out with riders) as well as on the course as ride marshals (biking around with an emergency contact sheet and helping fix the occasional flat tire). The event is super fun (and you can get a really nice t-shirt out of the deal :)). If you'd like to volunteer please fill out this spreadsheet<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1xIrFGoYrhM8EbS_1-ON3XMDInL9ub33nPBpTP_bk2hM/edit?usp=sharing> with information. I'll be organizing rides so we can all get there and have a great time. As a note, the event does start very early in the morning (we have to meet in Boston at 6:45), but it's so worth it.
Thanks!
~Kari
-------------- next part --------------

</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal><img width=576 height=381 id="Picture_x0020_1" src="cid:image001.jpg at 01CFCD40.E5E14320"><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Procrastibaking is open!<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:14.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>This week, there are Vermont Maple Cupcakes, Orange Almond Cupcakes, and Blueberry Orange Cupcakes.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:13.0pt'>(There are gluten-free and vegan options available)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:13.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>If you are hungry and have cash or Venmo, come over to EH3!<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><img width=279 height=422 id="Picture_x0020_2" src="cid:image002.jpg at 01CFCD40.E5E14320"><img width=385 height=254 id="Picture_x0020_3" src="cid:image003.jpg at 01CFCD40.E5E14320"><img width=385 height=254 id="Picture_x0020_4" src="cid:image004.jpg at 01CFCD40.E5E14320"><o:p></o:p></p></div></body></html>

Sent from my iPhone

On Sep 10, 2014, at 1:04 PM, "Amanda Lee" <Amanda.Lee at students.olin.edu<mailto:Amanda.Lee at students.olin.edu>> wrote:

F.I.L.M. Club Presents: The Kids Are All Right<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bdDSqgZ87fM>
10:00 pm Today, Auditorium

<PastedGraphic-3.tiff>

Welcome back guys! For those of you who don't know, FILM club is dedicated to showing movies (with snacks!) to the Olin Community on a weekly basis. This week we'll be watching The Kids Are All Right, a comedy-drama about what happens when the children of a lesbian couple reach out to their shared sperm donor father. It was well-recieved at Sundance when it came out in 2010 and has a fantastic cast.

Amanda Lee, F.I.L.M. Director
Mary Ruthven, I Couldn't Find Obvious Child :(
Helen Lyons, Mozzarella Sticks + Potstickers?
Philicia Chow, Key Grip
_______________________________________________
Carpediem mailing list
Carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:Carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/carpediem

From Mariko.Thorbecke at students.olin.edu  Thu Sep 11 08:05:06 2014
From: Mariko.Thorbecke at students.olin.edu (Mariko Thorbecke)
Date: Thu, 11 Sep 2014 08:05:06 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Part time job gardening/painting
Message-ID: <7B132BCA-AFFE-4630-9C32-A4506CF70A60@students.olin.edu>

Hi Everyone,

Last year I worked for a really nice older lady in Needham doing some gardening, painting, yard work etc? Unfortunately between soccer and course work this year weekends are no longer great for me.

But if you?re looking for a part time job, this lady pays $12 an hour and will pick you up at Olin and drop you back off! She generally likes a couple of students to come over on a Saturday or Sunday and she provides lunch. She?s super nice and has worked with many Olin students in the past.

Let me know if you?re interested and I can put you in touch, she?s interested in having people come over this weekend, but starting at a later date is also possible.

Thanks!

Mariko

From Caitrin.Lynch at olin.edu  Thu Sep 11 11:05:50 2014
From: Caitrin.Lynch at olin.edu (Caitrin Lynch)
Date: Thu, 11 Sep 2014 11:05:50 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] part-time job--Needham Center
Message-ID: <D037257F.9DAC4%caitrin.lynch@olin.edu>

Hi Oliners?Please see below.This could be a cool way to earn some extra money and learn some things about manufacturing and business. --Caitrin


------------
This part-time job notice is at Vita Needle Co., in the center of Needham. It's a very interesting place (I wrote a book about it), a small factory that produces medical & industrial needles. It could be a nice foot in the door for someone interested in engineering + manufacturing + business. (For more info on this company, see my book webpage: http://retirementontheline.net/)

Open position. About 4-6 hours a week, 2-5PM would be the typical work time, but it could be other hours instead. It consists purely of scanning in closed sales orders, stamping them scanned, and then reassembling them (staple) together. It's a little tricky because the scanner pulls in pages rapidly; it requires a combination of speed, dexterity and computer skills. Pay rate roughly $10/hr (details can be discussed with employer).
Frederick Hartman II
<frederick at vitaneedle.com<mailto:frederick at vitaneedle.com>>
Vita Needle Company
781-444-1780<tel:781-444-1780>
www.vitaneedle.com<http://www.vitaneedle.com/>

From Sawyer.Vaughan at students.olin.edu  Thu Sep 11 17:01:17 2014
From: Sawyer.Vaughan at students.olin.edu (Sawyer Vaughan)
Date: Thu, 11 Sep 2014 17:01:17 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Selling 120GB SSD
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F6C7AC8@EXVS01.olin.edu>

This one:

http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00A1ZTZOG/ref=wms_ohs_product?ie=UTF8&psc=1

I used it for a year. It is in good, working condition. I am selling it because I bought a new, larger one.

$40 OBO.

It probably isn't large enough to hold all of the files that you need, but you can put your computer's current hard drive in a hard drive caddy, and run Windows and your programs from your SSD to speed them up.

-Sawyer

From Hannah.Wilk at students.olin.edu  Thu Sep 11 22:58:09 2014
From: Hannah.Wilk at students.olin.edu (Hannah Wilk)
Date: Thu, 11 Sep 2014 22:58:09 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Xanadu Auditions!!!
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D279@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D279@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F6C7C51@EXVS01.olin.edu>

So there have been a change of plans!!

AUDITIONS for Xanadu ARE IN AC 128!!
At 1 pm, Saturday and Sunday!

Can't wait to see you all there!

Tell your friends!



From: Casey Alvarado
Sent: Sunday, September 07, 2014 5:25 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu; fwop at lists.olin.edu
Cc: Brian Liebson; Hannah Wilk; Ian Hill
Subject: Xanadu Auditions!!!

Hello friends,

FWOP will be preforming Xanadu, the musical, in November! Do you like 80's roller discos, dazzling romance, and stunning dance numbers? If you said yes to all of those things, come to auditions!

Auditions will be held on September 13th and 14th in the Crescent Room in the Campus Center at 1pm!

September 13th: Singing and Acting auditions.
Acting-wise, be prepared to read a scene. No preparation necessary.
Singing wise, please bring TWO 30 second songs prepared to sing a Capella. The first can be any song that displays your vocal range.  The second song should be from the show.

September 14th: Dancing Auditions.
Choreography will be taught, and then you will perform the choreography.


Everyone must attend both auditions. However if you feel like you only want to dance, please email us.

 Click here to view the complete Broadway show for inspiration!<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c_-mYomx1nw>
Show dates will be on November 13th, 14th, and 15th!

Everyone with a musical theatre interest is encouraged to audition! Even if you have minimal experience, don't worry about it, please still come! Bring your friends!

If you cannot attend both or either of the audition dates and you would still like to audition, please let us know!

Thank you,
Casey & Hannah

[cid:image001.jpg at 01CFCE13.DA7F4CB0]

From Emily.Guthrie at students.olin.edu  Fri Sep 12 10:44:34 2014
From: Emily.Guthrie at students.olin.edu (Emily Guthrie)
Date: Fri, 12 Sep 2014 10:44:34 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] SURVEY Please read
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E68009@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Look I'll play it to you straight. 20 people is not a statistically significant response number especially on an issue as pertinent as a policy change.

I know a lot more than 20 of you have opinions on this policy change be them positive feelings or negative. Please take the time to fill this in as it is your most effective way to give us feedback. It takes less than 10 minutes and it makes a huge difference :)

www.tinyurl.com/olintalk1<http://www.tinyurl.com/olintalk1>

This survey will close for entries Sunday at 11pm. Please if you care about this issue remind your friends, roomates, suitemates, and team mates to fill this out.

Emily

From Justin.Poh at students.olin.edu  Fri Sep 12 12:30:38 2014
From: Justin.Poh at students.olin.edu (Justin Poh)
Date: Fri, 12 Sep 2014 12:30:38 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Do Research on Robot Fish!!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E680AE@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Tl;dr: Robot fish are cool and we're building one! Come be a part of the team!! See video for demo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bkgKc3pttq0

Long version:
Hi all,

The Intelligent Vehicles Lab (aka RoboLab) is running a series of research projects during the academic year! If you're interested in what these projects are, you should feel free to reach out to Prof David Barrett (cc'ed on this email) and he can tell you all about the various projects! In this email, I'm specifically promoting one of our research projects most commonly known as the robotic tuna project! For those of you who know about this project, yes! It's back up and running and open for anyone to work on!

I can provide more details if anyone is interested but I will summarize the project here. Over the summer, we managed to create a working proof of concept that fish powered locomotion is possible and the system we developed over the summer is still in working condition for anyone who would like to see it. During this academic year, we will be working extensively with the robotic tuna to waterproof the hull, design new, innovative actuation systems and develop code for autonomous swimming and navigational capabilities! There is plenty of work to go around (of course) and if this project sounds interesting to you, you should definitely strongly consider joining this project. The final end goal (in several years) is to develop a fully autonomous robotic tuna vehicle that is capable of crossing the atlantic ocean. This year we will take some serious first steps to getting there. If that isn't enough incentive for you, Dave is our faculty advisor so you're guaranteed to have fun!

If you want to see where we got to over the summer:

Long video of fish swimming around the pool: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bkgKc3pttq0
The fish being guided between two makeshift "gates": https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I3NR2kj9fQw

Some more serious fine details: We will probably meet once a week as a team to calibrate ourselves on what everyone is doing and what progress is being made. These meetings will probably be 1 or 2 hours long and will probably take place either on Fridays or Wednesdays depending on when people are available. Of course, it would be preferable to avoid meeting on Friday because that's service time. Work wise, should you want to work on this project, we can discuss how extensively you want to be involved and you can work on it for just this semester or the entire academic year. That is all entirely up to you. Our goal here is to build a cohesive team of engineers to get this robot off the lab table and into the water for more testing.

Some examples of work to be done:


1.       Mechanical engineers needed to design new methods of actuating the tail section (e.g. soft robotics, Lorentz force actuators) and design sealing methods for keeping water out of the electronics bays

2.       Software engineers to design the autonomous control software for literally everything

3.       Electrical engineers to design sensor systems or develop new sensing circuits for sensing environmental variables such as vortex position and movement

That's it! If you're interested in working on this project or have questions, please email me at this email address or you can also email Prof David Barrett (cc'ed above).

Thanks guys!

Cheers,
Justin

-------------- next part --------------

	{margin-bottom:0in;}

	{margin-bottom:0in;}
--></style><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
<o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1026" />
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
<o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
<o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1" />
</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link="#0563C1" vlink="#954F72"><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal><b>Tl;dr: </b>Robot fish are cool and we&#8217;re building one! Come be a part of the team!! See video for demo: <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bkgKc3pttq0">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bkgKc3pttq0</a><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><b>Long version:<o:p></o:p></b></p><p class=MsoNormal><b> <o:p></o:p></b></p><p class=MsoNormal>Hi all,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>The Intelligent Vehicles Lab (aka RoboLab) is running a series of research projects during the academic year! If you&#8217;re interested in what these projects are, you should feel free to reach out to Prof David Barrett (cc&#8217;ed on this email) and he can tell you all about the various projects! In this email, I&#8217;m specifically promoting one of our research projects most commonly known as the robotic tuna project! For those of you who know about this project, yes! It&#8217;s back up and running and open for anyone to work on! <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>I can provide more details if anyone is interested but I will summarize the project here. Over the summer, we managed to create a working proof of concept that fish powered locomotion is possible and the system we developed over the summer is still in working condition for anyone who would like to see it. During this academic year, we will be working extensively with the robotic tuna to waterproof the hull, design new, innovative actuation systems and develop code for autonomous swimming and navigational capabilities! There is plenty of work to go around (of course) and if this project sounds interesting to you, you should definitely strongly consider joining this project. The final end goal (in several years) is to develop a fully autonomous robotic tuna vehicle that is capable of crossing the atlantic ocean. This year we will take some serious first steps to getting there. If that isn&#8217;t enough incentive for you, Dave is our faculty advisor so you&#8217;re guaranteed to have fun!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>If you want to see where we got to over the summer:<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Long video of fish swimming around the pool: <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bkgKc3pttq0">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bkgKc3pttq0</a><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>The fish being guided between two makeshift &#8220;gates&#8221;: <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I3NR2kj9fQw">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I3NR2kj9fQw</a><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Some more serious fine details: We will probably meet once a week as a team to calibrate ourselves on what everyone is doing and what progress is being made. These meetings will probably be 1 or 2 hours long and will probably take place either on Fridays or Wednesdays depending on when people are available. Of course, it would be preferable to avoid meeting on Friday because that&#8217;s service time. Work wise, should you want to work on this project, we can discuss how extensively you want to be involved and you can work on it for just this semester or the entire academic year. That is all entirely up to you. Our goal here is to build a cohesive team of engineers to get this robot off the lab table and into the water for more testing. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Some examples of work to be done:<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1'><![if !supportLists]><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>1.<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span><![endif]>Mechanical engineers needed to design new methods of actuating the tail section (e.g. soft robotics, Lorentz force actuators) and design sealing methods for keeping water out of the electronics bays<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1'><![if !supportLists]><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>2.<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span><![endif]>Software engineers to design the autonomous control software for literally everything<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1'><![if !supportLists]><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>3.<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span><![endif]>Electrical engineers to design sensor systems or develop new sensing circuits for sensing environmental variables such as vortex position and movement<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>That&#8217;s it! If you&#8217;re interested in working on this project or have questions, please email me at this email address or you can also email Prof David Barrett (cc&#8217;ed above).<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Thanks guys!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Cheers,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Justin<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Juanita.Desouza at students.olin.edu  Fri Sep 12 14:56:42 2014

Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E6818A@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey WrOlin(Writers of Olin) is having a Bad FanFiction Night this Monday(9/15) in WH1 Lounge! Swing by to write some truly terrible fanfiction or just to hear what people have written so far.

Freshman this is the perfect opportunity to de-stress and pass no record after a long day of classes. For everyone else, this is the best time to have some fun before the school work actually hits.

Interested in creative writing? Stories? Poems? Interested in helping organize Bad Fanfiction Night? Come visit the WrOlin table at the club fair!

~ Juanita

From Thomas.Chen at students.olin.edu  Fri Sep 12 21:55:52 2014
From: Thomas.Chen at students.olin.edu (Thomas Chen)
Date: Fri, 12 Sep 2014 21:55:52 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] DnD Club!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A34D9976@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi folks,

If you didn't catch Dungeons and Dragons Club at the club fair today, it's not too late to join! (it's secretly never too late to join)

Dungeons and Dragons is the role-playing game on which many others (Final Fantasy, Baldur's Gate, and Skyrim to name a few),  are based. Contrary to popular belief, DnD isn't supposed to be about obscure rules and complex math! It's a system for creating and acting out the stories you want to tell with your friends. You don't need any fancy console or gaming PC, just some dice and your imagination.

DnD Club may be right for you if you have played DnD in the past and want to continue at Olin, want to try it out but are unsure of how to start, or are even vaguely interested in the subject. The only commitment is signing up for the mailing list! I can help you buy new books and equipment, match you up with a group, or walk you through DMing and playing the game. I play the new 5th edition, but I know we have people who like 3.5 and 4, and none of us will rub any of your preferences in your face.

Sign up for the mailing list here: https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/dnd

Best,
Tom Chen

PS: If you're already in a group, please sign up for the mailing list anyway! This is helpful for everyone involved: you can get new stuff and support and I can keep track of everything.

Ladies and Gentlemen,

Natalie Sharpe, Paul Booth, and F. Scott Fitzgerald,

Errric Kolker...

IIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIT'S

TIIIIIIIIIIIME

To find out who's awake in the Olin LateNight DiVISION,

Introducing first,

REPLYING out of the Blue corner,

A mixed martial artist, holding a Who's Awake record of 3 replies, 11 snoozes , and 2 no responds, REPLYING from West Hall North Wing....

It's CHAZ, "Hella Chaz", GWENNNAAAAAAAAAAAAAAP

Subject: [Carpediem] Xanadu Auditions!!!
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F6C7C51@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE401587F35D279@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E682FB@EXVS01.olin.edu>

One last reminder! The singing and acting auditions for Xanadu will be held in about an hour in AC 128 at 1PM!
Also, dancing auditions are tomorrow at 1PM. See below for details!


From: Hannah Wilk
Sent: Thursday, September 11, 2014 10:58 PM
To: Casey Alvarado; carpediem at lists.olin.edu; fwop at lists.olin.edu
Cc: Brian Liebson; Ian Hill
Subject: RE: Xanadu Auditions!!!

So there have been a change of plans!!

AUDITIONS for Xanadu ARE IN AC 128!!
At 1 pm, Saturday and Sunday!

Can't wait to see you all there!

Tell your friends!



From: Casey Alvarado
Sent: Sunday, September 07, 2014 5:25 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>; fwop at lists.olin.edu<mailto:fwop at lists.olin.edu>
Cc: Brian Liebson; Hannah Wilk; Ian Hill
Subject: Xanadu Auditions!!!

Hello friends,

FWOP will be preforming Xanadu, the musical, in November! Do you like 80's roller discos, dazzling romance, and stunning dance numbers? If you said yes to all of those things, come to auditions!

Auditions will be held on September 13th and 14th in the Crescent Room in the Campus Center at 1pm!

September 13th: Singing and Acting auditions.
Acting-wise, be prepared to read a scene. No preparation necessary.
Singing wise, please bring TWO 30 second songs prepared to sing a Capella. The first can be any song that displays your vocal range.  The second song should be from the show.

September 14th: Dancing Auditions.
Choreography will be taught, and then you will perform the choreography.


Everyone must attend both auditions. However if you feel like you only want to dance, please email us.

 Click here to view the complete Broadway show for inspiration!<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c_-mYomx1nw>
Show dates will be on November 13th, 14th, and 15th!

Everyone with a musical theatre interest is encouraged to audition! Even if you have minimal experience, don't worry about it, please still come! Bring your friends!

If you cannot attend both or either of the audition dates and you would still like to audition, please let us know!

Thank you,
Casey & Hannah

Subject: [Carpediem] SERV Applications Extended!

SERV Applications have been extended to Sunday midnight :)

We have some really great events coming up: a 5K run, engineering shelters for PUPPIES, a blood drive, and of course the huge SERV auction.
Don't just be a part of them, help RUN them by being on the SERV board.

From Toni.Saylor at students.olin.edu  Sat Sep 13 14:26:30 2014
From: Toni.Saylor at students.olin.edu (Toni Saylor)
Date: Sat, 13 Sep 2014 14:26:30 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] First eDisco Meeting Tomorrow at 5:00
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E68373@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi friends,
Because of Serv Kickball, our first eDisco meeting will be at 5:00 tomorrow on the dining hall mezzanine. (If you got this email before, note the time has changed to 5:00)
Feel free to bring your dinner.
We'll do some fun teaching exercises with actual, real, live children.
We'll meet the new first years.
We'll discuss this year's activities.
And generally we'll be awesome.

For those of you that are going, "What is this club and did I sign up for this list?":
Engineering Discovery (eDisco) is a K12 education outreach group. We do a variety of things from running after school programs to Saturday workshops. We can guarantee you'll learn a lot about education, curriculum design, and teaching. We can also guarantee awesomeness.

Our usual meeting time is 3:30 on Fridays on the Mezz.

<3
The Four-ish
(Toni, Adam, Rachel, Jess and Ari)

(If you got this email before, note the time has changed to 5:00)<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Feel free to bring your dinner. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>We&#8217;ll do some fun <span style='font-size:14.0pt;color:#FFC000'>teaching exercises</span><span style='color:#FFC000'> </span>with <span style='font-size:14.0pt;color:#FFC000'>actual, real, live children</span>. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>We&#8217;ll meet the new first years. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>We&#8217;ll discuss <b><span style='font-size:14.0pt;color:#00B050'>this year&#8217;s activities</span></b>. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>And generally we&#8217;ll <span style='font-size:16.0pt;color:#0070C0'>be awesome</span>.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>For those of you that are going, &#8220;What is this club and did I sign up for this list?&#8221;: <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><b><u><span style='font-size:16.0pt;color:#7030A0'>Engineering Discovery (eDisco) is a K12 education outreach group</span></u></b>. We do a variety of things from running after school programs to Saturday workshops. We can guarantee you&#8217;ll learn a lot about education, curriculum design, and teaching. We can also guarantee <span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#C00000'>a</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:red'>w</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#FFC000'>e</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:yellow'>s</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#92D050'>o</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#00B050'>m</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#00B0F0'>e</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#0070C0'>n</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#002060'>e</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#7030A0'>s</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#403152'>s</span>.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>Our usual meeting time is 3:30 on Fridays on the Mezz. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:red'>&lt;3<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:#002060'>The Four-ish<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;color:#002060'>(Toni, Adam, Rachel, Jess and Ari)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Ian.Hill at students.olin.edu  Sat Sep 13 22:22:29 2014
From: Ian.Hill at students.olin.edu (Ian Hill)
Date: Sat, 13 Sep 2014 22:22:29 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Directors needed for One Act Festival!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E6852B@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi Oliners!

TL;DR: FWOP is now looking for one act directors! If you'd like to try your hand at directing a one act play, come to the FWOP One Act Directors Meeting this Monday from 6-7PM in the Crescent Room. (If you're interested, but cannot attend, simply reply to this email.)

It's time already to start preparing for FWOP's One Act Festival for Fall Family Weekend (October 17th and 18th)! Do you have a one act play that you've always wanted to direct? Have you never directed before and want to try it out? Do you want to participate in a play this semester that has a much smaller time commitment than the normal FWOP productions?

If you have some ideas for what one-act you'd like to direct, great! Bring them with you. If you'd like to direct, but don't know what one-act, that's OK too! We'll have some options for you!

If you're interested in acting in a one act play, be on the lookout soon for audition announcements from the directors!

[cid:image001.jpg at 01CFCFA1.34547BF0]

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Megan McCauley
Sent: Saturday, September 13, 2014 10:45 PM

Subject: [Carpediem] Moonrise Kingdom WH1

Reasons you should watch Moonrise Kingdom with us in WH1:

?  It's a Wes Anderson movie

?  Bill Murray

?  Edward Norton as Scout Master Ward

?  It was filmed at Paul's Boy Scout camp

?  It involves a love story between these adorable runaways

[cid:image001.jpg at 01CFCFA5.B585EC00]

Love,
Meg and Emily (and lots more people!!)

P.S. Bonus points if you can get the TV to actually want to participate in movie watching.

Everyone is welcome to join (and please do, because I just bought a bag-of-concrete sized thing of pancake mix).

From Megan.McCauley at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep 14 13:19:08 2014
From: Megan.McCauley at students.olin.edu (Megan McCauley)
Date: Sun, 14 Sep 2014 13:19:08 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Interested in SWE National Conference?
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E6866F@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello all you lovely ladies and gents!

It's coming! The SWE National Conference is about a month away!

And we want you to join us in Los Angeles, California the weekend of October 23-25!

The conference is a great place to go to hear amazing panels, interact with women in the industry, and even attend a career fair!

We will be doing fundraising, so don't let money be the reason you don't come!

Interested? Fill out this survey<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1P6POOysE9CZ5BNPqwlHa27F6IbkjmZQun8EJGd0pbKM/viewform?usp=send_form> and let us know!
No commitment necessary, we're just trying to gauge interest.

Thanks!
Meg, on behalf of SWE

From Subhash.Gubba at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep 14 14:04:02 2014
From: Subhash.Gubba at students.olin.edu (Subhash Gubba)
Date: Sun, 14 Sep 2014 14:04:02 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] some club stuff :)
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E686B7@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey folks - just in case you couldn't make club fair, I wanted to make one last plug for 2 clubs this year I'm in charge of:

Olin Indian Club:
All are welcome (Indians and non-indians alike)! Being part of this club means you'll hear about events and festivities including Bollywood movie nights, indian foods/snacks nights, Holi, Diwali, and maybe more! Sign up here: https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/indianclub

Yoga/Meditation Group:
For beginners and experts alike, a casual-meeting group who's focus is to relieve stress and learn the many ways of this calming, soothing, and even spiritual activity. It will be characterized by spontaneous and regular meetings, both of which are optional, and come-and-go-as-you-please. Sign up here: https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/yoga

Both of these activities are super low commitment. Thanks for your time and consideration (and possibly participation!)

On a side note, if you're interested in starting a Flute Club or a LEGO Club, let me know :).

Sincerely,

Subhash Gubba
Electrical and Computer Engineering
Olin College of Engineering | Class of 2017

From Toni.Saylor at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep 14 16:33:37 2014
From: Toni.Saylor at students.olin.edu (Toni Saylor)
Date: Sun, 14 Sep 2014 16:33:37 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] FW: First eDisco Meeting Tomorrow at 5:00
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E68373@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E68373@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E68794@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Reminder,
This is happening in 27 min.

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Toni Saylor
Sent: Saturday, September 13, 2014 2:27 PM
To: ediscovery at lists.olin.edu; carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] First eDisco Meeting Tomorrow at 5:00

Hi friends,
Because of Serv Kickball, our first eDisco meeting will be at 5:00 tomorrow on the dining hall mezzanine. (If you got this email before, note the time has changed to 5:00)
Feel free to bring your dinner.
We'll do some fun teaching exercises with actual, real, live children.
We'll meet the new first years.
We'll discuss this year's activities.
And generally we'll be awesome.

For those of you that are going, "What is this club and did I sign up for this list?":
Engineering Discovery (eDisco) is a K12 education outreach group. We do a variety of things from running after school programs to Saturday workshops. We can guarantee you'll learn a lot about education, curriculum design, and teaching. We can also guarantee awesomeness.

Our usual meeting time is 3:30 on Fridays on the Mezz.

<3
The Four-ish
(Toni, Adam, Rachel, Jess and Ari)

p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:11.0pt;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
a:link, span.MsoHyperlink
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:blue;
	text-decoration:underline;}
a:visited, span.MsoHyperlinkFollowed
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:purple;
	text-decoration:underline;}
span.EmailStyle17
	{mso-style-type:personal;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
span.EmailStyle18
	{mso-style-type:personal-reply;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-size:10.0pt;}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}
--></style><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'> Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] <b>On Behalf Of </b>Toni Saylor<br><b>Sent:</b> Saturday, September 13, 2014 2:27 PM<br><b>To:</b> ediscovery at lists.olin.edu; carpediem at lists.olin.edu<br><b>Subject:</b> [Carpediem] First eDisco Meeting Tomorrow at 5:00<o:p></o:p></span></p></div></div><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Hi friends,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Because of Serv Kickball, our first eDisco meeting will be at <b><span style='font-size:22.0pt;color:red'>5:00 tomorrow on the dining hall mezzanine</span></b>. (If you got this email before, note the time has changed to 5:00)<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Feel free to bring your dinner. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>We&#8217;ll do some fun <span style='font-size:14.0pt;color:#FFC000'>teaching exercises</span><span style='color:#FFC000'> </span>with <span style='font-size:14.0pt;color:#FFC000'>actual, real, live children</span>. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>We&#8217;ll meet the new first years. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>We&#8217;ll discuss <b><span style='font-size:14.0pt;color:#00B050'>this year&#8217;s activities</span></b>. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>And generally we&#8217;ll <span style='font-size:16.0pt;color:#0070C0'>be awesome</span>.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>For those of you that are going, &#8220;What is this club and did I sign up for this list?&#8221;: <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><b><u><span style='font-size:16.0pt;color:#7030A0'>Engineering Discovery (eDisco) is a K12 education outreach group</span></u></b>. We do a variety of things from running after school programs to Saturday workshops. We can guarantee you&#8217;ll learn a lot about education, curriculum design, and teaching. We can also guarantee <span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#C00000'>a</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:red'>w</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#FFC000'>e</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:yellow'>s</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#92D050'>o</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#00B050'>m</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#00B0F0'>e</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#0070C0'>n</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#002060'>e</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#7030A0'>s</span><span style='font-family:"Arial Black","sans-serif";color:#403152'>s</span>.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:12.0pt'>Our usual meeting time is 3:30 on Fridays on the Mezz. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:red'>&lt;3<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:18.0pt;color:#002060'>The Four-ish<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:10.0pt;color:#002060'>(Toni, Adam, Rachel, Jess and Ari)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div></body></html>

Subject: [Carpediem] Rockwell SCOPE Team - Final Design Review

video about the problem of human-robot interaction! Come join us in the
EH3NN suite at *8:45pm* tonight to watch our presentation/video and give us
feedback on our design. Chicken nuggets will be provided for viewers.

 - Derek on behalf of the Rockwall SCOPE team (which is slightly delirious
after a shorter-than-expected-but-still-really-long-SCOPEaTHON)

Come join us in the EH3NN suite at <b>8:45pm</b> tonight to watch our presentation/video and give us feedback on our design. From Brian.Liebson at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep 14 20:47:22 2014
From: Brian.Liebson at students.olin.edu (Brian Liebson)
Date: Sun, 14 Sep 2014 20:47:22 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Volleyball Starting this Wednesday! 9/17
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E688C6@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi Everyone!

So finally volleyball practices are starting THIS WEDNESDAY 9/17!!!!

We are holding practices Wednesdays 7:30PM - 9:30PM
                             & Saturdays 3:30PM-5:30PM.

There are also optional scrimmages on Sundays from 7:30PM - 9:30PM against Babson's club volleyball team.
In addition, we can attend Babson's club practices, so let me know if you'd like to go to those and we can set that up!

Anyone can join! Due to a large influx of new people and a leaving of seniors, we are taking this semester to learn the basics and getting everyone to play confidently.
This means that practices will be somewhat tame (compared to the spring) and we will be relaxed. If you can only come to one practice per week, that is okay.

I.E. Anyone and everyone should join so you can look cool beating your friends on the beach this summer.

We are meeting in WH1 15 minutes before each practice (Wednesdays and Sundays at 7:15PM, Saturdays at 3:15PM) and walking over all together.
We have gym time with an actual net and everything at Babson's Webster center in PepsiCo Pavilion (the blue-floored gym), if you'd like to just meet us there.


If you have any questions, comments, or concerns, don't hesitate to let me know.



Best,

Brian
Team Captain
-------------- next part --------------

</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal><a href="http://www.tinyurl.com/olintalk1">www.tinyurl.com/olintalk1</a><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Nuff Said<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Emily<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>(&lt;3)<o:p></o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Juanita.Desouza at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep 14 22:53:27 2014
From: Juanita.Desouza at students.olin.edu (Juanita Desouza)
Date: Sun, 14 Sep 2014 22:53:27 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Bad FanFiction with CORRECT ical!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E6895B@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Correct ical attached! See below for info. Ginger snaps will be provided.
---------------

Hey WrOlin(Writers of Olin) is having a Bad FanFiction Night at 8:00 P.M. this Monday(9/15) in WH1 Lounge! Swing by to write some truly terrible fanfiction or just to hear what people have written so far.

Freshman this is the perfect opportunity to de-stress and pass no record after a long day of classes. For everyone else, this is the best time to have some fun before the school work actually hits.


Interested in creative writing? Stories? Poems? Interested in helping organize Bad Fanfiction Night? Come visit the WrOlin and sign up for the coming mailing list(The mailing list will be made by this Friday.)!

~ Juanita

<body>
<font face="Calibri, sans-serif" size="2">
<div><font color="#1F497D">&nbsp;</font></div>
<div><font color="#1F497D">Now with ical!</font></div>
<div><font face="Tahoma, sans-serif" size="2">_____________________________________________<br>

From Caitrin.Lynch at olin.edu  Mon Sep 15 08:32:49 2014
From: Caitrin.Lynch at olin.edu (Caitrin Lynch)
Date: Mon, 15 Sep 2014 08:32:49 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] soccer video, paid job
Message-ID: <D03C5349.9E285%caitrin.lynch@olin.edu>

Hi Olin people--

The Needham High School's boys' varsity soccer team (recent state champs) is looking for someone to help make a video of their season. They need this done by roughly November 21st; most work is in those November weeks. It involves:

--The video is about 10 minutes long?+/- that will consist of video highlights throughout the season.
--You will be provided with videos from the season to select from.
--The video needs to include player interviews, which you could do or possibly a team parent can do and provide to you.
--It pays approx. $600.
--You can see last year's video as a sample.

Contact person, if interested:

Andrew Maslow
Cell 617 281 2746
Home 781 449 3366
63 Prince Street
Needham, Mass, 02492
amaslow at rcn.com<mailto:amaslow at rcn.com>

Thanks, Caitrin

From Juanita.Desouza at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep 15 09:04:22 2014
From: Juanita.Desouza at students.olin.edu (Juanita Desouza)
Date: Mon, 15 Sep 2014 09:04:22 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Bad FanFiction with CORRECT ical!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E68A60@EXVS01.olin.edu>



Correct ical attached! See below for info. Ginger snaps will be provided.




Hey WrOlin(Writers of Olin) is having a Bad FanFiction Night at 8:00 P.M. this Monday(9/15) in WH1 Lounge! Swing by to write some truly terrible fanfiction or just to hear what people have written so far.

Freshman this is the perfect opportunity to de-stress and pass no record after a long day of classes. For everyone else, this is the best time to have some fun before the school work actually hits.


Interested in creative writing? Stories? Poems? Interested in helping organize Bad Fanfiction Night? Come visit WrOlin and sign up for the coming mailing list(The mailing list will be made by this Friday.)!

~ Juanita

From Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep 15 09:38:18 2014
From: Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu (Lyra Silverwolf)
Date: Mon, 15 Sep 2014 09:38:18 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Not-Summer-Anymore Reading Program
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A306833F@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Do you read for fun? Do you read for class? Would you like to receive prizes for reading?

Participate in the Not-Summer-Anymore Reading Program sponsored by the Olin Library!

The rules are simple:

Pick up a coloring mat from the library. Then for every 15 minutes of reading you do before November 15th, color in one circle. Reading assigned for a class must be done in the library to count, but reading done for fun counts regardless of where you do it. For personal reading, you may choose either fiction or non-fiction per your own preference. For every two hours you read (up to eight hours total) you earn a small prize and an entry into the raffle. If you reach eight hours before the end of the semester, keep reading to earn more entries into the raffle.

Stop by the library today to pick up your mat and start earning prizes for reading!
-------------- next part --------------

From Sara.Hendren at olin.edu  Mon Sep 15 11:14:09 2014
From: Sara.Hendren at olin.edu (Sara Hendren)
Date: Mon, 15 Sep 2014 11:14:09 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] design/tech/art/science events coming up
Message-ID: <D03C7A81.1A1%sara.hendren@olin.edu>

Thought some of you also might be interested in these events:

1) Seeing/Sensing/Sounding, an MIT art-science-tech 2-day event on 9/26-27 for "creative artists to join with philosophers, cognitive neuroscientists, anthropologists, historians, and scholars from a range of disciplines in an open-ended discussion about knowledge production. The goal is to challenge each domain?s conventional certainty about 'what is known,? ?how we know it,' or ?how we can know more,? and to stimulate new issues for possible cross-disciplinary scholarship in the future.? See more here:
http://arts.mit.edu/cast-symposium/. I?ll be there; say hi if you get in!

2) Design Exchange Boston, a ?two-day design and innovation conference dedicated to celebrating the impact of design.? On 9/27/28. It?s a pretty amazing speaker lineup. http://www.dxboston.com/

AND

3) ?Make the Breast Pump Not Suck,? a maternal health hackathon, is this weekend at MIT. Sold out, but it?ll be interesting to watch this WAY overdue design opportunity. http://breastpump.media.mit.edu/.

Sara Hendren

Either way, if you are also going to the conference/want to spend some time in Providence, we could drive there together!

Ingrid

More info here: <a href="http://www.abetterworldbydesign.com/about-us/">http://www.abetterworldbydesign.com/about-us/</a><o:p></o:p></span></p><div><div style='border:none;border-top:solid #B5C4DF 1.0pt;padding:3.0pt 0in 0in 0in'><p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>From:</span></b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'> Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] <b>On Behalf Of </b>Ingrid Hagen-Keith<br><b>Sent:</b> Monday, September 15, 2014 12:33 PM<br><b>To:</b> carpediem at lists.olin.edu<br><b>Subject:</b> [Carpediem] Better World by Design<o:p></o:p></span></p></div></div><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Hi all-<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>I&#8217;m going to the Better World by Design conference in Providence this weekend. I&#8217;m still deciding whether I am going to go on Friday morning or Saturday morning. I will be driving back on Sunday so you may have to find your own way back to Olin. Either way, if you are also going to the conference/want to spend some time in Providence, we could drive there together! <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>If this suits you, please e-mail me and we can sort out details.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Ingrid<o:p></o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Alex.Spies at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep 15 15:08:14 2014
From: Alex.Spies at students.olin.edu (Alex Spies)
Date: Mon, 15 Sep 2014 15:08:14 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] The Pottery Studio Opens Today
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E68C51@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi,
I would like to let everybody know about the opportunities at the Babson Ceramic Studio this semester. There are currently 3 potential options, Independent Studio Use and 2 beginner courses. The studio opens to users Today and the studio fee is $85, but Olin will reimburse $30 of this studio fee. It's not too late to sign-up. The studio fee pays for supplies and firings for the semester. The links for registration are below. Please let me know if you have any questions.

Intro to Clay<https://www.eventbrite.com/e/introduction-to-clay-registration-12874984425>                                                                       Wednesdays 4:00-6:00 PM

Foundations of Wheel Throwing<http://www.eventbrite.com/e/foundations-of-wheel-throwing-registration-12876200061>                               Mondays 5:00-7:00 PM

Independent Studio Use<https://www.eventbrite.com/e/independent-studio-use-registration-12875963353>                                              7 days a week 9:00 AM-9:00 PM



-          Alex Spies

From: Ofac [mailto:ofac-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of OFAC
Sent: Monday, September 15, 2014 17:32 PM
To: ofac at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Ofac] Practice times!

Practices are going to start at 9pm on Tuesdays. We will be making practice poi and giving introductory level lessons in a number of props for the whole practice tomorrow. Current members, you should still come and either help teach or do your own thing.

Practice will generally run for about an hour but we encourage people to stay longer!

See you all Tuesday night!

Fire Lords Evan and Brooks

From Julianne.Jorgensen at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep 15 18:52:44 2014
From: Julianne.Jorgensen at students.olin.edu (Julianne Jorgensen)
Date: Mon, 15 Sep 2014 18:52:44 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Day of the Girl Child Volunteering and Ideas
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E68D69@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello!

Day of the Girl Child<http://dayofthegirl.org/about/> (hyperlinked) is coming up on October 11th . This year the theme is "Innovating for Girls' Education". Members from SWE, SERV, and EDisco are working to pull together activities that we could use to help educate middle school girls from the surrounding areas. We are hoping to have tables where girls can go around and interact with Olin students or faculty and each other. We would love to have volunteers and hear about your ideas concerning various activities.

Thanks,
Julianne

From Mitchell.Cieminski at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep 15 20:01:46 2014
From: Mitchell.Cieminski at students.olin.edu (Mitchell Cieminski)
Date: Mon, 15 Sep 2014 20:01:46 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Free guitar to a good home for a semester
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E68DBE@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey guys,

I have a guitar. It's currently in the Jam Room. I'm not at Olin. It's taking up space. If you want to play it for a semester, have at it. When I get back to Olin, I'd like said guitar back though...
Let me know if you want it. Must retrieve it yourself, or pay a few thousand dollars to transport me to the US, a taxi to Olin, and a return trip to Brazil.

mitch

-----Original Message-----
From: Mariko Thorbecke 
Sent: segunda-feira, 15 de setembro de 2014 20:59
To: Students - Class of 2016; Students - Class of 2015; Students - Class of 2017; Students - Class of 2018
Subject: Get yo stuff out of the jam room

Ok guys, now that we've been here for two weeks, it's time for you to get your stuff OUT OF THE JAM ROOM.

The jam room is NOT storage, it is a place to play music. Instruments that are used on an EXTREMELY REGULAR BASIS may be stored here neatly along the wall. But all other instruments should be kept in your room.

Please please please come get yo stuff.

Thanks!

Mariko

Now in WH2 because of SERV.

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Juanita Desouza
Sent: Monday, September 15, 2014 9:04 AM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Bad FanFiction with CORRECT ical!



Correct ical attached! See below for info. Ginger snaps will be provided.




Hey WrOlin(Writers of Olin) is having a Bad FanFiction Night at 8:00 P.M. this Monday(9/15) in WH1 Lounge! Swing by to write some truly terrible fanfiction or just to hear what people have written so far.

Freshman this is the perfect opportunity to de-stress and pass no record after a long day of classes. For everyone else, this is the best time to have some fun before the school work actually hits.


Interested in creative writing? Stories? Poems? Interested in helping organize Bad Fanfiction Night? Come visit WrOlin and sign up for the coming mailing list(The mailing list will be made by this Friday.)!

~ Juanita

From Julianne.Jorgensen at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep 15 20:24:03 2014
From: Julianne.Jorgensen at students.olin.edu (Julianne Jorgensen)
Date: Mon, 15 Sep 2014 20:24:03 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Day of the Girl Child Volunteering and Ideas
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E68D69@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E68D69@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2E68E03@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Now with I-cal!

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Julianne Jorgensen
Sent: Monday, September 15, 2014 6:53 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Day of the Girl Child Volunteering and Ideas

Hello!

Day of the Girl Child<http://dayofthegirl.org/about/> (hyperlinked) is coming up on October 11th . This year the theme is "Innovating for Girls' Education". Members from SWE, SERV, and EDisco are working to pull together activities that we could use to help educate middle school girls from the surrounding areas. We are hoping to have tables where girls can go around and interact with Olin students or faculty and each other. We would love to have volunteers and hear about your ideas concerning various activities.

Thanks,
Julianne

This year the theme is <span style='font-size:20.0pt;color:#7030A0'>&#8220;Innovating for Girls&#8217; Education&#8221;</span><span style='font-size:20.0pt'>.</span> Members from SWE, SERV, and EDisco are working to pull together activities that we could use to help educate middle school girls from the surrounding areas. We are hoping to have tables where girls can <span style='font-size:13.0pt;color:red'>go around and interact</span><span style='color:#604A7B'> </span>with <span style='font-size:13.0pt;color:#00B050'>Olin students or faculty</span><span style='color:#00B050'> </span>and each other. <span style='font-size:13.0pt'>We would <u>love</u> to have volunteers and hear about your ideas concerning various activities</span>.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Thanks,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Julianne<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Bernard.Kahle at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep 15 21:59:59 2014
From: Bernard.Kahle at students.olin.edu (Bernard Kahle)
Date: Mon, 15 Sep 2014 21:59:59 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] SLAC Wed. 8pm - Intro to Python - Pizza!
Message-ID: <1AC24E68-8D85-4602-A1E0-3EA582E4CEFB@students.olin.edu>

SLAC! Join us Wednesday at 8pm in EH2 for a great evening of learning and creating.

This week we will by kicking off Introduction to Python!

Never coded before? New to Python? Want a refresher? Still confused by MatLab?

Come by at 8 for a great first lesson on all things wonderful about Python and software development!

Also this week, Pizza!
At 9pm, the Microsoft recruiter for Olin, Healy, will be coming by with pizza to hang out, meet people, and share information about Microsoft jobs and internships.

If I still haven?t convinced you, come on by anyway! Meet some cool people, work on homework or projects, and learn why SLAC is awesome!

Wednesday; 8pm; EH2

In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A306C426@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <EFD19D03-E316-43D3-A00F-4351B40B9B42@olin.edu>

Hi Carpe members,

I would like to share news about an applied mathematics conference at Smith college (2 hrs away) whose primary audience/presenters are undergraduate females. However, everyone is invited and its a great opportunity to network and learn about grad schools. Spread the word and sign up here:

http://www.math.smith.edu/~jhenle/wimin14/

The deadline for registration is today. Registration is free and I will be organizing transportation so people should sign up. Even if you are not 100% you can make it, you could sign up and let me know later.

Hope you can make it!

Chloe

From Caitrin.Lynch at olin.edu  Tue Sep 16 13:45:54 2014
From: Caitrin.Lynch at olin.edu (Caitrin Lynch)
Date: Tue, 16 Sep 2014 13:45:54 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Survey supporting campus climate research for students
 of color! (also, a chance to get $100 gift card)
Message-ID: <D03DEF10.9E632%caitrin.lynch@olin.edu>

FYI, some students may be interested in doing this. Caitrin

From: ROLF J STRAUBHAAR <straubhaar at ucla.edu<mailto:straubhaar at ucla.edu>>
Date: Tuesday, September 16, 2014 11:23 AM
To: "fem-anth-l at binhost.com<mailto:fem-anth-l at binhost.com>" <fem-anth-l at binhost.com<mailto:fem-anth-l at binhost.com>>
Subject: [Fem-anth-l Listserv for AFA] Survey supporting campus climate research for students of color! (also, a chance to get $100 gift card)


Attention all students (including graduate students)!

My colleagues and I at the University of Georgia's Center for Latino Achievement and Success in Education (CLASE) are conducting a research study focused on the cultural adaptation and identity development of college students (in particular college students of color).

We invite all who are currently enrolled in a university program and are over 18 years of age to complete the attached survey. It should only take 20-30 minutes, and completion will enter you in a raffle for a $100 gift card.

Participation in this survey is also a way in which you can personally influence the current literature on college students and their experiences, particularly with regard to race. Let your voice be heard!



https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/CYAS


Best,

Rolf Straubhaar, Ph.D.
Postdoctoral Research Associate
Center for Latino Achievement and Success in Education (CLASE)
University of Georgia
https://uga.academia.edu/RolfStraubhaar
http://www.coe.uga.edu/directory/profiles/rolf

From Charles.Goddard at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep 16 15:31:47 2014
From: Charles.Goddard at students.olin.edu (Charles Goddard)
Date: Tue, 16 Sep 2014 15:31:47 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Do you need an absurd length of RGB LED strip?
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A39E5EA3@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Yes. Yes you do.
I'm planning to buy an undisclosed number of five-meter reels of 3528 SMD RGB lighting strips. This means I'm very close to getting wholesale pricing. If enough people go in on an order, I can get us the astounding price of $3.80 per five meters.

Which would you rather have for ten dollars - a single Domino's pizza, or almost six times your height in LEDs?

Think about it. Let me know. I'll be waiting.

Charl?y

Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A39E5EC1@EXVS01.olin.edu>

As always, no experience required. Everyone's been scared once.

Love,
Greg, on behalf of Bill and Greg

From Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep 16 17:55:42 2014
From: Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu (Gregory Edelston)
Date: Tue, 16 Sep 2014 17:55:42 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] PUZZLES!!!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A39E5F67@EXVS01.olin.edu>

tl;dr: Puzzles is still happening! Same bat-time (Tuesdays 8-10PM), same bat-channel (AC 126).

ntl;r: Puzzles is a long-standing Olin activity which for years has been brought to us by professor Chris Morse. Unfortunately, Chris is no longer at this school, but Puzzles shall carry on in his honor!

Every Tuesday (including tonight), we'll be in AC 126 from 8-10 PM doing puzzles. Swing by! There's no membership, no commitment - it's just a fun thing to do.

What do I mean by puzzles? Well, imagine a crossword puzzle, or those logic puzzles with like "Mr. Brown lives next door to the man with the tennis racket." Those are a good starting point, but it gets so much more beautiful than that. Below are a few pretty good puzzles to get you hooked, and I'll suggest that you swing by tonight for more :D

Love,
Greg

P.S.: I tried sending this a few hours go, but for some reason I got (and didn't see) an automated message that it needed moderator approval. Now there's only a small amount of time! So be sure to tell all your friends so that people actually know that this is happening.

Word puzzle: http://cpclive.blob.core.windows.net/puzzles/2013/Wave1/Angels%20and%20Demons.pdf?sv=2012-02-12&st=2014-09-16T19%3A53%3A38Z&se=2014-09-16T20%3A48%3A38Z&sr=b&sp=r&sig=eFvGvyYNz2WCHRSRqEhNynmLy5t6tHKLWh%2FGN8oXNIA%3D
Weird puzzle: http://cpclive.blob.core.windows.net/puzzles/2013/Wave1/Lives%20of%20a%20Cell.pdf?sv=2012-02-12&st=2014-09-16T19%3A53%3A30Z&se=2014-09-16T20%3A48%3A30Z&sr=b&sp=r&sig=08n7hlFEml0xXwJ5zDtyHPGZTbt0gUBP2Piniv%2BCZNo%3D
Wtf puzzle: http://cpclive.blob.core.windows.net/puzzles/2013/Wave2/Shifty%20Characters.pdf?sv=2012-02-12&st=2014-09-16T19%3A53%3A33Z&se=2014-09-16T20%3A48%3A33Z&sr=b&sp=r&sig=xKZgKMvhsb3IC4t9XWagrs2ToHzOhM4XfUjJ7HwEysc%3D

	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}

	{mso-style-type:personal-reply;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-size:10.0pt;}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}

From: Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu (Gregory Edelston)

It has been brought to my attention that those links suck, because authentication. To access them, go to this page:
https://www.collegepuzzlechallenge.com/Archive/2013/Default.aspx
The ones I was attempting to link you to are: Angels and Demons, Lives of a Cell, Shifty Characters. No, the puzzle was not figuring out how to access the puzzles.

Sorry about that!
Gregor

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Gregory Edelston
Sent: Tuesday, September 16, 2014 5:56 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: Re: [Carpediem] PUZZLES!!!

tl;dr: Puzzles is still happening! Same bat-time (Tuesdays 8-10PM), same bat-channel (AC 126).

ntl;r: Puzzles is a long-standing Olin activity which for years has been brought to us by professor Chris Morse. Unfortunately, Chris is no longer at this school, but Puzzles shall carry on in his honor!

Every Tuesday (including tonight), we'll be in AC 126 from 8-10 PM doing puzzles. Swing by! There's no membership, no commitment - it's just a fun thing to do.

What do I mean by puzzles? Well, imagine a crossword puzzle, or those logic puzzles with like "Mr. Brown lives next door to the man with the tennis racket." Those are a good starting point, but it gets so much more beautiful than that. Below are a few pretty good puzzles to get you hooked, and I'll suggest that you swing by tonight for more :D

Love,
Greg

P.S.: I tried sending this a few hours go, but for some reason I got (and didn't see) an automated message that it needed moderator approval. Now there's only a small amount of time! So be sure to tell all your friends so that people actually know that this is happening.

Word puzzle: http://cpclive.blob.core.windows.net/puzzles/2013/Wave1/Angels%20and%20Demons.pdf?sv=2012-02-12&st=2014-09-16T19%3A53%3A38Z&se=2014-09-16T20%3A48%3A38Z&sr=b&sp=r&sig=eFvGvyYNz2WCHRSRqEhNynmLy5t6tHKLWh%2FGN8oXNIA%3D
Weird puzzle: http://cpclive.blob.core.windows.net/puzzles/2013/Wave1/Lives%20of%20a%20Cell.pdf?sv=2012-02-12&st=2014-09-16T19%3A53%3A30Z&se=2014-09-16T20%3A48%3A30Z&sr=b&sp=r&sig=08n7hlFEml0xXwJ5zDtyHPGZTbt0gUBP2Piniv%2BCZNo%3D
Wtf puzzle: http://cpclive.blob.core.windows.net/puzzles/2013/Wave2/Shifty%20Characters.pdf?sv=2012-02-12&st=2014-09-16T19%3A53%3A33Z&se=2014-09-16T20%3A48%3A33Z&sr=b&sp=r&sig=xKZgKMvhsb3IC4t9XWagrs2ToHzOhM4XfUjJ7HwEysc%3D

---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: SERV <CommunityService at olin.edu>
Date: Mon, Sep 15, 2014 at 10:01 PM
Subject: HB and SERV - Voting Time!
To: Students - Class of 2018 <Students-Classof2018 at olin.edu>, Students -
Class of 2017 <Students-Classof2017 at olin.edu>, Students - Class of 2016 <
Students-Classof2016 at olin.edu>, Students - Class of 2015 <
Students-Classof2015 at olin.edu>


Hello all,



It is time to VOTE!



https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1VrESOr90ZuTemhY0RsgI0XYRuYk3byPJxGg8UlsVfTs/viewform?usp=send_form



The ballots are live, and will be open *until* *10:00 PM* *tomorrow*.



If you?ve never voted at Olin before, or if you?ve forgotten how it works,
here?s a quick refresher of the rules. Here, we use what?s called approval
or excellence voting. That means vote for as many of your peers as you
think will be successful in whatever position they?re running for. For both
SERV and the Honor Board, there are two open spots. One of them must be
filled by a first year, but the other is open to anyone. Thus, we will
first take the first year with the highest vote total to fill the first
spot, and then fill the second spot with the student with the second
highest overall votes. Also, every vote matters! Each candidate must
receive a certain percentage of the votes regardless of whether their
position is contested or not, so we really need you to take two minutes and
make your voice heard!



The election packets are attached ? please be informed voters.



Thanks all!

<3 SERV and Honor Board
