         ((\     /   `}.~                     `.

          \\\  .{     }               /     \   \

      (\   \\~~       }              |       }   \

       \`.-~ -@~     }  ,-,.         |       )    \

       (___     ) _}  (    :        |    / /      `._

        `----._-~.     _\ \ |_       \   / /-.__     `._

               ~~----~~  \ \| ~~--~~~(  + /     ~-._    ~-._

                         /  /         \  \          ~--.,___~_-_.

                      __/  /          _\  )

                    .<___.'         .<___/







*From:* SERV
*Sent:* Monday, September 15, 2014 11:37 AM
*To:* Students - Class of 2018; Students - Class of 2017; Students - Class
of 2016; Students - Class of 2015
*Cc:* Honor Board; SERV
*Subject:* Election Time!



Hey everyone,



SERV and Honor Board are holding elections on *Monday, September 15*, which
happens to be today. (Sorry for the late notice.)



The elections will be kicked off by a brief candidate forum at *8:00PM in
WH1.* Read the attached candidate information packets, then come ask the
candidates questions and become an informed voter.



The ballots will be done electronically, and will be open from *10:00PM
Monday* to *10:00PM Tuesday*. More detailed voting instructions will be
sent out with the ballots later tonight.



Thanks! <3

SERV & HB



               __

              / _)   It?s Election Season!

     _.----._/ /

    /         /

__/ (  | (  |

/__.-'|_|--|_|
-------------- next part --------------
<div dir="ltr"><div>Don&#39;t forget! You have until 10PM tonight.</div><div><br></div><div>-Ari on behalf of SERV and HB</div><br><div class="gmail_quote">---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: <b class="gmail_sendername">SERV</b> <span dir="ltr">&lt;<a href="mailto:CommunityService at olin.edu">CommunityService at olin.edu</a>&gt;</span><br>Date: Mon, Sep 15, 2014 at 10:01 PM<br>Subject: HB and SERV - Voting Time!<br>To: Students - Class of 2018 &lt;<a href="mailto:Students-Classof2018 at olin.edu">Students-Classof2018 at olin.edu</a>&gt;, Students - Class of 2017 &lt;<a href="mailto:Students-Classof2017 at olin.edu">Students-Classof2017 at olin.edu</a>&gt;, Students - Class of 2016 &lt;<a href="mailto:Students-Classof2016 at olin.edu">Students-Classof2016 at olin.edu</a>&gt;, Students - Class of 2015 &lt;<a href="mailto:Students-Classof2015 at olin.edu">Students-Classof2015 at olin.edu</a>&gt;<br><br><br><div lang="EN-US" link="blue" vlink="purple"><div><p class="MsoNormal">Hello all,<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal"><u></u>?<u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal">It is time to VOTE!<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal"><u></u>?<u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal"><a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1VrESOr90ZuTemhY0RsgI0XYRuYk3byPJxGg8UlsVfTs/viewform?usp=send_form" target="_blank"><span style="color:windowtext">https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1VrESOr90ZuTemhY0RsgI0XYRuYk3byPJxGg8UlsVfTs/viewform?usp=send_form</span></a><u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="background:white"><u></u>?<u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="background:white">The ballots are live, and will be open?<b><span style="font-size:12.0pt">until</span></b><span style="font-size:12.0pt">?<b>10:00 PM</b>?<b>tomorrow</b></span>.<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="background:white">?<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="background:white">If you?ve never?voted?at Olin before, or if you?ve forgotten how it works, here?s a quick refresher of the rules. Here, we use what?s called approval or excellence?voting. That means vote?for as many of your peers as you think will be successful in whatever position they?re running for. For both SERV and the Honor Board, there are two open spots. One of them must be filled by a first year, but the other is open to anyone. Thus, we will first take the first year with the highest vote?total to fill the first spot, and then fill the second spot with the student with the second highest overall votes. Also, every vote matters! Each candidate must receive a certain percentage of the votes regardless of whether their position is contested or not, so we really need you to take two minutes and make your voice heard!<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="background:white"><u></u>?<u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="background:white">The election packets are attached ? please be informed voters.<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="background:white">?<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="background:white">Thanks all!<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="background:white">&lt;3 SERV and Honor Board<u></u><u></u></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="background:white"><span style="color:#222222">?<u></u><u></u></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="background:white"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;;color:#222222">??????????????????????????? __.--&#39;~~~~~`--.</span><span style="color:#222222"><u></u><u></u></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="background:white"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;;color:#222222">?????? ??..?????? __.??? .-~?????????????? ~-.</span><span style="color:#222222"><u></u><u></u></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="background:white"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:&quot;Courier New&quot;;color:#222222">???????? From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Charles Goddard
Sent: Tuesday, September 16, 2014 3:32 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Do you need an absurd length of RGB LED strip?

Yes. Yes you do.

I'm planning to buy an undisclosed number of five-meter reels of 3528 SMD RGB lighting strips. This means I'm very close to getting wholesale pricing. If enough people go in on an order, I can get us the astounding price of $3.80 per five meters.

Which would you rather have for ten dollars - a single Domino's pizza, or almost six times your height in LEDs?

Think about it. Let me know. I'll be waiting.

Charl?y

</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal>Hey-<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Broad City Club will be holding its first event tonight at 10:15 in EH1NW. Even if you didn&#8217;t sign up at club fair, please drop by and enjoy an episode with us!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Here are two clips that are relatively demonstrative from the web series (it is now a TV show):<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lx1moSRAI-M&amp;index=15&amp;list=PLEFB92B04BF2F112C">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lx1moSRAI-M&amp;index=15&amp;list=PLEFB92B04BF2F112C</a><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_D9BoEP_kWE&amp;index=17&amp;list=PLEFB92B04BF2F112C">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_D9BoEP_kWE&amp;index=17&amp;list=PLEFB92B04BF2F112C</a><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Hope to see you there!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Ingrid<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Christopher.Willis at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep 16 16:05:35 2014
From: Christopher.Willis at students.olin.edu (Christopher Willis)
Date: Tue, 16 Sep 2014 16:05:35 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] PUZZLES!!!
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A39E5ECA@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A39E5ECA@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A39E5ED3@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Now with iCal.

From: Gregory Edelston
Sent: Tuesday, September 16, 2014 4:01 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Cc: Joshua Langowitz; Graham Hooton; Evan Dorsky; Christopher Willis; Mary Ruthven; Amanda Lee; Jacob Kingery; Cullen Ross; Bernard Kahle; Ankeet Mutha; Victoria Coleman; Chelsea Bailey; Radmer van der Heyde; Tatiana Anthony; Margaret Lidrbauch; Kyle McConnaughay; Saarth Mehrotra; Raagini Rameshwar; Toni Saylor; Kevin Suzuki
Subject: PUZZLES!!!

tl;dr: Puzzles is still happening! Same bat-time (Tuesdays 8-10PM), same bat-channel (AC 126).

ntl;r: Puzzles is a long-standing Olin activity which for years has been brought to us by professor Chris Morse. Unfortunately, Chris is no longer at this school, but Puzzles shall carry on in his honor!

Every Tuesday (including tonight), we'll be in AC 126 from 8-10 PM doing puzzles. Swing by! There's no membership, no commitment - it's just a fun thing to do.

What do I mean by puzzles? Well, imagine a crossword puzzle, or those logic puzzles with like "Mr. Brown lives next door to the man with the tennis racket." Those are a good starting point, but it gets so much more beautiful than that. Below are a few pretty good puzzles to get you hooked, and I'll suggest that you swing by tonight for more :D

Love,
Greg

Word puzzle: http://cpclive.blob.core.windows.net/puzzles/2013/Wave1/Angels%20and%20Demons.pdf?sv=2012-02-12&st=2014-09-16T19%3A53%3A38Z&se=2014-09-16T20%3A48%3A38Z&sr=b&sp=r&sig=eFvGvyYNz2WCHRSRqEhNynmLy5t6tHKLWh%2FGN8oXNIA%3D
Weird puzzle: http://cpclive.blob.core.windows.net/puzzles/2013/Wave1/Lives%20of%20a%20Cell.pdf?sv=2012-02-12&st=2014-09-16T19%3A53%3A30Z&se=2014-09-16T20%3A48%3A30Z&sr=b&sp=r&sig=08n7hlFEml0xXwJ5zDtyHPGZTbt0gUBP2Piniv%2BCZNo%3D
Wtf puzzle: http://cpclive.blob.core.windows.net/puzzles/2013/Wave2/Shifty%20Characters.pdf?sv=2012-02-12&st=2014-09-16T19%3A53%3A33Z&se=2014-09-16T20%3A48%3A33Z&sr=b&sp=r&sig=xKZgKMvhsb3IC4t9XWagrs2ToHzOhM4XfUjJ7HwEysc%3D

From Jessica.Townsend at olin.edu  Tue Sep 16 18:05:00 2014
From: Jessica.Townsend at olin.edu (Jessica Townsend)
Date: Tue, 16 Sep 2014 18:05:00 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] National Collegiate Research Conference at Harvard in
	January
Message-ID: <D03E2ACC.68406%jessica.townsend@olin.edu>

Hello CarpePeople,

I am experimenting with ways to share opportunities that students might be interested in without spamming StudentsAll. I would love for someone (perhaps the carpe moderator) to let me know if this is a reasonable use of this list (or suggest alternatives!).

So here?s the opportunity ? a pretty awesome looking undergraduate research conference at Harvard in January. You could just go, or you could go and present your work. The keynotes speakers look great, and the activities they?ve planned revolve around a lot of active engagement and problem solving. Oh, and apparently you get a free t-shirt too.

Check out the email below. I sent it to faculty as well so they?d know more about it.

Happy Tuesday,

Jessica



From: Christine Xu [mailto:christinexu at college.harvard.edu]
Sent: Wednesday, September 10, 2014 10:20 PM
To: Olin Gear
Subject: National Collegiate Research Conference


Dear Ms. Patterson,



My name is Christine Xu and I am a member of the Harvard College Undergraduate Research Association (HCURA). I would like to extend an invitation to undergraduate students at Olin to attend HCURA?s National Collegiate Research Conference (NCRC) on January 22-24, 2014. NCRC is currently the nation?s largest student-run national research organization. Over the past few years, it has grown to include an audience of 200 of the nation?s top undergraduate researchers and dozens of notable keynote speakers<http://ncrc.hcura.org/learn/keynotes/>.


NCRC is an opportunity for undergraduate researchers to share their work at poster sessions and to give plenary speaker presentations while hearing from inspiring leaders in various fields of research. This year, we will be featuring notable keynote speakers including the Editor-in-Chief of Science, Marcia McNutt; the director of the world?s largest biomedical engineering lab, MIT Professor Robert Langer; Temple Grandin, a global leader for the rights of autistic persons and animal welfare; and Dean of Harvard College, Donald Pfister. Topics in the sciences, humanities, and interdisciplinary fields are all encouraged.


I would appreciate if you could share this invitation with students who you believe will be interested in attending so that they can place it on their calendars. The application deadline for plenary speakers is October 15th, and the final deadline for general participants is November 1st. Additionally, you can find information about travel scholarships, housing, and registration on our website, http://ncrc.hcura.org/.


Thank you for your interest in NCRC - I am happy to answer questions

that you or students may have.


Best Regards,


Christine

-------------- next part --------------

From Alexander.Crease at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 17 11:57:55 2014
From: Alexander.Crease at students.olin.edu (Alexander Crease)
Date: Wed, 17 Sep 2014 11:57:55 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] 3D Printing on the Replicators
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A39E62F2@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey Guys,

As many of you may have seen, Olin's Replicator 2s are in the Library. Here are some things you should know, even if you have been trained already:


*         Even if you are trained, don't use the printers yet. The NINJAs are still in the process of setting up the space.

*         As a temporary measure, we will be taking work orders.

*         Send part files (in .stl or .thing format) to replicators at lists.olin.edu<mailto:replicators at lists.olin.edu>, with how many of each part you need and when you need them by. THIS IS TEMPORARY.

*         We will be prioritizing classes, then research, then student teams, then passionate pursuits, and then personal projects

*         If you are interested in getting trained, training and our new procedures will begin in approximately 2 weeks, once the space has been set up

*         MakerBot has a new software we suggest you download, called MakerBot Desktop. It is available on the MakerBot webpage.

*         Our hours will be posted soon by the printers in the library

*         The 3D printing NINJAs are in the process of setting up the space and figuring out where they should go in the Library (yes, we have heard people are worried about noise)

*         The Library is currently being re-vamped as a sort of creative workspace. If you are interested in this, please talk to the Library director Jeff Goldenson or attend The Olin Workshop on the Library co-curricular

*         We will probably be bringing in one more Replicator 2 and two Replicator 2Xs.

If you have any questions, comments, suggestions, or concerns, please email any questions to replicators at lists.olin.edu<mailto:replicators at lists.olin.edu>

-Alexander Crease

-------------- next part --------------

</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal>Hey Guys,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>As many of you may have seen, Olin&#8217;s Replicator 2s are in the Library. Here are some things you should know, even if you have been trained already:<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='margin-left:1.0in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>&middot;<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]><b>Even if you are trained</b>, don&#8217;t use the printers yet. The NINJAs are still in the process of setting up the space.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='margin-left:1.0in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>&middot;<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]>As a temporary measure, we will be taking work orders. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='margin-left:1.0in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>&middot;<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]>Send part files (in .<b>stl</b> or <b>.thing</b> format) to <a href="mailto:replicators at lists.olin.edu">replicators at lists.olin.edu</a>, with how many of each part you need and when you need them by. THIS IS TEMPORARY.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='margin-left:1.0in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>&middot;<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]>We will be prioritizing classes, then research, then student teams, then passionate pursuits, and then personal projects<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='margin-left:1.0in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>&middot;<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]>If you are interested in getting trained, training and our new procedures will begin in approximately 2 weeks, once the space has been set up<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='margin-left:1.0in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-family:Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>&middot;<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><![endif]>MakerBot has a new software we suggest you download, called MakerBot Desktop. From Charles.Goddard at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 17 12:14:10 2014
From: Charles.Goddard at students.olin.edu (Charles Goddard)
Date: Wed, 17 Sep 2014 12:14:10 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Do you need an absurd length of RGB LED strip?
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A39E5EA3@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A39E6304@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Just an update - I will be placing the order sometime tonight, and it looks like the price will be either $4.14 or $4.00 a reel depending on the final count.

If you're interested in getting in on the order, please fill out this form:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1iGDIRPjDLEN04CYpDUWD2yUDT9vRt8h_rC34y7N-YTk/viewform?usp=send_form

Thanks,
Charl?y

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Charles Goddard
Sent: Tuesday, September 16, 2014 3:32 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Do you need an absurd length of RGB LED strip?

Yes. Yes you do.

I'm planning to buy an undisclosed number of five-meter reels of 3528 SMD RGB lighting strips. This means I'm very close to getting wholesale pricing. If enough people go in on an order, I can get us the astounding price of $3.80 per five meters.

Which would you rather have for ten dollars - a single Domino's pizza, or almost six times your height in LEDs?

Think about it. Let me know. I'll be waiting.

Charl?y

From Sara.Hendren at olin.edu  Wed Sep 17 12:44:13 2014
From: Sara.Hendren at olin.edu (Sara Hendren)
Date: Wed, 17 Sep 2014 12:44:13 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] bionic hands, body socks,
 cardboard furniture: adaptive + assistive co-curricular
Message-ID: <D03F329D.5A1%sara.hendren@olin.edu>

Starts tomorrow, Thursday, Sept 18, at 11 am in AC 313! Open to all.

We?ve already got a great group signed up for the Adaptive + Assistive Technology co-curricular. Each week will be a different look at some devices/media around accessibility and technology or design.

If you want to join, drop in anytime?confirmed guests include Larry Goldberg, director of accessibility initiatives at Yahoo; Mike Benning, a bionic hand user and business development professional at Hanger, a local prosthetics design firm; and our own faculty working in the adaptive and assistive/prosthetics space: Alex Morrow on adaptive blind sailing, Paul Ruvolo on assistive software, and Caitrin Lynch showing various past Engineering for Humanity projects on technology and aging.

I?ll also introduce some of my own work and ask the community for ideas about what the Adaptation + Ability Group can do in the future. And occasionally there will be snacks. Snacks!

Sara Hendren



-------------- next part --------------
<html><head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=Windows-1252"></head><body style="word-wrap: break-word; -webkit-nbsp-mode: space; -webkit-line-break: after-white-space; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><div><font face="Helvetica" style="font-size: 16px;">Starts tomorrow, Thursday, Sept 18, at 11 am in AC 313! And occasionally there will be snacks. Snacks!</font></div><div><font face="Helvetica" style="font-size: 16px;"><br></font></div><div><font face="Helvetica" style="font-size: 16px;">Sara Hendren</font></div><div style="font-size: 14px; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"><br></div><div style="font-size: 14px; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;">&nbsp;</div><br></body></html>

From Ryan.Louie at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 17 16:07:58 2014
From: Ryan.Louie at students.olin.edu (Ryan Louie)
Date: Wed, 17 Sep 2014 16:07:58 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Dinner w/ Faculty
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A39E645D@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Interested in dining off-campus with Olin professors?  Chris Lee and Jean Huang have invited students to accompany them for two small table dinners.



Dine out with Chris Lee on Monday, September 22nd to Singh's Cafe. Limited to 5 students.

Dine out with Jean Huang on Wednesday, September 24th. Limited to 5 students. Once attendees are confirmed, Jean would like to communicate with her party to democratically decide on a restaurant.


SASE, the Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers, is happy to provide $10 in partial funding per person.  Please drop off receipts to WH312 so that the partial reimbursement via direct deposit can be processed.  Rides to the restaurant should be coordinated amongst the attendees.  Once signups are completed, a second email will go out to your entire party to connect you with your faculty host.



Sign up here!

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZQx8B3zKw9shSqKSe0q_LQJiPa6ieFVCQ4wahFs1RdA/edit#gid=0


Sincerely yours,

From Chelsea.Bailey at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 17 19:11:15 2014
From: Chelsea.Bailey at students.olin.edu (Chelsea Bailey)
Date: Wed, 17 Sep 2014 19:11:15 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Full-stack developer position
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A39E64E9@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi all!

A Babson graduate got in touch with me looking to hire someone who is skilled in PHP, JS, or both. His pitch is below

HigherMe uses data and video to help retail and service employers find, screen, and hire better employees faster.

We're part of MassChallenge, and won the Babson B.E.T.A. Challenge this year. We're looking for some paid contract development work - PHP (we use symfony2) and/or JavaScript (angular JS) - that could ideally lead to a full-time position. Someone full-stack would be ideal, but a rockstar on either end is also fine.

Check out a quick video of our pitch right here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x-B9IrFLRSo


Reply to me if you're interested and I'll get you in touch with them!

Thanks!
Chelsea

Charl?y

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Charles Goddard
Sent: Tuesday, September 16, 2014 3:32 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:carpediem at lists.olin.edu>
Subject: [Carpediem] Do you need an absurd length of RGB LED strip?

Yes. Yes you do.

I'm planning to buy an undisclosed number of five-meter reels of 3528 SMD RGB lighting strips. This means I'm very close to getting wholesale pricing. If enough people go in on an order, I can get us the astounding price of $3.80 per five meters.

Which would you rather have for ten dollars - a single Domino's pizza, or almost six times your height in LEDs?

Think about it. Let me know. I'll be waiting.

Charl?y

From sophia.li at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 17 19:49:09 2014
From: sophia.li at students.olin.edu (Sophia Li)
Date: Wed, 17 Sep 2014 19:49:09 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] "Pass no Record" and "Cafe Diem" open tonight!
Message-ID: <541A1DF5.8010005@students.olin.edu>

Hello Carpe!

Wednesdays are super stressful, and we at WH 4N want to make it better!

For the first years coming out of TIPS at 11 tonight, and all our other
Carpe friends, the Pass No Record (WH 423) and Cafe Diem (WH 429) will
be open from 11:30 - 1 today!

Pass No Record will be serving various drinks, while Cafe Diem will have
muffins, cookies, pie, and tea available. Come chill out with us and
de-stress a bit before heading into Thursday!

Love,
-Sophie & WH4N

We have Classic Chocolate Cupcakes w/ Peanut butter-Chocolate Icing, Devil's Food Cupcakes w/ Classic Chocolate Icing, & Ghirardelli Triple Chocolate Truffle Cupcakes tonight. There are Vegan and Gluten Free options available!

"This is up there as a contender for the best thing that ever happened to me." - Caleb, '16

From Charles.Gwennap at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 17 22:45:28 2014
From: Charles.Gwennap at students.olin.edu (Charles Gwennap)
Date: Wed, 17 Sep 2014 22:45:28 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Defenestration of the Envelopes!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A39E660C@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey Carpe diem!

Have you ever seen 100 Envelopes dropped out of a 4th story window?

You haven't?

Well, 100 envelopes are dropping out of 429F, of the East Hall 4NW suite, at 6pm on Thursday. Best viewing spots are from the lawn between the dorms.

Do you have items you would like to have defenestrated?

All items which don't break upon impact with the ground shall be accepted as tribute (from a 4th story window, cats do not have sufficient time to right themselves). Bring them to 429F shortly before defenestration time.

Best,
-Chaz

</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal>For anyone interested, 21 Jump street playing in 10 minutes in WH 3 Lounge.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Regards,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Manik Singh Sethi<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div></body></html>

HigherMe uses data and video to help retail and service employers find, screen, and hire better employees faster.

We're part of MassChallenge, and won the Babson B.E.T.A. Challenge this year. We're looking for some paid contract development work - PHP (we use symfony2) and/or JavaScript (angular JS) - that could ideally lead to a full-time position. Someone full-stack would be ideal, but a rockstar on either end is also fine.

From Rebecca.Christianson at olin.edu  Thu Sep 18 16:04:55 2014
From: Rebecca.Christianson at olin.edu (Rebecca J. Christianson)
Date: Thu, 18 Sep 2014 16:04:55 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] For First Years:  Money for using Matlab
Message-ID: <74EC63270F70E84EBE31C4588324B476012028D6255F@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi!

I've done usability exercises for Mathworks (in Natick, just nearby) before.  It is kind of fun, and pays pretty well (see below).  They are looking for a few students who are just starting out in using Matlab to run some usability studies.  Please contact them directly with the answers to the questions in the email if you are interested.

Rebecca

From: US-Usability-Recruiting [mailto:usabilityrecruiting at mathworks.com]
Sent: Thursday, September 18, 2014 12:42 PM
To: Rebecca J. Christianson
Subject: MathWorks Usability Research Opportunity - Learning MATLAB

Hi Rebecca,
I was wondering if you have any students Olin who are just starting out with MATLAB that might be interested in participating in a usability research session on the topic of trying to learn MATLAB.
Below is the email that we're sending out to people that we think might be a good fit. Feel free to forward this on or give us some contact information of people you think we should reach out to.
Thank you!


Cindy Chiuchiolo

Usability Recruiting Team Lead
User Experience Department at MathWorks<https://www.mathworks.com/products/usability/index.html>
usabilityrecruiting at mathworks.com<mailto:usabilityrecruiting at mathworks.com>
508 433 5555
---
We are looking for people learning to use MATLAB to participate in a usability research session.  Are you, or do you know anyone who might be, interested in participating?
The usability session will be held at MathWorks headquarters in Natick and will take approximately two hours. The time is flexible, and we can schedule it for a day and time that works best for you.  You will also be offered a $150 stipend as compensation for your time.

If you're interested in participating, please respond to this e-mail with answers to the following questions or call me at 508-433-5555. Please note that you are not required to answer yes to all of these questions to qualify.


1.       Are you new to MATLAB?

2.       How long have you been using MATLAB and how often do you use it?

3.       Do you write your own scripts in MATLAB?


What is usability research?
Usability research enables MathWorks developers to talk to users of MathWorks products to gather feedback on what works well and what could work better. During the session, we will ask you to work through typical tasks and give us your feedback.

Thank you,


Cindy Chiuchiolo

Usability Recruiting Team Lead
User Experience Department at MathWorks<https://www.mathworks.com/products/usability/index.html>
usabilityrecruiting at mathworks.com<mailto:usabilityrecruiting at mathworks.com>
508 433 5555


-------------- next part --------------

</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link="#0563C1" vlink="#954F72"><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'>Hi!<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'>I&#8217;ve done usability exercises for Mathworks (in Natick, just nearby) before.&nbsp; It is kind of fun, and pays pretty well (see below).&nbsp; They are looking for a few students who are just starting out in using Matlab to run some usability studies.&nbsp; Please contact them directly with the answers to the questions in the email if you are interested.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'>Rebecca<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><div><div style='border:none;border-top:solid #B5C4DF 1.0pt;padding:3.0pt 0in 0in 0in'><p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>From:</span></b><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'> US-Usability-Recruiting [mailto:usabilityrecruiting at mathworks.com] <br><b>Sent:</b> Thursday, September 18, 2014 12:42 PM<br><b>To:</b> Rebecca J. Christianson<br><b>Subject:</b> MathWorks Usability Research Opportunity - Learning MATLAB<o:p></o:p></span></p></div></div><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Hi Rebecca,<span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span style='color:#2D2F32'>I was wondering if you have any students Olin who are just starting out with MATLAB that might be interested in participating in a usability research session on the topic of trying to learn MATLAB.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span style='color:#2D2F32'>Below is the email that we&#8217;re sending out to people that we think might be a good fit. Feel free to forward this on or give us some contact information of people you think we should reach out to.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span style='color:#2D2F32'>Thank you!<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><b><i>Cindy Chiuchiolo <o:p></o:p></i></b></p><p class=MsoNormal><i><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></i></p><p class=MsoNormal><b>Usability Recruiting Team Lead<o:p></o:p></b></p><p class=MsoNormal><a href="https://www.mathworks.com/products/usability/index.html"><b><span style='color:#ED7D31'>User Experience Department at MathWorks</span></b></a><b><span style='color:#ED7D31'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p><p class=MsoNormal><a href="mailto:usabilityrecruiting at mathworks.com"><span style='color:blue'>usabilityrecruiting at mathworks.com</span></a><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>508 433 5555<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span style='color:#2D2F32'>---<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span style='color:#2D2F32'>We are looking for <b>people learning to use MATLAB </b>to participate in a usability research session.&nbsp; </span>Are you, or do you know anyone who might be, interested in participating?<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>The usability session will be held at MathWorks headquarters in Natick and will take approximately two hours. The time is flexible, and we can schedule it for a day and time that works best for you.&nbsp; You will also be offered a $150 stipend as compensation for your time.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>If you&#8217;re interested in participating, please respond to this e-mail with <b><i>answers to the following questions</i></b> or call me at 508-433-5555. <b><i><u>Please note that you are not required to answer yes to all of these questions to qualify.</u></i></b><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in'><b><i>1.</i></b><b><i><span style='font-size:7.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Are you new to MATLAB?<o:p></o:p></i></b></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in'><b><i>2.</i></b><b><i><span style='font-size:7.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>How long have you been using MATLAB and how often do you use it?<o:p></o:p></i></b></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in'><b><i>3.</i></b><b><i><span style='font-size:7.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Do you write your own scripts in MATLAB?<o:p></o:p></i></b></p><p class=MsoListParagraph><b><i><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></i></b></p><p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:6.0pt'><b>What is usability research?<o:p></o:p></b></p><p class=MsoNormal>Usability research enables MathWorks developers to talk to users of MathWorks products to gather feedback on what works well and what could work better. During the session, we will ask you to work through typical tasks and give us your feedback. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Thank you,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><b><i>Cindy Chiuchiolo <o:p></o:p></i></b></p><p class=MsoNormal><i><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></i></p><p class=MsoNormal><b>Usability Recruiting Team Lead<o:p></o:p></b></p><p class=MsoNormal><a href="https://www.mathworks.com/products/usability/index.html"><b><span style='color:#ED7D31'>User Experience Department at MathWorks</span></b></a><b><span style='color:#ED7D31'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p><p class=MsoNormal><a href="mailto:usabilityrecruiting at mathworks.com"><span style='color:blue'>usabilityrecruiting at mathworks.com</span></a><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>508 433 5555<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div></body></html>

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Charles Gwennap
Sent: Wednesday, September 17, 2014 10:45 PM
To: Carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Defenestration of the Envelopes!

Hey Carpe diem!

Have you ever seen 100 Envelopes dropped out of a 4th story window?

You haven't?

Well, 100 envelopes are dropping out of 429F, of the East Hall 4NW suite, at 6pm on Thursday. Best viewing spots are from the lawn between the dorms.

Do you have items you would like to have defenestrated?

All items which don't break upon impact with the ground shall be accepted as tribute (from a 4th story window, cats do not have sufficient time to right themselves). Bring them to 429F shortly before defenestration time.

Best,
-Chaz

From David.Pudlo at students.olin.edu  Thu Sep 18 22:04:41 2014
From: David.Pudlo at students.olin.edu (David Pudlo)
Date: Thu, 18 Sep 2014 22:04:41 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] BanterFest
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A39E6B83@EXVS01.olin.edu>

[cid:image001.png at 01CFD38C.7CEE7C00]
What was it like in the early years?
Before East Hall? When Milas Hall was called the Olin Center?
What's it like in the real world? What do alums miss most about the Bubble?

Come by for BanterFest
at Alumni Weekend

Connect with some visiting alumni!
Share stories in a match-and-share activity.
If you find someone you really jive with,
you can become Banter Buddies for the new year!

Saturday, 2:00-3:30, in the Oval
Desserts & caffeine served

From Yevgeniya.Zastavker at olin.edu  Fri Sep 19 09:00:31 2014
From: Yevgeniya.Zastavker at olin.edu (Yevgeniya Zastavker)
Date: Fri, 19 Sep 2014 09:00:31 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] GCSP: Invitation for 9/24 Academic Conference Call:
 "Confronting the Ebola Outbreak"
In-Reply-To: <74EC63270F70E84EBE31C4588324B476012028F4ACB5@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <CFRBLASTg4e2eNK67bk00042f0e@CFRBLAST.cfr.org>
	<039C32BB-5911-4FB7-92AC-490D82B5E80B@olin.edu>,
	<74EC63270F70E84EBE31C4588324B476012028F4ACB5@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <74EC63270F70E84EBE31C4588324B476012028A9B994@EXVS01.olin.edu>

 Hi, All,

Olin students have been invited t participate in this conference call re: global health situation confronting us at this very moment. Although I am specifically targeting Grand Challenge Scholars Program (GCSP) students who are concerned with Global Health issues, this is really a call to everyone.  Please, forward to those who may be interested beyond the senior class and Carpe.

If you are planning on joining the call, please email me ASAP, so that I can get a group of students together on a call (see below).

Looking forward to hearing many of you respond,
Zhenya



Yevgeniya V. Zastavker
Associate Professor of Physics
Director of Olin Grand Challenge Scholars Program
Franklin W. Olin College of Engineering
Olin Way

Begin forwarded message:
From: Council on Foreign Relations <Academic at cfr.org<mailto:Academic at cfr.org>>
Date: September 18, 2014 at 5:41:25 PM EDT
To: "Richard K. Miller" <Richard.Miller at olin.edu<mailto:Richard.Miller at olin.edu>>
Cc: Nancy Sullivan <Nancy.Sullivan at olin.edu<mailto:Nancy.Sullivan at olin.edu>>
Subject: CFR Invitation for 9/24 Academic Conference Call: "Confronting the Ebola Outbreak"
Reply-To: "Academic at cfr.org<mailto:Academic at cfr.org>" <Academic at cfr.org<mailto:Academic at cfr.org>>
Dear Rick:

On behalf of the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR), I invite you and your students to participate in the next session of the Fall 2014 CFR Academic Conference Call series on Wednesday, September 24, from 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. (ET). Laurie Garrett, CFR's senior fellow for global health, will discuss the Ebola epidemic in West Africa and the evolving global response. **Please note the change in time and topic of this Academic Conference Call.**

Ms. Garrett's expertise includes global health systems, chronic and infectious diseases, and bioterrorism. She received the 1996 Pulitzer Prize for her coverage of the Ebola epidemic in Kikwit, Zaire in 1995. During that epidemic she resided in Kikwit and tracked cases from village-to-village. Details of her coverage can be found in "Betrayal of Trust," published in 2000 by Hyperion. Ms. Garrett is the only writer ever to have been awarded the three Big "Ps" of journalism: the Peabody, the Polk, and the Pulitzer. She is the best-selling author of "The Coming Plague: Newly Emerging Diseases in a World Out of Balance" and "Betrayal of Trust: The Collapse of Global Public Health." Ms. Garrett has written for many publications, including the "Los Angeles Times," "Washington Post," and "Foreign Affairs," and has also appeared on national television programs, such as ABC's "Nightline," "NewsHour with Jim Lehrer," and "The Charlie Rose Show."

In order to encourage student participation, professors typically convene as a group in a classroom or their office around a speaker phone. Please reply to this email if you would like to make this call available to your students, and we will send you the toll-free dial-in number and password one day prior to the call.

As background for the discussion, you may wish to have your students review the following materials:

1) Laurie Garrett, "Epic Failures Feeding Ebola Crisis," Interview with Danielle Renwick, CFR.org<http://CFR.org>, September 18, 2014.
http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/epic-failures-feeding-ebola-crisis/p33465?cid=emc-ACC-Interview-092414
2) Laurie Garrett, "Can the U.S. Army Degrade and Destroy Ebola?" Foreign Policy, September 16, 2014.
http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/can-us-army-degrade-destroy-ebola/p33456?cid=emc-ACC-pandemic-092414
3) Laurie Garrett, "We Could Have Stopped This," Foreign Policy, September 16, 2014.
http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/we-could-have-stopped/p33398?cid=emc-ACC-we_could_have_stopped_this-092414
4) "White House Fact Sheet: U.S. Response to the Ebola Epidemic in West Africa," White House, September 16, 2014.
http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/white-house-fact-sheet-us-response-ebola-epidemic-west-africa/p33440#?cid=emc-ACC-white_house_fact_sheet-092414
5) "World Health Organization: Ebola Response Roadmap," World Health Organization, August 28, 2014.
http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/world-health-organization-ebola-response-roadmap/p33459?cid=emc-ACC-who_ebola-092414

I hope you will visit our portal on the CFR website at www.cfr.org/educators<http://www.cfr.org/educators>, where you will find CFR and "Foreign Affairs" tools and resources designed specifically for the academic community and announcements about upcoming events. Please don't hesitate to call or email Catalina Caro at 212.434.9564 or academic at cfr.org<mailto:academic at cfr.org> should you have any questions.

Best regards,
Irina

Irina A. Faskianos
Vice President, National Program & Outreach,
Council on Foreign Relations
58 East 68th Street, New York, New York 10065
tel 212.434.9465   cell 201.463.4515   fax 212.434.9829
ifaskianos at cfr.org<mailto:ifaskianos at cfr.org>   www.cfr.org<http://www.cfr.org>

*************************************************

SCHEDULE FOR FALL 2014 ACADEMIC CONFERENCE CALL SERIES

Thursday, October 9, 12:00 to 1:00 p.m. (ET)
"The U.S.-India Relationship"
Alyssa Ayres, Senior Fellow for India Pakistan and South Asia, CFR

Wednesday, October 22, 12:00 to 1:00 p.m. (ET)
"The Future of Guantanamo Bay"
Matthew C. Waxman, Adjunct Senior Fellow for Law and Foreign Policy, CFR

Tuesday, November 6, 12:00 to 1:00 p.m. (ET)
"NAFTA at Twenty"
Shannon K. O'Neil, Senior Fellow for Latin America Studies, CFR

Thursday, November 20, 12:00 to 1:00 p.m. (ET)
"U.S.-China Relations"
Robert D. Blackwill, Henry A. Kissinger Senior Fellow for U.S. Foreign Policy, CFR

Thursday, December 4, 12:00 to 1:00 p.m. (ET)
"The Implications of Drones on U.S. Foreign Policy"
Micah Zenko, Douglas Dillon Fellow, CFR
Sarah Kreps, Associate Professor, Cornell University

***If you do not wish to receive emails regarding the Academic Conference Call series, please reply to this email and type "unsubscribe" in the subject line before sending.***

<div style="FONT-SIZE: x-small; FONT-FAMILY: Tahoma; COLOR: #000000; DIRECTION: ltr">
<div>&nbsp;Hi, All,</div>
<div><font face="tahoma"></font>&nbsp;</div>
<div><font face="tahoma">Olin students have been invited t participate in this conference call re: global health situation confronting us at this very moment. Although I am specifically targeting
<em>Grand Challenge Scholars Program (GCSP<a></a>)</em> students who are concerned with Global Health issues, this is really a call to everyone.&nbsp; Please, forward to those who may be interested beyond the senior class and Carpe.</font></div>
<div><font face="tahoma"></font>&nbsp;</div>
<div><font face="tahoma">If you are planning on joining the call, please <em>email me ASAP</em>, so that I can get a group of students together on a call (see below).</font></div>
<div><font face="tahoma"></font>&nbsp;</div>
<div><font face="tahoma">Looking forward to hearing many of you respond,</font></div>
<div><font face="tahoma"><a><font face="tahoma">Zhenya</font></a></font></div>
<div><font face="tahoma"></font>&nbsp;</div>
<div><font face="tahoma"></font>&nbsp;</div>
<div><font face="tahoma"></font>&nbsp;</div>
<div>

<p class="MsoNormal"><b><span style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d"><a></a><b><span style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d"><a></a></span></b><b><span style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d"><b><span style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d"><a></a></span></b></span></b><b><span style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d"><b><span style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d"><b><span style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri','sans-serif'; COLOR: #1f497d">Yevgeniya</span></b></span></b></span></b>&nbsp;V.

<blockquote style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5pt; MARGIN-TOP: 5pt">
<div>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt"><b>From:</b> Council on Foreign Relations &lt;<a href="mailto:Academic at cfr.org">Academic at cfr.org</a><a></a>&gt;<br>
<b>Date:</b> September 18, 2014 at 5:41:25 PM EDT<br>
<b>To:</b> &quot;Richard K. Miller&quot; &lt;<a href="mailto:Richard.Miller at olin.edu">Richard.Miller at olin.edu</a><a></a>&gt;<br>
<b>Cc:</b> Nancy Sullivan &lt;<a href="mailto:Nancy.Sullivan at olin.edu">Nancy.Sullivan at olin.edu</a><a></a>&gt;<br>
<b>Subject:</b>&nbsp;<b><b>CFR</b><a></a> Invitation for 9/24 Academic Conference Call: &quot;Confronting the Ebola Outbreak&quot;</b><br>
<b>Reply-To:</b> &quot;<a href="mailto:Academic at cfr.org">Academic at cfr.org</a><a></a>&quot; &lt;<a href="mailto:Academic at cfr.org">Academic at cfr.org</a><a></a>&gt;</p>
</div>
</blockquote>
<blockquote style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5pt; MARGIN-TOP: 5pt">
<div>
<p class="MsoNormal">Dear Rick: <br>
<br>
On behalf of the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR<a></a>), I invite you and your students to participate in the next session of the Fall 2014&nbsp;CFR<a></a> Academic Conference Call series on Wednesday, September 24, from 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. (ET). Laurie
 Garrett,&nbsp;CFR's<a></a> senior fellow for global health, will discuss the Ebola epidemic in West Africa and the evolving global response. **Please note the change in time and topic of this Academic Conference Call.**<br>
<br>
Ms. Garrett's expertise includes global health systems, chronic and infectious diseases, and bioterrorism. She received the 1996 Pulitzer Prize for her coverage of the Ebola epidemic in Kikwit<a></a>, Zaire in 1995. During that epidemic she resided in&nbsp;Kikwit<a></a>
 and tracked cases from village-to-village. Details of her coverage can be found in &quot;Betrayal of Trust,&quot; published in 2000 by Hyperion. Ms. Garrett is the only writer ever to have been awarded the three Big &quot;Ps&quot; of journalism: the Peabody, the Polk, and the
 Pulitzer. She is the best-selling author of &quot;The Coming Plague: Newly Emerging Diseases in a World Out of Balance&quot; and &quot;Betrayal of Trust: The Collapse of Global Public Health.&quot; Ms. Garrett has written for many publications, including the &quot;Los Angeles Times,&quot;
 &quot;Washington Post,&quot; and &quot;Foreign Affairs,&quot; and has also appeared on national television programs, such as ABC's &quot;Nightline,&quot; &quot;NewsHour<a></a> with Jim Lehrer,&quot; and &quot;The Charlie Rose Show.&quot;
<br>
<br>
In order to encourage student participation, professors typically convene as a group in a classroom or their office around a speaker phone. Please reply to this email if you would like to make this call available to your students, and we will send you the toll-free
 dial-in number and password one day prior to the call. <br>
<br>
As background for the discussion, you may wish to have your students review the following materials:
<br>
<br>
1) Laurie Garrett, &quot;Epic Failures Feeding Ebola Crisis,&quot; Interview with Danielle Renwick,
<a href="http://CFR.org" target="_blank">CFR.org</a><a></a>, September 18, 2014. <br>
<a href="http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/epic-failures-feeding-ebola-crisis/p33465?cid=emc-ACC-Interview-092414" target="_blank">http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/epic-failures-feeding-ebola-crisis/p33465?cid=emc-ACC-Interview-092414</a>
<br>
2) Laurie Garrett, &quot;Can the U.S. Army Degrade and Destroy Ebola?&quot; Foreign Policy, September 16, 2014.
<br>
<a href="http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/can-us-army-degrade-destroy-ebola/p33456?cid=emc-ACC-pandemic-092414" target="_blank">http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/can-us-army-degrade-destroy-ebola/p33456?cid=emc-ACC-pandemic-092414</a>
 &nbsp;<br>
3) Laurie Garrett, &quot;We Could Have Stopped This,&quot; Foreign Policy, September 16, 2014.<br>
<a href="http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/we-could-have-stopped/p33398?cid=emc-ACC-we_could_have_stopped_this-092414" target="_blank">http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/we-could-have-stopped/p33398?cid=emc-ACC-we_could_have_stopped_this-092414</a>
<br>
4) &quot;White House Fact Sheet: U.S. Response to the Ebola Epidemic in West Africa,&quot; White House, September 16, 2014.<br>
<a href="http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/white-house-fact-sheet-us-response-ebola-epidemic-west-africa/p33440#?cid=emc-ACC-white_house_fact_sheet-092414" target="_blank">http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/white-house-fact-sheet-us-response-ebola-epidemic-west-africa/p33440#?cid=emc-ACC-white_house_fact_sheet-092414</a>
<br>
5) &quot;World Health Organization: Ebola Response Roadmap,&quot; World Health Organization, August 28, 2014.<br>
<a href="http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/world-health-organization-ebola-response-roadmap/p33459?cid=emc-ACC-who_ebola-092414" target="_blank">http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/world-health-organization-ebola-response-roadmap/p33459?cid=emc-ACC-who_ebola-092414</a>
<br>
<br>
I hope you will visit our portal on the&nbsp;CFR<a></a> website at <a href="http://www.cfr.org/educators" target="_blank">
www.cfr.org/educators</a>, where you will find&nbsp;CFR<a></a> and &quot;Foreign Affairs&quot; tools and resources designed specifically for the academic community and announcements about upcoming events. Please don't hesitate to call or email Catalina Caro at 212.434.9564
 or&nbsp;<a href="mailto:academic at cfr.org">academic at cfr.org</a><a></a> should you have any questions.<br>
<br>
Best regards, <br>
Irina <br>
<br>
Irina A.&nbsp;Faskianos<a></a> <br>
Vice President, National Program &amp; Outreach, <br>
Council on Foreign Relations<br>

tel<a></a> 212.434.9465 &nbsp;&nbsp;cell 201.463.4515 &nbsp;&nbsp;fax 212.434.9829&nbsp;<br>

Are you interested in playing intramural inner tube water polo? This will be entirely for fun and awesome.

Games will be weeknights sometime. It hasn't been determined when yet.

http://www.babsonathletics.com/information/intramurals/inner_tube_water_polo

email me if you're interested. We need to register by Monday.

also I'm sending this to the swimming list. You should join it if you're interested in swimming to stay in shape.

-Luke

From Mitchell.Cieminski at students.olin.edu  Fri Sep 19 11:34:17 2014
From: Mitchell.Cieminski at students.olin.edu (Mitchell Cieminski)
Date: Fri, 19 Sep 2014 11:34:17 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] [FYI] [HelpYou] How to send REsolveds.
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3CDE6F0@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Just FYI, sending to HelpMe because it's /about/ helpme. Sending to Randomness because it was a random discovery today. Sending to Carpe so people can seize the day and send better REsolveds.



A bit more than a year ago, I sent a very lengthy survey to people about Helpme and Carpe culture. I think the following question has responses that should be shared... just because I came across the results today while looking for something else, not for any particular reason.



"When sending a "REsolved:" email [to the Helpme mailing list], what information (if any) should be included?"

47/50 said "Information gained from responses so others also have the information"

25/50 said "Thanking the person who helped you publicly"

10/50 said "There is no need to send a 'resolved' email."

10/50 said "other," usually containing the idea that "It depends" or some variation of that thought



mitch
-------------- next part --------------

	{mso-style-priority:99;

	text-decoration:underline;}

	{mso-style-priority:99;

	{mso-style-priority:99;

	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:11.0pt;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
span.PlainTextChar
	{mso-style-name:"Plain Text Char";
	mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Plain Text";
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
@page WordSection1
	{size:612.0pt 792.0pt;
	margin:70.85pt 3.0cm 70.85pt 3.0cm;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}
--></style><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
<o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="1026" />
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
<o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
<o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1" />
</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoPlainText>Just FYI, sending to HelpMe because it&#8217;s /about/ helpme. Sending to Randomness because it was a random discovery today. Sending to Carpe so people can seize the day and send better REsolveds.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoPlainText><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoPlainText>A bit more than a year ago, I sent a very lengthy survey to people about Helpme and Carpe culture. I think the following question has responses that should be shared... just because I came across the results today while looking for something else, not for any particular reason.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoPlainText><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoPlainText><b>&quot;When sending a &quot;REsolved:&quot; email [to the Helpme mailing list], what information (if any) should be included?&quot;<o:p></o:p></b></p><p class=MsoPlainText><b>47/50 said &quot;Information gained from responses so others also have the information&quot;<o:p></o:p></b></p><p class=MsoPlainText><b>25/50 said &quot;Thanking the person who helped you publicly&quot;<o:p></o:p></b></p><p class=MsoPlainText>10/50 said &quot;There is no need to send a 'resolved' email.&quot;<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoPlainText>10/50 said &quot;other,&quot; usually containing the idea that &quot;It depends&quot; or some variation of that thought<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoPlainText><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoPlainText>mitch<o:p></o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Philip.Seger at students.olin.edu  Fri Sep 19 12:45:46 2014
From: Philip.Seger at students.olin.edu (Philip Seger)
Date: Fri, 19 Sep 2014 12:45:46 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Alumni Weekend Workshop
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3CDE759@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey Olin!

This weekend is Alumni Weekend! And this year we're excited to introduce a new addition to the festivities- Alumni Weekend Workshops!

What: Alumni are doing awesome things, but what? What are they researching? What are their favorite life hacks? What are some cool tips they've picked up after graduating they wish they'd had when they were at Olin? Well, today's your chance to find out!

A few awesome alumni have volunteered to run an hour-long workshop this afternoon on something they're passionate about and you should check it out!

When: Today, 3:30-4:30

Where: In the AC (see flyer attached for specific room #'s).

Why: Learn something new, talk to alumni about what they do, and get a glimpse of what life post-Olin looks like. Alumni are an awesome resource- let's take advantage of that!

I've attached the flyer of the specific workshops with room numbers. We've got a range of activities from a mini Tessel hackathon to cutting-edge solar cell research. Check it out!

Philip (on behalf of Margaret-Ann) Seger

Hi Carpe!

For those who are interested, I have finally gotten round to uploading some of the pictures I took from SERV kickball today! You can find them at this link:

https://www.flickr.com/photos/justinpohphotography/sets/72157647787168431/

From Mary.Martin at students.olin.edu  Sat Sep 20 12:14:34 2014
From: Mary.Martin at students.olin.edu (Mary Martin)
Date: Sat, 20 Sep 2014 12:14:34 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] BUFFY the Vampire Slayer WH2 8pm
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3CDEA0B@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello All,

Tonight in West Hall 2 lounge we are going to be showing the Buffy the Vampire Slayer pilot (and then more episodes depending on interest) starting at 8. Please come and join us!

If you don't know what Buffy is, or you've never seen it; this is your lucky day! Buffy is a TV show that was on in the 90s staring Sarah Michelle Geller as Buffy Summers, the Slayer. Her job is to rid the world of vampires and any other creatures that threaten the world. It was created by Joss Whedon and the dialogue is almost as amazing as the terrible 90s clothing and special effects. If you hated Twilight, this show is for you.
-------------- next part --------------

From: David.Pudlo at students.olin.edu (David Pudlo)
Date: Sat, 20 Sep 2014 14:01:54 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] BanterFest
Message-ID: <xdm1c6kbhj66jyj0axpxpwyf.1411236098554@email.android.com>

Hey all!

Come on out to the O right now for food and conversations!

Sent from my phone, so please excuse any brevity or typos.


David Pudlo <David.Pudlo at students.olin.edu> wrote:

[cid:image001.png at 01CFD38C.7CEE7C00]
What was it like in the early years?
Before East Hall? When Milas Hall was called the Olin Center?
What?s it like in the real world? What do alums miss most about the Bubble?

Come by for BanterFest
at Alumni Weekend

Connect with some visiting alumni!
Share stories in a match-and-share activity.
If you find someone you really jive with,
you can become Banter Buddies for the new year!

Saturday, 2:00-3:30, in the Oval
Desserts & caffeine served

Happening for real at 6 p.m. in EH1NW

-------- Original message --------
From: Katherine Maschan
Date:09/18/2014 7:47 PM (GMT-05:00)
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: Watch Trouble the Water

I have the library copy of Trouble the Water, a documentary about Hurricane Katrina. It was filmed by a woman who was stuck in New Orleans during the storm and it?s supposed to be incredible in a lot of different ways. Anyway, I want to watch it tonight. I?m thinking to set up in EH1 after the alcohol discussion. Come join if you want! We might also move to a suite with a projector if there aren?t a lot of people there, because then the video can be bigger :) So if we?re not in EH1 then come to EH1NW suite.

Kate

From Amanda.Sutherland at students.olin.edu  Sat Sep 20 17:58:48 2014
From: Amanda.Sutherland at students.olin.edu (Amanda Sutherland)
Date: Sat, 20 Sep 2014 17:58:48 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Cheerios first meeting!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A2FFCB59@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello Olin!

Cheerios, Olin's premier non-audition accapella group, is starting meetings this week! Cheerios is the place to be if you love singing but do not want to devote more than two hours a week to it. We meet once a week as a full group for an hour, then have sectionals once a week for an hour. The whole point of Cheerios is to have fun singing and relax from work, so please come if any of these sound interesting to you! Even if you are not sure you want to join, come for our first meeting and check us out. 

If anyone is interested in being a section leader, let Jacob and I know. Thanks! 

Cheerio FAQs

Q: But what if I can't read music?
A: Who cares? There are enough people who can that it doesn't matter. Fun fact, Amanda can't read music either and she's half the Cheerio Box...

Q: But I can't sing!
A: 1. You're probably lying. 2. If you like singing and it would be fun for you, no one cares you "can't sing". Really. 

Q: But I hate fun and singing!
A: ... I'm afraid you're not welcome. Sorry. 

See you soon!
Amanda S and Jacob K, both halves of the Cheerio Box

From Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu  Sat Sep 20 19:58:19 2014
From: Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu (Gregory Edelston)
Date: Sat, 20 Sep 2014 19:58:19 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Think. Do. Reflect.
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3CDEC2F@EXVS01.olin.edu>

tl;dr: Self-improvement club! Dinner meetings every Sunday at 6PM on the mezz.

ntl;r: What would you do if life were an experiment? Would you try to live your life a little differently, just to see what would happen? If your tweaks are good, you'd keep them going; if they're not, you might try something else.

The Experimenters' Society lives by that principle. Every week we think about changes we can make in our lives, and we talk about them over dinner. Then we spend a week trying to implement those changes, and then we reflect on how it worked.

This club has gotten me to change my life in several ways; for example, I floss my teeth now, I don't browse reddit anymore, and I'm in control of my sleep schedule (in stark contrast with freshman year). Other folks have used the club to start working out, journal daily, become vegetarian, and more.

If you're interested, come to our meetings on the DH mezz Sundays at 6PM! If you can't make it tomorrow, email me and I'll send you our spreadsheet.

See you there!
Greg
-------------- next part --------------

From Shane.Skikne at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep 21 12:21:46 2014
From: Shane.Skikne at students.olin.edu (Shane Skikne)
Date: Sun, 21 Sep 2014 12:21:46 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Adventure Club Scavenger Hunt
Message-ID: <AF4AD2D0-BB12-4A06-91CF-EC05776AA2AA@students.olin.edu>

Hello!
This Saturday, Adventure Club will be holding our triennial Adventure Club Scavenger Hunt. These 24 hours of madness will have participants doing all sorts of crazy things! And, of course, there?ll be an awesome prize!

We aim to make this a mini version of the legendary UChicago Scavenger Hunt.

We?ll send out more details soon, but in the meantime, we wanted to let you know so you can start making teams and getting excited! Put your name or team here<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1llSDzi7RoB_7SAz-2kXWyUbLcX9rjxvjAfBWrmySS3c/edit?usp=sharing> if you?re interested. You totally don?t need to compete for the whole 24 hours. We?ve had some teams just do a few hours. This will occur during the Boston Kickout by SAC so it?ll give you some fun ways to explore Boston.

Also, if you have any ideas for tasks in the hunt or if you?d like to help plan shoot me an email!  Some examples: ?Roll a stranger down a hill?, ?Get interviewed on TV?, ?Be in two different countries?, ?Get a tattoo?, and ?Write an Olin fight song?.
Love<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eSbcuB1EkLw>
Shane

-------------- next part --------------

BOCA (Babson -Olin Catholic Association) is having an ice cream social directly after Mass today (4pm Glavin Chapel). If you're interested in coming to Mass, Lindsey will be walking over with people at 3:40, leaving from WH1. (Lindsey.vanderlyn at students.olin.edu<mailto:Lindsey.vanderlyn at students.olin.edu>). This is a great time to come over, check out Church and get to know club members a bit.

Anyone is welcome. For those of you looking for OIE experiences, you're quite welcome to join us.

[cid:image003.jpg at 01CFD2C2.8630B0A0]

Elizabeth

From Jacob.Kingery at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep 21 15:08:19 2014
From: Jacob.Kingery at students.olin.edu (Jacob Kingery)
Date: Sun, 21 Sep 2014 15:08:19 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Cheerios first meeting!
Message-ID: <wtmomg01tbog512fdrollx2k.1411326495831@email.android.com>

Reminder, this is happening RIGHT NOW in the jam room! Come even if you might be maybe interested!


-------- Original message --------
From: Amanda Sutherland <Amanda.Sutherland at students.olin.edu>
Date:09/20/2014 6:01 PM (GMT-05:00)
To: olinsingers at lists.olin.edu, carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Cc: Jacob Kingery <Jacob.Kingery at students.olin.edu>
Subject: Cheerios first meeting!

Hello Olin!

Cheerios, Olin's premier non-audition accapella group, is starting meetings this week! Cheerios is the place to be if you love singing but do not want to devote more than two hours a week to it. We meet once a week as a full group for an hour, then have sectionals once a week for an hour. The whole point of Cheerios is to have fun singing and relax from work, so please come if any of these sound interesting to you! Even if you are not sure you want to join, come for our first meeting and check us out.

If anyone is interested in being a section leader, let Jacob and I know. Thanks!

Cheerio FAQs

Q: But what if I can't read music?
A: Who cares? There are enough people who can that it doesn't matter. Fun fact, Amanda can't read music either and she's half the Cheerio Box...

Q: But I can't sing!
A: 1. You're probably lying. 2. If you like singing and it would be fun for you, no one cares you "can't sing". Really.

Q: But I hate fun and singing!
A: ... I'm afraid you're not welcome. Sorry.

See you soon!
Amanda S and Jacob K, both halves of the Cheerio Box
-------------- next part --------------

Want to spend an afternoon playing tons of board games in a caf??
It's time for a *field trip*!

Sign up here!
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bytGtBNb-OgbpJf4yg2YaVqWE-CmWXyKkRhC64hWUFY/edit#gid=0>

Board Game Club is sponsoring an outing to Knight Moves caf?
<https://www.google.com/maps/place/Knight+Moves+Cafe/@42.341509,-71.125022,15z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x0:0xc8be98d4119380bb>
for
up to 10 people. It's a cozy place with the largest supply of board games
I've ever seen.

I'm bringing the Olin van (which seats 6 passengers), and I can pay for a
few additional people if someone else wants to drive their own car.

We will need to arrive around noon in order to secure spots at the caf?
(there are no reservations). We'll each get a day pass, which lets you come
and go as you please, so we may go out for dinner somewhere if we stay late.

-Cypress

Subject: [Carpediem] Think. Do. Reflect.
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3CDEC2F@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3CDEC2F@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Desc: Experimenters' Society.ics

<html><head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html charset=windows-1252"></head><body style="word-wrap: break-word; -webkit-nbsp-mode: space; -webkit-line-break: after-white-space;"><div><div><br></div><div><br><div><div>On Sep 20, 2014, at 7:58 PM, Gregory Edelston &lt;<a href="mailto:Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu">Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu</a>&gt; wrote:</div><br class="Apple-interchange-newline"><blockquote type="cite"><div lang="EN-US" link="blue" vlink="purple" style="font-family: Palatino-Roman; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: normal; orphans: auto; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: auto; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px;"><div class="WordSection1" style="page: WordSection1;"><div style="margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"><b>tl;dr:</b><span class="Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>Self-improvement club! Dinner meetings every Sunday at 6PM on the mezz.<o:p></o:p></div><div style="margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></div><div style="margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"><b>ntl;r:</b><span class="Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span>What would you do if life were an experiment? Would you try to live your life a little differently, just to see what would happen? If your tweaks are good, you?d keep them going; if they?re not, you might try something else.<o:p></o:p></div><div style="margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></div><div style="margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;">The Experimenters? Society lives by that principle. Every week we think about changes we can make in our lives, and we talk about them over dinner. Then we spend a week trying to implement those changes, and then we reflect on how it worked.<o:p></o:p></div><div style="margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></div><div style="margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;">This club has gotten me to change my life in several ways; for example, I floss my teeth now, I don?t browse reddit anymore, and I?m in control of my sleep schedule (in stark contrast with freshman year). Other folks have used the club to start working out, journal daily, become vegetarian, and more.<o:p></o:p></div><div style="margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></div><div style="margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;">If you?re interested, come to our meetings on the<span class="Apple-converted-space">&nbsp;</span><b>DH mezz Sundays at 6PM</b>! If you can?t make it tomorrow, email me and I?ll send you our spreadsheet.<o:p></o:p></div><div style="margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></div><div style="margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;">See you there!<o:p></o:p></div><div style="margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;">Greg</div></div></div></blockquote></div><br></div></div></body></html>

From Janie.Harari at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep 21 18:30:02 2014
From: Janie.Harari at students.olin.edu (Janie Harari)
Date: Sun, 21 Sep 2014 18:30:02 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Engineering Prototyping Job
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3CDEF7E@EXVS01.olin.edu>

I know someone who is looking for someone to do some prototyping for a product: a screw on light for liquor bottles that will turn them into lanterns.   This would involve some CAD, physical modeling (plastics, 3d printing, you decide etc.), packaging electronics components, and aesthetic design.  He is looking for a workable prototype that he can show on a kickstarter and a design that he can give to a plastic molding company to get it manufactured there.  Are you interested? Let me know, and I can connect you for more details

From Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep 21 21:40:00 2014
From: Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu (Lyra Silverwolf)
Date: Sun, 21 Sep 2014 21:40:00 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] [ThinkDoReflect] Think. Do. Reflect.
In-Reply-To: <3A9EE5A9-0B5B-4646-B019-0474A74FAF61@students.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3CDEC2F@EXVS01.olin.edu>
	<3A9EE5A9-0B5B-4646-B019-0474A74FAF61@students.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <5978B416-B653-4975-B5CF-BE59D6BAB974@students.olin.edu>

Here is the spreadsheet<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AriFx57EfKvAdFdFbFV4LXoybWVNdHBPU3dEaFNubkE&usp=sharing> we use to keep track of our progress on our goals. By tracking them in this spreadsheet you can view your progress and keep others accountable. Even if you weren't at the meeting, feel free to add your own personal goals to the spreadsheet.

-Lyra

On Sep 21, 2014, at 4:17 PM, Lyra Silverwolf <Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu<mailto:Lyra.Silverwolf at students.olin.edu>> wrote:

Now with an iCal!

<Experimenters' Society.ics>


On Sep 20, 2014, at 7:58 PM, Gregory Edelston <Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu<mailto:Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu>> wrote:

tl;dr: Self-improvement club! Dinner meetings every Sunday at 6PM on the mezz.

ntl;r: What would you do if life were an experiment? Would you try to live your life a little differently, just to see what would happen? If your tweaks are good, you?d keep them going; if they?re not, you might try something else.

The Experimenters? Society lives by that principle. Every week we think about changes we can make in our lives, and we talk about them over dinner. Then we spend a week trying to implement those changes, and then we reflect on how it worked.

This club has gotten me to change my life in several ways; for example, I floss my teeth now, I don?t browse reddit anymore, and I?m in control of my sleep schedule (in stark contrast with freshman year). Other folks have used the club to start working out, journal daily, become vegetarian, and more.

If you?re interested, come to our meetings on the DH mezz Sundays at 6PM! If you can?t make it tomorrow, email me and I?ll send you our spreadsheet.

See you there!
Greg

_______________________________________________
ThinkDoReflect mailing list
ThinkDoReflect at lists.olin.edu<mailto:ThinkDoReflect at lists.olin.edu>
https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/thinkdoreflect

From Meghan.Tighe at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep 21 21:59:43 2014
From: Meghan.Tighe at students.olin.edu (Meghan Tighe)
Date: Sun, 21 Sep 2014 21:59:43 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] FW: Walk for type 1 diabetes (How does this look?)
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3CDF07D@EXVS01.olin.edu>
	<DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3CDF081@EXVS01.olin.edu> 
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3CDF0A0@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello all,

TL;DR
This Saturday, the 27th, the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation is holding the One Walk for type 1 diabetes. It's going to be super fun and you should come! Or if you can't make it you should get a kickin T-shirt!



This Saturday is Boston's JDRF (Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation) One Walk. Its purpose is to raise funds for research as well as to raise awareness of type 1 diabetes and its complications. My little sister has diabetes so it is a cause that is really important to me personally. I am also planning to make T-shirts! If you would like a shirt, you can get one regardless of whether or not you are attending the walk. I will be buying and making the shirts myself and I'm asking for a suggested $10 donation to JDRF per shirt. You can do that through our team here.<http://www2.jdrf.org/site/TR?fr_id=3896&pg=team&team_id=166942>

The walk is a very casual 5k through a park. If we have enough drivers we will probably leave around 9:30am and get back by 1 (so you'd have plenty of time to do some of the other cool things going on in Boston on Saturday afternoon!) Otherwise we would probably have to leave by 8:30 if traveling by T. If you are interested in attending or getting a T-shirt, you can fill out this quick survey<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1kww4s-rg_6X_Zz8NVhQgz3a7HqYTGR6FtUSm0y1oTTs/viewform?usp=send_form> by Wednesday. JDRF would prefer you register for the walk on our team page<http://www2.jdrf.org/site/TR?fr_id=3896&pg=team&team_id=166942> but it is not strictly required.

Even if you are not remotely interested in coming to the walk or getting a shirt, please feel free to ask me any questions you may have regarding type 1 diabetes, JDRF, or my family's connection with type 1!!
Meghan

Meghan Tighe
Olin College '17

-------------- next part --------------

It&#8217;s going to be super fun and you should come! Or if you can&#8217;t make it you should get a kickin T-shirt!<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=page-link><span style='font-size:16.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=page-link><span style='font-size:16.0pt'>This Saturday is Boston&#8217;s <b><span style='color:#FF3399'>JDRF (Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation) One Walk</span></b>. Its purpose is to raise funds for research as well as to raise awareness of type 1 diabetes and its complications. My little sister has diabetes so it is a cause that is really important to me personally. I am also planning to make T-shirts! If you would like a shirt, you can get one regardless of whether or not you are attending the walk. I will be buying and making the shirts myself and I&#8217;m asking for a suggested $10 donation to JDRF per shirt. You can do that through our team <a href="http://www2.jdrf.org/site/TR?fr_id=3896&amp;pg=team&amp;team_id=166942">here.</a> <span style='color:#1F497D'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p><p class=page-link><span style='font-size:16.0pt'>The walk is a very casual 5k through a park. If we have enough drivers we will probably leave around 9:30am and get back by 1 (so you&#8217;d have plenty of time to do some of the other cool things going on in Boston on Saturday afternoon!) Otherwise we would probably have to leave by 8:30 if traveling by T. If you are interested in attending or getting a T-shirt, you can fill out <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1kww4s-rg_6X_Zz8NVhQgz3a7HqYTGR6FtUSm0y1oTTs/viewform?usp=send_form">this quick survey</a> by Wednesday. JDRF would prefer you register for the walk on <a href="http://www2.jdrf.org/site/TR?fr_id=3896&amp;pg=team&amp;team_id=166942">our team page</a> but it is not strictly required. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=page-link><span style='font-size:16.0pt'>Even if you are not remotely interested in coming to the walk or getting a shirt, <b>please feel free to ask me any questions you may have</b> regarding type 1 diabetes, JDRF, or my family&#8217;s connection with type 1!!<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:16.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>Meghan</span><span style='font-size:14.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;font-family:"Poor Richard","serif"'>Meghan Tighe<o:p></o:p></span></b></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:16.0pt;font-family:"Poor Richard","serif"'>Olin College &#8216;17<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p></div></body></html>

Subject: [Carpediem] Frankly Speaking Open Ended Question: October
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3CDF2C0@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Time for another Frankly Speaking open ended question! This month's prompt:
Describe the most valuable thing you learned this past summer.

Submit here:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1yRwY9mdycsMFQxk5UCEvyrtWvL9rm95j8pK-umCrPbA/viewform?usp=send_form

Answers will be published in the October issue of Frankly Speaking.
