From Toni.Saylor at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep 22 19:36:52 2014
From: Toni.Saylor at students.olin.edu (Toni Saylor)
Date: Mon, 22 Sep 2014 19:36:52 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Volunteers Needed for JFK
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3CDF5AF@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi friends,
We need more volunteers to go to JFK Elementary school from 9:00-12:00 on any day of the week.
JFK is a really awesome cultural school in Jamaica Plain.
Last year we did really cool activities ranging from designing a water turbine to a rube Goldberg.
We would really love it to keep up a relationship with this school, so if you can't do it this semester, let us know anyway if you're interested for next semester.

<3
The Four

From dredfern.olin at gmail.com  Mon Sep 22 20:38:47 2014
From: dredfern.olin at gmail.com (Derek Redfern)
Date: Mon, 22 Sep 2014 20:38:47 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Uni in the O Tonight!
Message-ID: <CA+O+WhHWygEVZxwwBNHLaZiSy5_nWOi39Sq4zsHQBM1Sot66Pw@mail.gmail.com>

Come *unicycle in the O* with me later tonight! I'll be heading outside
around *10:30 this evening*, and I'll hang out for around an hour. Feel
free to come whether you already know how to unicycle or want to learn!
Personally, I'll be trying to learn to ride the *giraffe*.

If you email me to let me know you're coming, I'll grab a uni and helmet
for you; otherwise, you'll have to grab one yourself. Yes, helmets are
mandatory.

Also, if you're interested in getting further uni notifications, subscribe
to the Uni list <https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/uni>! This is the
only one that will go out on Carpe as well.

Derek

From: Yevgeniya Zastavker
Sent: Friday, September 19, 2014 9:00 AM
To: Students - Class of 2015; carpediem at lists.olin.edu

Subject: GCSP: Invitation for 9/24 Academic Conference Call: "Confronting the Ebola Outbreak"

 Hi, All,

Olin students have been invited t participate in this conference call re: global health situation confronting us at this very moment. Although I am specifically targeting Grand Challenge Scholars Program (GCSP) students who are concerned with Global Health issues, this is really a call to everyone.  Please, forward to those who may be interested beyond the senior class and Carpe.

If you are planning on joining the call, please email me ASAP, so that I can get a group of students together on a call (see below).

Looking forward to hearing many of you respond,
Zhenya



Yevgeniya V. Zastavker
Associate Professor of Physics

Begin forwarded message:
From: Council on Foreign Relations <Academic at cfr.org<mailto:Academic at cfr.org>>
Date: September 18, 2014 at 5:41:25 PM EDT
To: "Richard K. Miller" <Richard.Miller at olin.edu<mailto:Richard.Miller at olin.edu>>
Cc: Nancy Sullivan <Nancy.Sullivan at olin.edu<mailto:Nancy.Sullivan at olin.edu>>
Subject: CFR Invitation for 9/24 Academic Conference Call: "Confronting the Ebola Outbreak"
Reply-To: "Academic at cfr.org<mailto:Academic at cfr.org>" <Academic at cfr.org<mailto:Academic at cfr.org>>
Dear Rick:

On behalf of the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR), I invite you and your students to participate in the next session of the Fall 2014 CFR Academic Conference Call series on Wednesday, September 24, from 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. (ET). Laurie Garrett, CFR's senior fellow for global health, will discuss the Ebola epidemic in West Africa and the evolving global response. **Please note the change in time and topic of this Academic Conference Call.**

Ms. Garrett's expertise includes global health systems, chronic and infectious diseases, and bioterrorism. She received the 1996 Pulitzer Prize for her coverage of the Ebola epidemic in Kikwit, Zaire in 1995. During that epidemic she resided in Kikwit and tracked cases from village-to-village. Details of her coverage can be found in "Betrayal of Trust," published in 2000 by Hyperion. Ms. Garrett is the only writer ever to have been awarded the three Big "Ps" of journalism: the Peabody, the Polk, and the Pulitzer. She is the best-selling author of "The Coming Plague: Newly Emerging Diseases in a World Out of Balance" and "Betrayal of Trust: The Collapse of Global Public Health." Ms. Garrett has written for many publications, including the "Los Angeles Times," "Washington Post," and "Foreign Affairs," and has also appeared on national television programs, such as ABC's "Nightline," "NewsHour with Jim Lehrer," and "The Charlie Rose Show."

In order to encourage student participation, professors typically convene as a group in a classroom or their office around a speaker phone. Please reply to this email if you would like to make this call available to your students, and we will send you the toll-free dial-in number and password one day prior to the call.

As background for the discussion, you may wish to have your students review the following materials:

1) Laurie Garrett, "Epic Failures Feeding Ebola Crisis," Interview with Danielle Renwick, CFR.org<http://CFR.org>, September 18, 2014.
http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/epic-failures-feeding-ebola-crisis/p33465?cid=emc-ACC-Interview-092414
2) Laurie Garrett, "Can the U.S. Army Degrade and Destroy Ebola?" Foreign Policy, September 16, 2014.
http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/can-us-army-degrade-destroy-ebola/p33456?cid=emc-ACC-pandemic-092414
3) Laurie Garrett, "We Could Have Stopped This," Foreign Policy, September 16, 2014.
http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/we-could-have-stopped/p33398?cid=emc-ACC-we_could_have_stopped_this-092414
4) "White House Fact Sheet: U.S. Response to the Ebola Epidemic in West Africa," White House, September 16, 2014.
http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/white-house-fact-sheet-us-response-ebola-epidemic-west-africa/p33440#?cid=emc-ACC-white_house_fact_sheet-092414
5) "World Health Organization: Ebola Response Roadmap," World Health Organization, August 28, 2014.
http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/world-health-organization-ebola-response-roadmap/p33459?cid=emc-ACC-who_ebola-092414

I hope you will visit our portal on the CFR website at www.cfr.org/educators<http://www.cfr.org/educators>, where you will find CFR and "Foreign Affairs" tools and resources designed specifically for the academic community and announcements about upcoming events. Please don't hesitate to call or email Catalina Caro at 212.434.9564 or academic at cfr.org<mailto:academic at cfr.org> should you have any questions.

Best regards,
Irina

Irina A. Faskianos
Vice President, National Program & Outreach,
Council on Foreign Relations
58 East 68th Street, New York, New York 10065
tel 212.434.9465   cell 201.463.4515   fax 212.434.9829
ifaskianos at cfr.org<mailto:ifaskianos at cfr.org>   www.cfr.org<http://www.cfr.org>

*************************************************

SCHEDULE FOR FALL 2014 ACADEMIC CONFERENCE CALL SERIES

Thursday, October 9, 12:00 to 1:00 p.m. (ET)
"The U.S.-India Relationship"
Alyssa Ayres, Senior Fellow for India Pakistan and South Asia, CFR

Wednesday, October 22, 12:00 to 1:00 p.m. (ET)
"The Future of Guantanamo Bay"
Matthew C. Waxman, Adjunct Senior Fellow for Law and Foreign Policy, CFR

Tuesday, November 6, 12:00 to 1:00 p.m. (ET)
"NAFTA at Twenty"
Shannon K. O'Neil, Senior Fellow for Latin America Studies, CFR

Thursday, November 20, 12:00 to 1:00 p.m. (ET)
"U.S.-China Relations"
Robert D. Blackwill, Henry A. Kissinger Senior Fellow for U.S. Foreign Policy, CFR

Thursday, December 4, 12:00 to 1:00 p.m. (ET)
"The Implications of Drones on U.S. Foreign Policy"
Micah Zenko, Douglas Dillon Fellow, CFR
Sarah Kreps, Associate Professor, Cornell University

***If you do not wish to receive emails regarding the Academic Conference Call series, please reply to this email and type "unsubscribe" in the subject line before sending.***

<div>&nbsp;Hi, All,</div>
<div><font face="tahoma"></font>&nbsp;</div>
<div><font face="tahoma">Olin students have been invited t participate in this conference call re: global health situation confronting us at this very moment. Although I am specifically targeting
<em>Grand Challenge Scholars Program (GCSP<a></a>)</em> students who are concerned with Global Health issues, this is really a call to everyone.&nbsp; Please, forward to those who may be interested beyond the senior class and Carpe.</font></div>
<div><font face="tahoma"></font>&nbsp;</div>

<div class="WordSection1">
<blockquote style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5pt; MARGIN-TOP: 5pt">
<div>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt"><b>From:</b> Council on Foreign Relations &lt;<a href="mailto:Academic at cfr.org">Academic at cfr.org</a><a></a>&gt;<br>
<b>Date:</b> September 18, 2014 at 5:41:25 PM EDT<br>
<b>To:</b> &quot;Richard K. Miller&quot; &lt;<a href="mailto:Richard.Miller at olin.edu">Richard.Miller at olin.edu</a><a></a>&gt;<br>
<b>Cc:</b> Nancy Sullivan &lt;<a href="mailto:Nancy.Sullivan at olin.edu">Nancy.Sullivan at olin.edu</a><a></a>&gt;<br>
<b>Subject:</b>&nbsp;<b><b>CFR</b><a></a> Invitation for 9/24 Academic Conference Call: &quot;Confronting the Ebola Outbreak&quot;</b><br>
<b>Reply-To:</b> &quot;<a href="mailto:Academic at cfr.org">Academic at cfr.org</a><a></a>&quot; &lt;<a href="mailto:Academic at cfr.org">Academic at cfr.org</a><a></a>&gt;</p>
</div>
</blockquote>
<blockquote style="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 5pt; MARGIN-TOP: 5pt">
<div>
<p class="MsoNormal">Dear Rick: <br>
<br>
On behalf of the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR<a></a>), I invite you and your students to participate in the next session of the Fall 2014&nbsp;CFR<a></a> Academic Conference Call series on Wednesday, September 24, from 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. (ET). Laurie
 Garrett,&nbsp;CFR's<a></a> senior fellow for global health, will discuss the Ebola epidemic in West Africa and the evolving global response. **Please note the change in time and topic of this Academic Conference Call.**<br>
<br>
Ms. Garrett's expertise includes global health systems, chronic and infectious diseases, and bioterrorism. She received the 1996 Pulitzer Prize for her coverage of the Ebola epidemic in Kikwit<a></a>, Zaire in 1995. During that epidemic she resided in&nbsp;Kikwit<a></a>
 and tracked cases from village-to-village. Details of her coverage can be found in &quot;Betrayal of Trust,&quot; published in 2000 by Hyperion. Ms. Garrett is the only writer ever to have been awarded the three Big &quot;Ps&quot; of journalism: the Peabody, the Polk, and the
 Pulitzer. She is the best-selling author of &quot;The Coming Plague: Newly Emerging Diseases in a World Out of Balance&quot; and &quot;Betrayal of Trust: The Collapse of Global Public Health.&quot; Ms. Garrett has written for many publications, including the &quot;Los Angeles Times,&quot;
 &quot;Washington Post,&quot; and &quot;Foreign Affairs,&quot; and has also appeared on national television programs, such as ABC's &quot;Nightline,&quot; &quot;NewsHour<a></a> with Jim Lehrer,&quot; and &quot;The Charlie Rose Show.&quot;
<br>
<br>
In order to encourage student participation, professors typically convene as a group in a classroom or their office around a speaker phone. Please reply to this email if you would like to make this call available to your students, and we will send you the toll-free
 dial-in number and password one day prior to the call. <br>
<br>
As background for the discussion, you may wish to have your students review the following materials:
<br>
<br>
1) Laurie Garrett, &quot;Epic Failures Feeding Ebola Crisis,&quot; Interview with Danielle Renwick,
<a href="http://CFR.org" target="_blank">CFR.org</a><a></a>, September 18, 2014. <br>
<a href="http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/epic-failures-feeding-ebola-crisis/p33465?cid=emc-ACC-Interview-092414" target="_blank">http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/epic-failures-feeding-ebola-crisis/p33465?cid=emc-ACC-Interview-092414</a>
<br>
2) Laurie Garrett, &quot;Can the U.S. Army Degrade and Destroy Ebola?&quot; Foreign Policy, September 16, 2014.
<br>
<a href="http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/can-us-army-degrade-destroy-ebola/p33456?cid=emc-ACC-pandemic-092414" target="_blank">http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/can-us-army-degrade-destroy-ebola/p33456?cid=emc-ACC-pandemic-092414</a>
 &nbsp;<br>
3) Laurie Garrett, &quot;We Could Have Stopped This,&quot; Foreign Policy, September 16, 2014.<br>
<a href="http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/we-could-have-stopped/p33398?cid=emc-ACC-we_could_have_stopped_this-092414" target="_blank">http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/we-could-have-stopped/p33398?cid=emc-ACC-we_could_have_stopped_this-092414</a>
<br>
4) &quot;White House Fact Sheet: U.S. Response to the Ebola Epidemic in West Africa,&quot; White House, September 16, 2014.<br>
<a href="http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/white-house-fact-sheet-us-response-ebola-epidemic-west-africa/p33440#?cid=emc-ACC-white_house_fact_sheet-092414" target="_blank">http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/white-house-fact-sheet-us-response-ebola-epidemic-west-africa/p33440#?cid=emc-ACC-white_house_fact_sheet-092414</a>
<br>
5) &quot;World Health Organization: Ebola Response Roadmap,&quot; World Health Organization, August 28, 2014.<br>
<a href="http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/world-health-organization-ebola-response-roadmap/p33459?cid=emc-ACC-who_ebola-092414" target="_blank">http://www.cfr.org/public-health-threats-and-pandemics/world-health-organization-ebola-response-roadmap/p33459?cid=emc-ACC-who_ebola-092414</a>
<br>
<br>
I hope you will visit our portal on the&nbsp;CFR<a></a> website at <a href="http://www.cfr.org/educators" target="_blank">
www.cfr.org/educators</a>, where you will find&nbsp;CFR<a></a> and &quot;Foreign Affairs&quot; tools and resources designed specifically for the academic community and announcements about upcoming events. Please don't hesitate to call or email Catalina Caro at 212.434.9564
 or&nbsp;<a href="mailto:academic at cfr.org">academic at cfr.org</a><a></a> should you have any questions.<br>
<br>
Best regards, <br>
Irina <br>
<br>
Irina A.&nbsp;Faskianos<a></a> <br>
Vice President, National Program &amp; Outreach, <br>
Council on Foreign Relations<br>
58 East 68th Street, New York, New York 10065&nbsp;<br>
tel<a></a> 212.434.9465 &nbsp;&nbsp;cell 201.463.4515 &nbsp;&nbsp;fax 212.434.9829&nbsp;<br>
<a href="mailto:ifaskianos at cfr.org">ifaskianos at cfr.org</a><a></a>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="http://www.cfr.org" target="_blank">www.cfr.org</a><a></a>
<br>

From Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep 23 00:23:19 2014
From: Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu (Gregory Edelston)
Date: Tue, 23 Sep 2014 00:23:19 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Improv! Improv! Improv!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3F8824C@EXVS01.olin.edu>

You know the drill! This is the third of three open improv workshops by OPIUM, held in the auditorium tomorrow (Tuesday) at 10PM [ical attached]! Next week we're going to audition for the '014-'015 improv troupe, so this is your chance to hone your sweet skillz!

See you there, buddy-pals!

Stylishly yours,
Greg, on behalf of Bill and Greg, on behalf of OPIUM, on behalf of improv comedians everywhere.

From Nagy.Hakim at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep 23 00:52:18 2014
From: Nagy.Hakim at students.olin.edu (Nagy Hakim)
Date: Tue, 23 Sep 2014 00:52:18 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Organizing Group Bike Rides
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3F8826E@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey Carpe,
Are you interested in riding bikes? Are you interested in getting off campus for a bit and enjoying some fresh air?
The HPV team is organizing Saturday morning group rides. These rides will be for everyone and will be tailored to fit as many people's interests as possible. If you are interested in participating, please fill out this survey<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1jOhwneYlrV6L-zWFiYlRedYikUxLbrhIWUh-2V9dPVQ/viewform>.

This survey is non committing; we're just trying to gauge interests in order to continue planning. Note, you do not need to have your own bike or equipment.

These rides will be a ton of fun! Please let me know if you have any other questions.


Nagy
-------------- next part --------------

If you are interested in participating, please fill out <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1jOhwneYlrV6L-zWFiYlRedYikUxLbrhIWUh-2V9dPVQ/viewform">this survey</a>. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>This survey is non committing; we&#8217;re just trying to gauge interests in order to continue planning. Note, you do not need to have your own bike or equipment. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>These rides will be a ton of fun! Please let me know if you have any other questions.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><br>Nagy<o:p></o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Ryan.Louie at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep 23 01:11:26 2014
From: Ryan.Louie at students.olin.edu (Ryan Louie)
Date: Tue, 23 Sep 2014 01:11:26 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] P&M Charity App Team Needs YOU
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3F88278@EXVS01.olin.edu>

As part of Products and Markets (aka neo-new FBE), my team is creating the first ever web app product in the history of Olin's intro entrepreneurship course (to our knowledge).  If that's not enough to get you excited, you should check out how we're incentivizing micro-donations to charities by taking our survey<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1w1x7WeFzgIufAkqeV5HLE5sX18YZlFjmuhESR7jY380/viewform?usp=send_form>!

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1w1x7WeFzgIufAkqeV5HLE5sX18YZlFjmuhESR7jY380/viewform?usp=send_form

"It's for charity, you jackass." - Kevin O'Toole

Yours Truly,
P&M Charity App Team

Subject: [Carpediem] Missed the Club spending talk?
Message-ID: <60A83C9B-8848-4811-90E7-992620AD58AA@students.olin.edu>

Do you run a club or org (or plan on doing any spending for a club/org)? Do you plan on spending any SAF money?
Well, then you need to attend a short presentation by Brooks and myself about how spending will work this year. This is required before your club is allowed to spend any $$ and we don?t plan on doing it again. If you?d like to attend, please fill out this whenisgood http://whenisgood.net/Spendallthemoney We?ll pick the best date and send out another email.
Thanks!
Shane+Brooks

	font-family:"Times","serif";
	color:windowtext;}

	{mso-style-type:personal-reply;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-size:10.0pt;}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}

	{page:WordSection1;}

From Margaret.Lidrbauch at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 24 12:08:52 2014
From: Margaret.Lidrbauch at students.olin.edu (Margaret Lidrbauch)
Date: Wed, 24 Sep 2014 12:08:52 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Green Initiatives Fund
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3F88908@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey Olin!

Do you have a cool, sustainable project that you need funding for? Apply for funds through the Green Initiatives Fund! This is a fund established through the Class of 2007 class gift. We have funds available, so send us your ideas!

Past requests have included funds to buy and plant berry bushes for the Pickles and Jams co-curricular, sensors and gauges for a weather station, and supplies to raise community awareness about the environment.

If you have an idea, but aren't sure if it's "green" enough, fill out the form and we can help determine its viability.

The application for can be found here:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1FgNVLALV_8ybOdvc51HUPWn9deSoFz3c2oNHfko-Ghg/viewform?usp=send_form

All requests for funding for this semester are due by Friday, October 24.

Please let me, Halley or Russ know if you have any questions about the fund or the application process or if you're interested in being a part of the committee.

The Green Initiatives Committee,
Meg Lidrbauch, Halley Pollock-Muskin, and Russell Zacharias

-------------- next part --------------

From Amanda.Lee at students.olin.edu  Wed Sep 24 14:03:04 2014
From: Amanda.Lee at students.olin.edu (Amanda Lee)
Date: Wed, 24 Sep 2014 14:03:04 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] F.I.L.M. Presents: Moon @ 10:00 pm
Message-ID: <CB37D5BC-4B75-469E-9E63-B0405FE56202@students.olin.edu>

F.I.L.M. Club Presents: Moon<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=twuScTcDP_Q>
10:00 pm Today, Auditorium

[cid:96A770E0-395E-466B-B6F1-266DBE032A1C at olin.edu]

Moon is about a man who goes through a crisis right before his three year stint as a miner on the moon is over. It is the feature debut of Duncan Jones (David Bowie's first kid), with the lead role being written specifically for Sam Rockwell. This year I'm trying to get a little more input on movie choices - so if anybody has any suggestions please email me :)

Amanda Lee, F.I.L.M. Director
Mary Ruthven, Finally one I haven't seen
Rachel Mathew, Pigs in a blanket
Doyung Lee, 97 minutes

From Jessica.Townsend at olin.edu  Tue Sep 23 18:01:05 2014
From: Jessica.Townsend at olin.edu (Jessica Townsend)
Date: Tue, 23 Sep 2014 18:01:05 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Spend Thanksgiving in Somerville
Message-ID: <D04765E1.68E55%jessica.townsend@olin.edu>

Hi Everyone,

I?ll be traveling over the Thanksgiving break, and would love to find an Olin student (or a group of 2 ? 3 students) to stay at my condo in Union Square in Somerville to take care of my dog (Abby, picture attached, isn?t she the cutest?) and generally keep an eye on things.

The dates are Saturday, November 22 through Sunday, November 30. I?ll even pay the group that comes to stay ($30/night) so you?ll have some fun money to spend on the great coffee shops and hipster bike shops in my neighborhood. I?m a 20 minute walk to Harvard Square, and there are Hubway bike stations all over the place to get around. Here?s more on my neighborhood:
http://www.bostonglobe.com/lifestyle/travel/2014/08/30/union-square-hipster-central/8fE2013t42xi4CfD6jycHM/story.html

I?d be looking for students that have experience with dogs, are generally responsible and are not too slovenly. That?s pretty much it.  Responsibilities include feeding the dog, walking the dog, and snuggling the dog.

Let me know if you are interested. It?s not first come, first serve, so just get back to me in the next week if you are interested.

Jessica

Subject: [Carpediem] Hair Dye party!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3F88B00@EXVS01.olin.edu>

I'm planning on having a hair dye party some weekend day after Career Fair.  Basically, anyone who wants to dye their hair a crazy color tells me what color and how much they want beforehand (these<http://www.amazon.com/dp/B0094BQIQQ/ref=twister_B008MBWEO4> are the dyes I plan on using), and I'll order enough dye, bleach, developer, gloves, etc. for everyone who wants to come.
I'll keep track of how much people use and send out Venmo requests afterwards based on how much is used.

Basically, the point is to hang out and get help dying our hair - it's super hard to dye everything evenly when you can't see the back of your head, and it's more fun to do it with other people anyways.

I know of several people who have said they'd want to do this, but I'd like to gauge interest in this.  Please respond if you'd want to come, even if I've already talked to you!

Thanks!

-Tatiana
-------------- next part --------------

Seriously. Two minutes. Please fill it out. Here's a link<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1igJiY8AtjFX7DXRvU22gMRLJjsa2Cu3ivvDUwfQuiec/viewform>. This email has already wasted two minutes of your life. What's two more?

Thanks,
The Sex Team

From: Amanda Lee

Date: Wed, Sep 24, 2014 2:03 PM

To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu;film-list at lists.olin.edu;

Subject:[Carpediem] F.I.L.M. Presents: Moon @ 10:00 pm

F.I.L.M. Club Presents: Moon<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=twuScTcDP_Q>
10:00 pm Today, Auditorium

[cid:96A770E0-395E-466B-B6F1-266DBE032A1C at olin.edu]

Moon is about a man who goes through a crisis right before his three year stint as a miner on the moon is over. It is the feature debut of Duncan Jones (David Bowie's first kid), with the lead role being written specifically for Sam Rockwell. This year I'm trying to get a little more input on movie choices - so if anybody has any suggestions please email me :)

Amanda Lee, F.I.L.M. Director
Mary Ruthven, Finally one I haven't seen
Rachel Mathew, Pigs in a blanket
Doyung Lee, 97 minutes

Next week at PyCharmers:
- More functions!
- Useful Linux tricks!
- GRAPHICS!

If you missed tonight but are interested, it?s not too late! We?ll catch you up next week.

From William.Lu at students.olin.edu  Thu Sep 25 09:41:23 2014
From: William.Lu at students.olin.edu (William Lu)
Date: Thu, 25 Sep 2014 09:41:23 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Free $10 Amazon Credit
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3F88E16@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi everyone,

If you still don't have an Amazon Student account (free Prime for 6 months!), today is Amazon Student Day, and if you get an Amazon Student account using a referral link today, both parties (the person referring you AND you) will get $10 in Amazon Credit.  You can click here<http://www.amazon.com/gp/student/signup/info?ie=UTF8&refcust=GV2WER3V3O6D4QN53FI32T3D3E&ref_type=generic> (yes, that is my referral link) for a referral link.

Happy two-day shipping!

Here is my referral link again: http://www.amazon.com/gp/student/signup/info?ie=UTF8&refcust=GV2WER3V3O6D4QN53FI32T3D3E&ref_type=generic


William Lu
Class of 2018
Olin College of Engineering
Needham, MA 02492

Leading the Revolution in Engineering Education

From Lindsey.Andrade at students.olin.edu  Thu Sep 25 12:03:10 2014
From: Lindsey.Andrade at students.olin.edu (Lindsey Andrade)
Date: Thu, 25 Sep 2014 12:03:10 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Messed Up MatLab Graphs
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3F88EC2@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Are you in Transport or Dynamics or ModSim? Do you work with MatLab a lot?

Do you get super funky graphs of things that should just never happen?

SAVE THESE GRAPHS!

I'd like to do a project with all these graphs and see if I can create something awesome out of MatLab failure.

So save your graphs a MatLab figure (.fig) and send them over to me!

(Props to Kari for the idea last night.)

Subject: [Carpediem] Gelato Tasting Panel
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A3F88FDB@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Tl;dr no gelato for you.

Hi carpe.
The passionate pursuit gelato team is making gelato again this semester and we need YOUR help with tasting. As like before, we want to form a gelato tasting panel, but given the super popularness of it two years ago, we're implementing a *super stringent* interview process. Fill out form below if interested.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1hWuiaQySCDG-Pmg1GMaAIBEXSPjwUPdQcmoofH1xjac/viewform?usp=send_form

-b

	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:11.0pt;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
span.BalloonTextChar
	{mso-style-name:"Balloon Text Char";
	mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text";
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}

	{mso-style-type:personal;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
span.EmailStyle21
	{mso-style-type:personal;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:#1F497D;}

	{mso-style-type:personal;

	font-size:10.0pt;}

	{page:WordSection1;}

Subject: [Carpediem] Rosh Hashana - Tashlich
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A41EB263@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Join JOO Club to experience an essential part of Rosh Hashana, Tashlich. Tashlich involves casting bread into water as a metaphorical way to rid of sin. Come to learn about it, experience it, and enjoy some traditional snacks (apples, honey and maybe challah)! If you plan on coming let me know.


Jamie Gorson | Class of 2016
Leading the Revolution in Engineering Education
[cid:image001.png at 01CFD845.0AF03090]


-------------- next part --------------

Like Olin? Like education? Like GIFs? Don't know what the crap I'm talking about?

Don?t know what the crap I?m talking about?<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">FOLLOW OUR BLOG: <a href="http://desafioinsper.tumblr.com/">http://desafioinsper.tumblr.com/</a> <o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">Also, feel free to reach out to any of us if you have any questions/random thoughts/just want to hang out. <o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">&lt;3 <o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">The Insper-Oliners<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal">Aditi, Doyung, Cecelia and Mitch <o:p></o:p></p></div></div></blockquote><blockquote type="cite"><div><span>_______________________________________________</span><br><span>Carpediem mailing list</span><br><span><a href="mailto:Carpediem at lists.olin.edu">Carpediem at lists.olin.edu</a></span><br><span><a href="https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/carpediem">https://lists.olin.edu/mailman/listinfo/carpediem</a></span><br></div></blockquote></body></html>

From: ariana.chae at students.olin.edu (Ariana Chae)
Date: Thu, 25 Sep 2014 21:47:53 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Charles River Center 5K
In-Reply-To: <CAHT-TTAuCRvi1FT9anS8F-s48g7MXPp0_MMmrC+iWSPcLHdp8g@mail.gmail.com>

I just wanted to bump this. We currently have five students and two faculty
members (Allen Downey and Kent Lundberg) signed up, and we've love to have
more! Go register here!
http://www.charlesrivercenterroadrace.com/


On Thu, Aug 21, 2014 at 11:21 AM, Ariana Chae <ariana.chae at students.olin.edu
> wrote:

> Hey everyone,
>
> The Charles River Center is a nonprofit social service agency that has
> been providing advocacy and a variety of services to families, children and
> adults with developmental disabilities and autism since 1956.
>
> They are hosting a *5K on Sunday, September 28* and we are creating an
> Olin team. The race happens in Needham/Wellesley (incredibly close to
> Olin), and it's at 11am so you don't even have to wake up super early.
> Please consider supporting this organization - I worked with them in high
> school and they're awesome.
>
> Registration is here - make sure you sign up for the 5K race and join the
> team "Olin College." SERV will reimburse you $5 off your registration fee
> once we're back at Olin. This race replaces the Susan G. Komen Race for the
> Cure 5K we've done for the past few years. Info here:
> http://www.charlesrivercenterroadrace.com/
>
> We're also looking for volunteers at the event if you don't want to
> walk/run the race, so let me know if you're interested.
>
> You'll hear more about this through official SERV channels once the
> semester begins, but I wanted to get the word out there early.
>
> See you in a few weeks!
>
> Best,
> Ari
>

From Shane.Skikne at students.olin.edu  Thu Sep 25 23:05:04 2014
From: Shane.Skikne at students.olin.edu (Shane Skikne)
Date: Thu, 25 Sep 2014 23:05:04 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Adventure Club Scavenger Hunt
In-Reply-To: <AF4AD2D0-BB12-4A06-91CF-EC05776AA2AA@students.olin.edu>
References: <AF4AD2D0-BB12-4A06-91CF-EC05776AA2AA@students.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <104C8B96-6EE6-49C1-B83C-8E214492F91E@students.olin.edu>

Starting tomorrow! Sign up now here<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1llSDzi7RoB_7SAz-2kXWyUbLcX9rjxvjAfBWrmySS3c/edit#gid=0> It?ll be fun!
On Sep 21, 2014, at 12:21 PM, Shane Skikne <Shane.Skikne at students.olin.edu<mailto:Shane.Skikne at students.olin.edu>> wrote:

Hello!
This Saturday, Adventure Club will be holding our triennial Adventure Club Scavenger Hunt. These 24 hours of madness will have participants doing all sorts of crazy things! And, of course, there?ll be an awesome prize!

We aim to make this a mini version of the legendary UChicago Scavenger Hunt.

We?ll send out more details soon, but in the meantime, we wanted to let you know so you can start making teams and getting excited! Put your name or team here<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1llSDzi7RoB_7SAz-2kXWyUbLcX9rjxvjAfBWrmySS3c/edit?usp=sharing> if you?re interested. You totally don?t need to compete for the whole 24 hours. We?ve had some teams just do a few hours. This will occur during the Boston Kickout by SAC so it?ll give you some fun ways to explore Boston.

Also, if you have any ideas for tasks in the hunt or if you?d like to help plan shoot me an email!  Some examples: ?Roll a stranger down a hill?, ?Get interviewed on TV?, ?Be in two different countries?, ?Get a tattoo?, and ?Write an Olin fight song?.
Love<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eSbcuB1EkLw>
Shane

Carpediem at lists.olin.edu<mailto:Carpediem at lists.olin.edu>

From Mariko.Thorbecke at students.olin.edu  Fri Sep 26 10:38:56 2014
From: Mariko.Thorbecke at students.olin.edu (Mariko Thorbecke)
Date: Fri, 26 Sep 2014 10:38:56 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] The Earth and Table (EaT) club presents...
Message-ID: <398FF50C-231B-4104-8A0A-FDEB86355DFA@students.olin.edu>

MAKE-YOUR-OWN ORGANIC PIZZA NIGHT!!!!

Are you interested in SUSTAINABILITY? Do you like FOOD? Well then the Earth and Table (EAT) club is the place for you!

Come join us for our kick-off event to learn more about the club and enjoy some stellar, homemade organic pizza! Thursday October 2nd at 5:30-7:00 pm in the EH kitchen.

This is our first meeting of the year and we will be talking about what kind of different events people want to do while enjoying delicious pizza.

Please R.S.V.P. via this<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1fwFaY-u-JD5bh4ihGaEZw5nLasErO_rjZCR3WvqzhvI/viewform?usp=send_form> form if you plan on attending. Gluten free options will be made available upon request.

Mariko

Stop by, eat pizza, and make a few calls!

Hello all! :D



Like ice cream? Of course you do!

Like Fridays? Even more!!



Everyone is welcome to come eat ice cream and enjoy some great company with the Olin Christian Fellowship this Friday on the Great Lawn!



We'll be starting at 3:30 and going until the ice cream is gone. If it rains (hopefully it doesn't!) we'll meet in WH1 Lounge for ice cream anyways :). iCal attached!



[cid:image001.png at 01CFD6B1.CEB270F0]



Love,

Sophie and Michael
-------------- next part --------------

From Lauren.Froschauer at students.olin.edu  Sat Sep 27 09:14:05 2014
From: Lauren.Froschauer at students.olin.edu (Lauren Froschauer)
Date: Sat, 27 Sep 2014 09:14:05 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Reminder Boston Kickout! and details!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A41EB97C@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey Everyone!

Guess what today is!
That's right!
THE  BOSTON KICKOUT!!!

There will be a free shuttle running continuously from the Olin O to  Eliot Station from 10AM to 7PM today!***
***Just note, the buses will stop running at 7pm, meaning that you should be back at Eliot Station by 6:30pm at the latest!

There was no provided schedule. But the time to and from Eliot Station is approx. 24 minutes. Factor in a few minutes for load/off load/traffic. The bus should be in the O every half hour.

Love,
SAC <3

From Manik.Sethi at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep 28 12:57:23 2014
From: Manik.Sethi at students.olin.edu (Manik Sethi)
Date: Sun, 28 Sep 2014 12:57:23 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Model United Nations Interest
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A41EBD38@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hello Everyone!

So Olin is very engineering based and technical even it comes to our clubs and extracurricular options. I was hoping to bring another facet to the face of Olin with our very own Model United Nations Team.

What is Model UN? Come to the meeting and find out!
How much fun is it? Come to the meeting and find out!

Meeting  on Friday October 3rd, at 7 pm in the First Floor West Hall Lounge


As a hook, If you?ve wanted to be in a seat of power, driving a country, and attempting to solve to world?s current problems (as well as its previous controversial ones), I highly suggest you attend this meeting.

More or less, we will be having an open discussion of options and how we would like to possibly shape the future of Olin?s MUN team should it become reality.

As an addition, I would really like to run OMUN (?) in conjunction with our GCSP or Grand Challenge Scholar?s Program so if you are interesting in what that is or are already intrigued, you should come. We will have some discussion on that topic as well.

Model UN is a great opportunity that is a standard at many amazing colleges and universities in the US and beyond. We are one of those anyway, right?

See you all then!!

From Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep 28 13:53:29 2014
From: Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu (Gregory Edelston)
Date: Sun, 28 Sep 2014 13:53:29 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] How To Send iCals
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A41EBDA2@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Good afternoon! It's that time of year again: time to teach people how to send iCals to large mailing lists.

Preface: This email is meant to be informative and helpful. It is not meant to shame individuals who have not previously been taught this technique. The whole point of learning is that not everyone knows everything yet.

When you're setting up a meeting with your team, sending an iCal is easy. You type the name of the other parties into the "Invite Attendees" field, and everyone is happy.

When you're sending an event to a large mailing list such as Carpe, your first thought is probably, "I should do it the same way. It's still an iCal." Unfortunately, this will make the event appear on everyone's calendar as "tentative" until they deal with it, AND it'll bypass their email filters, sending it straight to their inbox rather than their Carpe folder (or whatever other folder may be appropriate). This results in sadness.

Instead, you want to attach the event as a .ics file. It's really easy to do so! Here's how.


1.       Create the iCal on your computer.
[cid:image013.jpg at 01CFDB23.94711150]

2.       File --> Save As. Save your calendar item locally as a .ics file.
[cid:image014.jpg at 01CFDB23.94711150] [cid:image015.jpg at 01CFDB23.94711150]

3.       In the email you're sending, attach the .ics file you just saved.
[cid:image016.jpg at 01CFDB23.94711150][cid:image017.jpg at 01CFDB23.94711150][cid:image018.jpg at 01CFDB23.94711150]

4.       Celebrate your well-organized event.
[cid:image019.jpg at 01CFDB23.94711150]

Congratulations! You're now sending iCals like a pro. Go organize some serious meetings, you middle-manager, you!

Love,
Greg
-------------- next part --------------

</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal>Good afternoon! It&#8217;s that time of year again: time to teach people how to send iCals to large mailing lists.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><br><b>Preface:</b> This email is meant to be informative and helpful. It is not meant to shame individuals who have not previously been taught this technique. The whole point of learning is that not everyone knows everything yet. <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>When you&#8217;re setting up a meeting with your team, sending an iCal is easy. You type the name of the other parties into the &#8220;Invite Attendees&#8221; field, and everyone is happy.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>When you&#8217;re sending an event to a large mailing list such as Carpe, your first thought is probably, &#8220;I should do it the same way. It&#8217;s still an iCal.&#8221; Unfortunately, this will make the event appear on <i>everyone&#8217;s</i> calendar as &#8220;tentative&#8221; until they deal with it, AND it&#8217;ll bypass their email filters, sending it straight to their inbox rather than their Carpe folder (or whatever other folder may be appropriate). This results in sadness.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Instead, you want to attach the event as a .ics file. It&#8217;s really easy to do so! Here&#8217;s how.<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>1.<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span><![endif]>Create the iCal on your computer.<br><img width=376 height=227 id="Picture_x0020_1" src="cid:image013.jpg at 01CFDB23.94711150"><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>2.<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span><![endif]>File <span style='font-family:Wingdings'>?</span> Save As. Save your calendar item locally as a .ics file.<br><img width=434 height=262 id="Picture_x0020_2" src="cid:image014.jpg at 01CFDB23.94711150"> <img width=367 height=264 id="Picture_x0020_3" src="cid:image015.jpg at 01CFDB23.94711150"><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>3.<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span><![endif]>In the email you&#8217;re sending, attach the .ics file you just saved.<br><img width=422 height=240 id="Picture_x0020_5" src="cid:image016.jpg at 01CFDB23.94711150"><img width=407 height=244 id="Picture_x0020_6" src="cid:image017.jpg at 01CFDB23.94711150"><img width=461 height=263 id="Picture_x0020_7" src="cid:image018.jpg at 01CFDB23.94711150"><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>4.<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span><![endif]>Celebrate your well-organized event.<br><img width=116 height=276 id="Picture_x0020_8" src="cid:image019.jpg at 01CFDB23.94711150" alt="http://www.erinmurray.net/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/red_balloon.jpg"><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Congratulations! You&#8217;re now sending iCals like a pro. Go organize some serious meetings, you middle-manager, you!<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Love,<o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal>Greg<o:p></o:p></p></div></body></html>

From Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep 28 16:13:54 2014
From: Gregory.Edelston at students.olin.edu (Gregory Edelston)
Date: Sun, 28 Sep 2014 16:13:54 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] How To Send iCals
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A41EBDA2@EXVS01.olin.edu>
References: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A41EBDA2@EXVS01.olin.edu>
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A41EBE81@EXVS01.olin.edu>

New information abounds! Apparently this process is even easier than I thought. I received the following email:

"Create the event then instead of that save-as bullshit, click the drop down next to forward and do forward as iCal. Then it opens a new draft with the iCal attached and the event name as the subject."

Yowza! I even confirmed this for myself.

[cid:image001.jpg at 01CFDB36.FDDF9900]

It turns out even old dogs can learn new tricks. Who knew meetings could be so easy and fun?

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Gregory Edelston
Sent: Sunday, September 28, 2014 1:53 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] How To Send iCals

Good afternoon! It's that time of year again: time to teach people how to send iCals to large mailing lists.

Preface: This email is meant to be informative and helpful. It is not meant to shame individuals who have not previously been taught this technique. The whole point of learning is that not everyone knows everything yet.

When you're setting up a meeting with your team, sending an iCal is easy. You type the name of the other parties into the "Invite Attendees" field, and everyone is happy.

When you're sending an event to a large mailing list such as Carpe, your first thought is probably, "I should do it the same way. It's still an iCal." Unfortunately, this will make the event appear on everyone's calendar as "tentative" until they deal with it, AND it'll bypass their email filters, sending it straight to their inbox rather than their Carpe folder (or whatever other folder may be appropriate). This results in sadness.

Instead, you want to attach the event as a .ics file. It's really easy to do so! Here's how.


1.       Create the iCal on your computer.
[cid:image002.jpg at 01CFDB36.FDDF9900]

2.       File --> Save As. Save your calendar item locally as a .ics file.
[cid:image003.jpg at 01CFDB36.FDDF9900][cid:image004.jpg at 01CFDB36.FDDF9900]

3.       In the email you're sending, attach the .ics file you just saved.
[cid:image005.jpg at 01CFDB36.FDDF9900][cid:image006.jpg at 01CFDB36.FDDF9900][cid:image007.jpg at 01CFDB36.FDDF9900]

4.       Celebrate your well-organized event.
[cid:image008.jpg at 01CFDB36.FDDF9900]

Congratulations! You're now sending iCals like a pro. Go organize some serious meetings, you middle-manager, you!

Love,
Greg
-------------- next part --------------

</o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]--></head><body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple><div class=WordSection1><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'>New information abounds! Apparently this process is even easier than I thought. I received the following email:<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'>&#8220;</span>Create the event then instead of that save-as bullshit, click the drop down next to forward and do forward as iCal. Then it opens a new draft with the iCal attached and the event name as the subject.<span style='color:#1F497D'>&#8221;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='color:#1F497D'>Yowza! From Jamie.Gorson at students.olin.edu  Sun Sep 28 16:15:14 2014
From: Jamie.Gorson at students.olin.edu (Jamie Gorson)

Subject: [Carpediem] Rosh Hashana - Tashlich
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A41EBE86@EXVS01.olin.edu>

HAPPENING IN 15 Minutes! Come join! All are welcome

Join JOO Club to experience an essential part of Rosh Hashana, Tashlich. Tashlich involves casting bread into water as a metaphorical way to rid of sin. Come to learn about it, experience it, and enjoy some traditional snacks (apples, honey and maybe challah)! If you plan on coming let me know.

-------------- next part --------------

It's time already to audition for the FWOP Fall Family Weekend
One Act Festival!

this Wednesday at 8PM
in the Crescent Room

This year's One Act Festival will include:
Check Please
By Jonathan Rand
Directed by Celina Bekins '18

Cheesecake & Waffles
By Kai Austin
Directed by Kai Austin '15
Summary: Cari has a crush. When her friend's crack her to find out exactly who, they decide to send her off to an alleged relationship expert by the name of Sevan. The problem is, this is an anti-romantic comedy and Sevan could not care less.

<html xmlns:v="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:vml" xmlns:o="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" xmlns:w="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:word" xmlns:m="http://schemas.microsoft.com/office/2004/12/omml" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40"><head><meta http-equiv=Content-Type content="text/html; charset=us-ascii"><meta name=Generator content="Microsoft Word 14 (filtered medium)"><!--[if !mso]><style>v\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);}
o\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);}
w\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);}
.shape {behavior:url(#default#VML);}
</style><![endif]--><style><!--

	{font-family:"Cambria Math";

/* Style Definitions */

	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:11.0pt;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}

	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:blue;
	text-decoration:underline;}

The problem is, this is an anti-romantic comedy and Sevan could not care less.<o:p></o:p></span></i></p><p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;font-family:"Cambria","serif"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;font-family:"Cambria","serif"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p></div></body></html>

From Jacob.Riedel at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep 29 01:13:21 2014
From: Jacob.Riedel at students.olin.edu (Jacob Riedel)
Date: Mon, 29 Sep 2014 01:13:21 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Online LaTeX editor you may like
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A43F9987@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey First Years!

Now that you have learned how to use LaTex for your iSim class, you should probably know about the beautiful website that is ShareLaTex!  It's like Google docs...  but for LaTex!

It makes it easier to collaborate with class on group projects.

I added a link<https://www.sharelatex.com/?r=fcbde227&rm=e&rs=b> if you want to make an account.



Happy LaTexing!



Jacob Riedel

From Rebecca.Christianson at olin.edu  Mon Sep 29 09:29:22 2014
From: Rebecca.Christianson at olin.edu (Rebecca J. Christianson)
Date: Mon, 29 Sep 2014 09:29:22 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Jeremy Courtney speaking in Reading
Message-ID: <74EC63270F70E84EBE31C4588324B4760120292FA3F1@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hi All,


In case anyone is interested. Jeremy Courtney, who is the head of a coalition which  organizes heart surgeries for children in Iraq (http://www.jeremycourtney.com/) will be speaking in Reading, MA this Sunday, 10 AM, at the Unitarian Universalist Church. (http://uureading.org/news-and-calendar/newsletter ) The talk is free and open to the public.  It is a bit of a drive to get there, but he is supposed to be an awesome speaker who has given several TED talks on Islam-Christian relations.

Rebeca

From Logan.Davis at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep 29 14:10:52 2014
From: Logan.Davis at students.olin.edu (Logan Davis)
Date: Mon, 29 Sep 2014 14:10:52 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Happy Bill Warner Day!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A43F9C33@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey Carpe,

                It's that time of year again! Come celebrate everyone's favorite Olin-related holiday, Bill Warner Day, today at 8:00 PM in WH2L. There will be song, dance, poetry, speech, dramatic reenactment, and quite probably tears, all in honor of the greatest man you are ever likely to meet.

[cid:image002.jpg at 01CFDBEF.2D91A4A0]

Think of it as a study break. The most awesome study break of all time.

All hail,
-Logan

@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}

From Dakota.Nelson at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep 29 20:48:16 2014
From: Dakota.Nelson at students.olin.edu (Dakota Nelson)
Date: Mon, 29 Sep 2014 20:48:16 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] FW: Olin <-> Babson Relations
In-Reply-To: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A41EBCAA@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Happening in ten minutes! Hear an awesome startup talk about Babson-Olin relations!


From: Foundry [mailto:foundry-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Dakota Nelson
Sent: Sunday, September 28, 2014 10:39 AM
To: Foundry at lists.olin.edu<mailto:Foundry at lists.olin.edu>
Cc: Michael Ninh (Forwarding); lropergonzalez1 at babson.edu<mailto:lropergonzalez1 at babson.edu>; Gee, Christina; Jianhan Wang (Forwarding)
Subject: [Foundry] Olin <-> Babson Relations

Hey everyone!

Monday night, at 9:00 in AC113 (iCal attached), the team from Indico Data Solutions<http://indico.io/> will be here talking about the state of Babson-Olin relations. Two of the Foundry's board members are on LOA with Indico, along with the head of Babson's equivalent organization, E-tower. As a very successful Babson-Olin startup, they have a unique perspective both on where relations currently stand and where they could go in the future.

Join us! I'll be awesome!


Dakota on behalf of the Foundry

Dakota Nelson | Class of 2017
Tel: 605-877-4076 | URL: www.dakotanelson.com<http://www.dakotanelson.com/>
[cid:image001.png at 01CFDB0B.38DCA060]

From Shane.Skikne at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep 29 23:05:56 2014
From: Shane.Skikne at students.olin.edu (Shane Skikne)
Date: Mon, 29 Sep 2014 23:05:56 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Spoken Word Poetry Wednesday
Message-ID: <F359A97B-E544-4BC4-AB27-11AADC583C42@students.olin.edu>

Hello!
Every few weeks, some brave Oliners venture out of the bubble to hear of a thing called art. This art is otherwise known as spoken word poetry. Just like poetry in high school english class?! No, more like this<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h5yg0u1MkDI>  Or this<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JQgz2AhHaQg>.
There will be some open mic time, an awesome, funny feature poet and a short competition. If you?d like to join, we?ll be heading out of Olin around 6pm to get to Cambridge by 7 for the 8pm show. Just put your name in this spreadshee<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1px4xlYK16KKWbW_g_bvjpOxVHugdvM6ARJAr1sgkByI/edit?usp=sharing>t or email me telling me you?d want to come next time.  As you can see we need another driver, but still sign up and we?ll try find one.
Shane
-------------- next part --------------
<html><head><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html charset=windows-1252"></head><body style="word-wrap: break-word; -webkit-nbsp-mode: space; -webkit-line-break: after-white-space;">Hello!<div>Every few weeks, some brave Oliners venture out of the bubble to hear of a thing called art. This art is otherwise known as spoken word poetry. Just like poetry in high school english class?! No, more like&nbsp;<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h5yg0u1MkDI">this</a>&nbsp; Or&nbsp;<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JQgz2AhHaQg">this</a>.&nbsp;</div><div>There will be some open mic time, an awesome, funny feature poet and a short competition. If you?d like to join, we?ll be heading out of Olin around 6pm to get to Cambridge by 7 for the 8pm show. Just put your name in this&nbsp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1px4xlYK16KKWbW_g_bvjpOxVHugdvM6ARJAr1sgkByI/edit?usp=sharing">spreadshee</a>t or email me telling me you?d want to come next time.&nbsp;&nbsp;As you can see we need another driver, but still sign up and we?ll try find one.&nbsp;</div><div>Shane</div></body></html>

From Paige.Cote at students.olin.edu  Mon Sep 29 23:32:16 2014
From: Paige.Cote at students.olin.edu (Paige Cote)
Date: Mon, 29 Sep 2014 23:32:16 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Adven-Cheese Club Presents. . .
Message-ID: <F71C51FC-2578-421F-ACC3-4B7234445BD6@students.olin.edu>

The Chocolate and Cheese study break! That?s right, we are rounding up an outstanding (and adventurous) selection of two of the best food groups in the whole wide world for your eating pleasure.

Shane and I were having a difficult week and this is clearly the best solution.

Let our pain be your gain, and join us tomorrow night at 10:30 in the EH1 lounge.

Yours in cheesy chocolatey goodness,
Shane and Paige

From William.Warner at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep 30 01:36:40 2014
From: William.Warner at students.olin.edu (William Warner)
Date: Tue, 30 Sep 2014 01:36:40 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Free Synergy Premium
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A43FA167@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Buzzwords aside, http://synergy-project.org/ is a really cool service that lets you use one mouse + keyboard across many computers (virtual seamless KVM switch), even running different operating systems.

I have eight (8) codes for free copies of the premium version, so if you're interested, let me know. I've had a good experience using it to bind a few laptops together as extended monitor space.

- Bill Warner
-------------- next part --------------

From James.Wu at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep 30 03:43:09 2014
From: James.Wu at students.olin.edu (James Wu)
Date: Tue, 30 Sep 2014 03:43:09 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Part time job doing web development,
	or Arduino programming
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A43FA192@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Did you really enjoy Real World Measurements?
Do you know how to write firmware for the Arduino?
Have you any experience with MySQL and Amazon AWS?
Do you know how write front-end data visualization apps In Javascript?

If you answered yes to one or more, and you are interested in doing part time work this semester, then I have an opportunity for you. I was an intern at Energy Intelligence LLC this summer. The founder is looking for people to work on the prototype a couple of hours per week, ideally at a regular time, with monthly check-ins. Compensation can be negotiated, but it will be above Olin College wage.

Energy Intelligence is developing an energy harvesting system that turns the momentum of vehicles that are braking into energy. For more information visit http://www.energyintel.us/

It&#8217;s not that far away (<a href="http://goo.gl/maps/rr5Np">http://goo.gl/maps/rr5Np</a>), and they&#8217;ll be having a tournament using the demo version, with a $20 prize!<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Times","serif"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Times","serif"'>Email me if interested.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Times","serif"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Times","serif"'>Elizabeth<o:p></o:p></span></p></div></body></html>

From Thomas.Nattestad at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep 30 10:04:36 2014
From: Thomas.Nattestad at students.olin.edu (Thomas Nattestad)
Date: Tue, 30 Sep 2014 10:04:36 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Technical Interview Prep at SLAC this Wednesday
Message-ID: <D05030B4.4632%thomas.nattestad@students.olin.edu>

Tl;dr Come to SLAC on Wednesday if you want technical interview prep and get awesome jobs

Hello! Want a really amazing software job this summer? Come to slac this Wednesday for interview prep. We will teach you all the things you need to knock out a technical interview that Olin?s classes will never teach you. For those of you who don?t know yet, when you interview for a job, a technical interview will be a part of that and they will ask you all sorts of weird questions such as: write out a sorting algorithm and explain it, what is MVC, write a class for a binary tree and implement an example. You?ll need to be a pro at concepts like big O notation, size complexity, data structures, and famous algorithms to really nail the hardest of these interviews and get the sweetest jobs. Remember Career Fair is next week!

Subject: [Carpediem] REsolved: Free Synergy Premium
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A43FA323@EXVS01.olin.edu>

All claimed! $4.99 each for a lifetime membership for the rest of you if you're so inclined.

From: William Warner
Sent: Tuesday, September 30, 2014 1:37 AM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: Free Synergy Premium

Buzzwords aside, http://synergy-project.org/ is a really cool service that lets you use one mouse + keyboard across many computers (virtual seamless KVM switch), even running different operating systems.

I have eight (8) codes for free copies of the premium version, so if you're interested, let me know. I've had a good experience using it to bind a few laptops together as extended monitor space.

- Bill Warner

From Mitchell.Cieminski at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep 30 13:32:00 2014
From: Mitchell.Cieminski at students.olin.edu (Mitchell Cieminski)
Date: Tue, 30 Sep 2014 13:32:00 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Microsoft Predictions Lab
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A43FA334@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Microsoft's predictions lab successfully predicted EVERY SINGLE knockout game of the World Cup.

Now they're taking on Politics and all kinds of other stuff. And they're doing it by making it into a super fun game! Join our team and compete against us :)

Go to http://prediction.microsoft.com and paste this code: 

2a102f59-288f-4160-907e-a163b3d06245 

where it says Join a Team on the Settings page. 

Happy Predicting :)

mitch



From Ryan.Louie at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep 30 14:25:38 2014
From: Ryan.Louie at students.olin.edu (Ryan Louie)

Subject: [Carpediem] Boston Data Fest Eventbrite
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A43FA372@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Just got the invite to attend the Boston Data Fest.  Event is November 3rd (Monday) 6 - 9pm.  Sign up by October 20th for a discount.  I personally have had awesome interactions with the Boston Data Science scene, and would highly recommend to meet some folk in Boston who are interested in data.  Let me know if you sign up, as we might want to commute over together!

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/boston-data-festival-2014-kickoff-event-thomson-reuters-tickets-13323604259?ref=enivtefor001&invite=NjgyMjYwNy9yeWFuLmMubG91aWVAZ21haWwuY29tLzA%3D&utm_source=eb_email&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=inviteformal001&utm_term=eventpage


-          ryan louie

Let me know if you sign up, as we might want to commute over together!&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/boston-data-festival-2014-kickoff-event-thomson-reuters-tickets-13323604259?ref=enivtefor001&amp;invite=NjgyMjYwNy9yeWFuLmMubG91aWVAZ21haWwuY29tLzA%3D&amp;utm_source=eb_email&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_campaign=inviteformal001&amp;utm_term=eventpage">https://www.eventbrite.com/e/boston-data-festival-2014-kickoff-event-thomson-reuters-tickets-13323604259?ref=enivtefor001&amp;invite=NjgyMjYwNy9yeWFuLmMubG91aWVAZ21haWwuY29tLzA%3D&amp;utm_source=eb_email&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_campaign=inviteformal001&amp;utm_term=eventpage</a><o:p></o:p></p><p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p><p class=MsoListParagraph style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>-<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Hi, All,

I hope you are all enjoying this talk as I write this!!! If not, see whether you can join now!  This is a call to all of you pursuing GCSP, MUN and other programs attempting to solve problems that are larger than the Olin bubble!

Looking forward to hearing from many of you about this talk!

Zhenya


Yevgeniya V. Zastavker

From Cameron.Anderson at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep 30 20:41:15 2014
From: Cameron.Anderson at students.olin.edu (Cameron Anderson)
Date: Tue, 30 Sep 2014 20:41:15 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Be on the Technical Crew for Xanadu!
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A43FA597@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Have you ever wanted to Light up the world?
Do you love Messing with sound?
Has it always been you dream to Design the perfect eighties roller disco?

If you answered yes to any of these questions, or even if you didn't,  you might be  (Probably are)  the perfect fit for the Tech crew of this semester's FWOP production XANADU. It's a musical set in the eighties about this guy opening a roller disco while helped by a Greek muse. It's pretty sweet.

We are currently looking for people to fill the positions of Lighting Designer, Sound Board Operator, Assistant Stage Manager, and Set Designer.
Email me (Cameron Anderson) if you are interested, or want more information on any of the roles.


-------------- next part --------------

From Dakota.Nelson at students.olin.edu  Tue Sep 30 21:03:57 2014
From: Dakota.Nelson at students.olin.edu (Dakota Nelson)
Date: Tue, 30 Sep 2014 21:03:57 -0400
Subject: [Carpediem] Foundry Office Hours
Message-ID: <DA80C3E6C10BE94E8FCACEB239C2FEE40159A43FA5B9@EXVS01.olin.edu>

Hey everyone!

A few Foundry members will be holding office hours in the Foundry space, CC300, at 5:00 on Friday until the Foundry meeting at 6:00.

Come by if you...

*         Want resume tips!

*         Want to know more about the startup fair!

*         Want to know what the startup scene in Boston is like!

*         Want a job! With a startup! (Or not a startup.)

*         Want to talk about entrepreneurship and starting a company!

*         Are curious about the Foundry!

*         Are awesome!

It'll be great. Also, if you have a suggestion for a less boring name than "office hours," come on by and tell us.

See you all at 5:00 on Friday!


Dakota on behalf of the Foundry

Dakota Nelson | Class of 2017
Tel: 605-877-4076 | URL: www.dakotanelson.com<http://www.dakotanelson.com/>

	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:11.0pt;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
a:link, span.MsoHyperlink
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:blue;
	text-decoration:underline;}
a:visited, span.MsoHyperlinkFollowed
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	color:purple;
	text-decoration:underline;}
p.MsoAcetate, li.MsoAcetate, div.MsoAcetate
	{mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text Char";
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:8.0pt;
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
p.MsoListParagraph, li.MsoListParagraph, div.MsoListParagraph
	{mso-style-priority:34;
	margin-top:0in;
	margin-right:0in;
	margin-bottom:0in;
	margin-left:.5in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:11.0pt;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
span.EmailStyle17
	{mso-style-type:personal-compose;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";
	color:windowtext;}
span.BalloonTextChar
	{mso-style-name:"Balloon Text Char";
	mso-style-priority:99;
	mso-style-link:"Balloon Text";
	font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";}
.MsoChpDefault
	{mso-style-type:export-only;
	font-family:"Calibri","sans-serif";}
@page WordSection1
	{size:8.5in 11.0in;
	margin:1.0in 1.0in 1.0in 1.0in;}
div.WordSection1
	{page:WordSection1;}

From: Carpediem [mailto:carpediem-bounces at lists.olin.edu] On Behalf Of Paige Cote
Sent: Monday, September 29, 2014 11:32 PM
To: carpediem at lists.olin.edu
Subject: [Carpediem] Adven-Cheese Club Presents. . .

The Chocolate and Cheese study break! That's right, we are rounding up an outstanding (and adventurous) selection of two of the best food groups in the whole wide world for your eating pleasure.

Shane and I were having a difficult week and this is clearly the best solution.

Let our pain be your gain, and join us tomorrow night at 10:30 in the EH1 lounge.

Yours in cheesy chocolatey goodness,
Shane and Paige
